element.name: note
element.definition: Comments made about the event by the performer, subject or other participants.

element.name: supportingInformation
element.definition: Further information supporting this charge.

element.name: function
element.description: What type of performance was done
element.definition: Describes the type of performance or participation(e.g. primary surgeon, anesthesiologiest, etc.).

binding.name: ChargeItemPerformerFunction
binding.description: Codes describing the types of functional roles performers can take on when performing events.

element.name: actor
element.definition: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed or participated in the service.

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this charge item definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this charge item definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this charge item definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the charge item definition is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Additional identifier for the charge item definition
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this charge item definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this charge item definition outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the charge item definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the charge item definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the charge item definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active assets.
element.comment: There may be different charge item definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the charge item definition with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: title
element.description: Name for this charge item definition (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the charge item definition.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

element.name: derivedFromUri
element.definition: The URL pointing to an externally-defined charge item definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this definition.

element.name: partOf
element.description: A larger definition of which this particular definition is a component or step
element.definition: A larger definition of which this particular definition is a component or step.

element.name: replaces
element.description: Completed or terminated request(s) whose function is taken by this new request
element.definition: As new versions of a protocol or guideline are defined, allows identification of what versions are replaced by a new instance.

element.name: status
element.definition: The current state of the ChargeItemDefinition.
element.comment: Allows filtering of charge item definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: experimental
element.description: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this charge item definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of charge item definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the charge item definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the charge item definition changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the charge item definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the charge item definition.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the charge item definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the charge item definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the charge item definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the charge item definition
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the charge item definition from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the charge item definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the charge item definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the charge item definition is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the charge item definition was created).

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate charge item definition instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for charge item definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the charge item definition is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the charge item definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the charge item definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the charge item definition.

element.name: approvalDate
element.description: When the charge item definition was approved by publisher
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.
element.comment: The 'date' element may be more recent than the approval date because of minor changes or editorial corrections.

element.name: lastReviewDate
element.description: When the charge item definition was last reviewed
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.
element.comment: If specified, this date follows the original approval date.

element.name: effectivePeriod
element.description: When the charge item definition is expected to be used
element.definition: The period during which the charge item definition content was or is planned to be in active use.
element.comment: The effective period for a charge item definition determines when the content is applicable for usage and is independent of publication and review dates. For example, a measure intended to be used for the year 2016 might be published in 2015.

element.name: code
element.description: Billing codes or product types this definition applies to
element.definition: The defined billing details in this resource pertain to the given billing code.

binding.name: ChargeItemDefinitionCode
binding.description: Billing Code defined by this ChargeItemDefinition.

element.name: instance
element.definition: The defined billing details in this resource pertain to the given product instance(s).
element.comment: In case of highly customized, individually produced or fitted devices/substances, the pricing information may be different for each instance of the product. This reference links pricing details to specific product instances.

element.name: applicability
element.description: Whether or not the billing code is applicable
element.definition: Expressions that describe applicability criteria for the billing code.
element.comment: The applicability conditions can be used to ascertain whether a billing item is allowed in a specific context. E.g. some billing codes may only be applicable in out-patient settings, only to male/female patients or only to children.

element.name: propertyGroup
element.description: Group of properties which are applicable under the same conditions
element.definition: Group of properties which are applicable under the same conditions. If no applicability rules are established for the group, then all properties always apply.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the condition
element.definition: A brief, natural language description of the condition that effectively communicates the intended semantics.

element.name: language
element.definition: The media type of the language for the expression, e.g. "text/cql" for Clinical Query Language expressions or "text/fhirpath" for FHIRPath expressions.

element.name: expression
element.definition: An expression that returns true or false, indicating whether the condition is satisfied. When using FHIRPath expressions, the %context environment variable must be replaced at runtime with the ChargeItem resource to which this definition is applied.
element.comment: Please note that FHIRPath Expressions can only be evaluated in the scope of the current ChargeItem resource to which this definition is being applied. FHIRPath expressions can traverse into other resources linked from the ChargeItem resource, however, testing rules such as that a billing code may be billed only once per encounter need a wider scope. In such scenarios, CQL may be the appropriate choice.

element.name: applicability
element.description: Conditions under which the priceComponent is applicable
element.definition: Expressions that describe applicability criteria for the priceComponent.
element.comment: The applicability conditions can be used to ascertain whether a billing item is allowed in a specific context. E.g. some billing codes may only be applicable in out-patient settings, only to male/female patients or only to children.

element.name: priceComponent
element.description: Components of total line item price
element.definition: The price for a ChargeItem may be calculated as a base price with surcharges/deductions that apply in certain conditions. A ChargeItemDefinition resource that defines the prices, factors and conditions that apply to a billing code is currently under development. The priceComponent element can be used to offer transparency to the recipient of the Invoice of how the prices have been calculated.

element.name: type
element.description: base | surcharge | deduction | discount | tax | informational
element.definition: This code identifies the type of the component.

binding.name: ChargeItemDefinitionPriceComponentType
binding.description: Codes indicating the kind of the price component.

element.name: code
element.definition: A code that identifies the component. Codes may be used to differentiate between kinds of taxes, surcharges, discounts etc.

element.name: factor
element.description: Factor used for calculating this component
element.definition: The factor that has been applied on the base price for calculating this component.

element.name: amount
element.description: Monetary amount associated with this component
element.definition: The amount calculated for this component.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this claim.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the resource instance.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: ClaimStatus
binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

element.name: type
element.definition: The category of claim, e.g. oral, pharmacy, vision, institutional, professional.
element.comment: The majority of jurisdictions use: oral, pharmacy, vision, professional and institutional, or variants on those terms, as the general styles of claims. The valueset is extensible to accommodate other jurisdictional requirements.

binding.name: ClaimType
binding.description: The type or discipline-style of the claim.

element.name: subType
element.definition: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.
element.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes, for example the US UB-04 bill type code or the CMS bill type.

binding.name: ClaimSubType
binding.description: A more granular claim typecode.

element.name: use
element.definition: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: to request adjudication of products and services previously rendered; or requesting authorization and adjudication for provision in the future; or requesting the non-binding adjudication of the listed products and services which could be provided in the future.

binding.name: Use
binding.description: The purpose of the Claim: predetermination, preauthorization, claim.

element.name: patient
element.description: The recipient of the products and services
element.definition: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual or forecast reimbursement is sought.

element.name: billablePeriod
element.description: Relevant time frame for the claim
element.definition: The period for which charges are being submitted.
element.comment: Typically this would be today or in the past for a claim, and today or in the future for preauthorizations and predeterminations. Typically line item dates of service should fall within the billing period if one is specified.

element.name: created
element.definition: The date this resource was created.
element.comment: This field is independent of the date of creation of the resource as it may reflect the creation date of a source document prior to digitization. Typically for claims all services must be completed as of this date.

element.name: enterer
element.definition: Individual who created the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

element.name: insurer
element.definition: The Insurer who is target of the request.

element.name: provider
element.definition: The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.
element.comment: Typically this field would be 1..1 where this party is responsible for the claim but not necessarily professionally responsible for the provision of the individual products and services listed below.

element.name: priority
element.definition: The provider-required urgency of processing the request. Typical values include: stat, routine deferred.
element.comment: If a claim processor is unable to complete the processing as per the priority then they should generate and error and not process the request.

binding.name: ProcessPriority
binding.description: The timeliness with which processing is required: stat, normal, deferred.

element.name: fundsReserve
element.definition: A code to indicate whether and for whom funds are to be reserved for future claims.
element.comment: This field is only used for preauthorizations.

binding.name: FundsReserve
binding.description: For whom funds are to be reserved: (Patient, Provider, None).

element.name: related
element.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior submissions or claims for related services or for the same event.
element.comment: For example, for the original treatment and follow-up exams.

element.name: prescription
element.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.

element.name: originalPrescription
element.description: Original prescription if superseded by fulfiller
element.definition: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.
element.comment: For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefore issues a new prescription for an alternate medication which has the same therapeutic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.

element.name: payee
element.definition: The party to be reimbursed for cost of the products and services according to the terms of the policy.
element.comment: Often providers agree to receive the benefits payable to reduce the near-term costs to the patient. The insurer may decline to pay the provider and choose to pay the subscriber instead.

element.name: referral
element.definition: A reference to a referral resource.
element.comment: The referral resource which lists the date, practitioner, reason and other supporting information.

element.name: facility
element.definition: Facility where the services were provided.

element.name: careTeam
element.definition: The members of the team who provided the products and services.

element.name: supportingInfo
element.definition: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.
element.comment: Often there are multiple jurisdiction specific valuesets which are required.

element.name: diagnosis
element.definition: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.

element.name: procedure
element.definition: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.

element.name: insurance
element.definition: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.
element.comment: All insurance coverages for the patient which may be applicable for reimbursement, of the products and services listed in the claim, are typically provided in the claim to allow insurers to confirm the ordering of the insurance coverages relative to local 'coordination of benefit' rules. One coverage (and only one) with 'focal=true' is to be used in the adjudication of this claim. Coverages appearing before the focal Coverage in the list, and where 'Coverage.subrogation=false', should provide a reference to the ClaimResponse containing the adjudication results of the prior claim.

element.name: accident
element.definition: Details of an accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.

element.name: item
element.definition: A claim line. Either a simple product or service or a 'group' of details which can each be a simple items or groups of sub-details.

element.name: total
element.definition: The total value of the all the items in the claim.

element.name: date
element.definition: Date of an accident event related to the products and services contained in the claim.
element.comment: The date of the accident has to precede the dates of the products and services but within a reasonable timeframe.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type or context of the accident event for the purposes of selection of potential insurance coverages and determination of coordination between insurers.

binding.name: AccidentType
binding.description: Type of accident: work place, auto, etc.

element.name: location
element.definition: The physical location of the accident event.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify care team entries.

element.name: provider
element.definition: Member of the team who provided the product or service.

element.name: responsible
element.definition: The party who is billing and/or responsible for the claimed products or services.
element.comment: Responsible might not be required when there is only a single provider listed.

element.name: role
element.definition: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisciplinary team.
element.comment: Role might not be required when there is only a single provider listed.

binding.name: CareTeamRole
binding.description: The role codes for the care team members.

element.name: qualification
element.definition: The qualification of the practitioner which is applicable for this service.

binding.name: ProviderQualification
binding.description: Provider professional qualifications.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.
element.comment: Diagnosis are presented in list order to their expected importance: primary, secondary, etc.

element.name: diagnosis
element.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

binding.name: ICD10
binding.description: Example ICD10 Diagnostic codes.

element.name: type
element.description: Timing or nature of the diagnosis
element.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.
element.comment: For example: admitting, primary, secondary, discharge.

binding.name: DiagnosisType
binding.description: The type of the diagnosis: admitting, principal, discharge.

element.name: onAdmission
element.definition: Indication of whether the diagnosis was present on admission to a facility.

binding.name: DiagnosisOnAdmission
binding.description: Present on admission.

element.name: packageCode
element.definition: A package billing code or bundle code used to group products and services to a particular health condition (such as heart attack) which is based on a predetermined grouping code system.
element.comment: For example DRG (Diagnosis Related Group) or a bundled billing code. A patient may have a diagnosis of a Myocardial Infarction and a DRG for HeartAttack would be assigned. The Claim item (and possible subsequent claims) would refer to the DRG for those line items that were for services related to the heart attack event.

binding.name: DiagnosisRelatedGroup
binding.description: The DRG codes associated with the diagnosis.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify insurance entries and provide a sequence of coverages to convey coordination of benefit order.

element.name: focal
element.description: Coverage to be used for adjudication
element.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.
element.comment: A patient may (will) have multiple insurance policies which provide reimbursement for healthcare services and products. For example a person may also be covered by their spouse's policy and both appear in the list (and may be from the same insurer). This flag will be set to true for only one of the listed policies and that policy will be used for adjudicating this claim. Other claims would be created to request adjudication against the other listed policies.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: The business identifier to be used when the claim is sent for adjudication against this insurance policy.
element.comment: Only required in jurisdictions where insurers, rather than the provider, are required to send claims to insurers that appear after them in the list. This element is not required when 'subrogation=true'.

element.name: coverage
element.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

element.name: businessArrangement
element.definition: A business agreement number established between the provider and the insurer for special business processing purposes.

element.name: preAuthRef
element.definition: Reference numbers previously provided by the insurer to the provider to be quoted on subsequent claims containing services or products related to the prior authorization.
element.comment: This value is an alphanumeric string that may be provided over the phone, via text, via paper, or within a ClaimResponse resource and is not a FHIR Identifier.

element.name: claimResponse
element.definition: The result of the adjudication of the line items for the Coverage specified in this insurance.
element.comment: Must not be specified when 'focal=true' for this insurance.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify item entries.

element.name: careTeamSequence
element.definition: CareTeam members related to this service or product.

element.name: diagnosisSequence
element.definition: Diagnosis applicable for this service or product.

element.name: procedureSequence
element.definition: Procedures applicable for this service or product.

element.name: informationSequence
element.definition: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information applicable for this service or product.

element.name: revenue
element.definition: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

binding.name: RevenueCenter
binding.description: Codes for the revenue or cost centers supplying the service and/or products.

element.name: category
element.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
element.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.

binding.name: BenefitCategory
binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral-basic, major, glasses.

element.name: productOrService
element.description: Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

binding.name: ServiceProduct
binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.name: modifier
element.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: For example in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or outside of office hours.

binding.name: Modifiers
binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.name: programCode
element.description: Program the product or service is provided under
element.definition: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.
element.comment: For example: Neonatal program, child dental program or drug users recovery program.

binding.name: ProgramCode
binding.description: Program specific reason codes.

element.name: serviced
element.description: Date or dates of service or product delivery
element.definition: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

element.name: location
element.description: Place of service or where product was supplied
element.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

binding.name: ServicePlace
binding.description: Place of service: pharmacy, school, prison, etc.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

element.name: unitPrice
element.description: Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

element.name: factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

element.name: net
element.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
element.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

element.name: udi
element.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

element.name: bodySite
element.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).
element.comment: For example: Providing a tooth code, allows an insurer to identify a provider performing a filling on a tooth that was previously removed.

binding.name: OralSites
binding.description: The code for the teeth, quadrant, sextant and arch.

element.name: subSite
element.definition: A region or surface of the bodySite, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).

binding.name: Surface
binding.description: The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

element.name: encounter
element.description: Encounters related to this billed item
element.definition: The Encounters during which this Claim was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter.

element.name: detail
element.definition: A claim detail line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of sub-details which are simple items.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify item entries.

element.name: revenue
element.definition: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

binding.name: RevenueCenter
binding.description: Codes for the revenue or cost centers supplying the service and/or products.

element.name: category
element.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
element.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.

binding.name: BenefitCategory
binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral-basic, major, glasses.

element.name: sequence

element.name: revenue
element.definition: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

element.name: udi
element.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

element.name: type
element.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: subscriber, provider, other.

binding.name: PayeeType
binding.description: A code for the party to be reimbursed.

element.name: party
element.definition: Reference to the individual or organization to whom any payment will be made.
element.comment: Not required if the payee is 'subscriber' or 'provider'.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify procedure entries.

element.name: type
element.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.
element.comment: For example: primary, secondary.

binding.name: ProcedureType
binding.description: Example procedure type codes.

element.name: date
element.definition: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed.

element.name: procedure
element.definition: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

binding.name: ICD10_Procedures
binding.description: Example ICD10 Procedure codes.

element.name: udi
element.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

element.name: claim
element.definition: Reference to a related claim.

element.name: relationship
element.description: How the reference claim is related
element.definition: A code to convey how the claims are related.
element.comment: For example, prior claim or umbrella.

binding.name: RelatedClaimRelationship
binding.description: Relationship of this claim to a related Claim.

element.name: reference
element.definition: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains.
element.comment: For example, Property/Casualty insurer claim # or Workers Compensation case # .

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.

element.name: category
element.definition: The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.
element.comment: This may contain a category for the local bill type codes.

binding.name: InformationCategory
binding.description: The valuset used for additional information category codes.

element.name: code
element.definition: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient for which care is sought.

binding.name: InformationCode
binding.description: The valuset used for additional information codes.

element.name: timing
element.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

element.name: value
element.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.
element.comment: Could be used to provide references to other resources, document. For example could contain a PDF in an Attachment of the Police Report for an Accident.

element.name: reason
element.definition: Provides the reason in the situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.
element.comment: For example: the reason for the additional stay, or why a tooth is missing.

binding.name: MissingReason
binding.description: Reason codes for the missing teeth.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business Identifier for a claim response
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this claim response.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the resource instance.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: ClaimResponseStatus
binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

element.name: type
element.definition: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.
element.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes, for example the US UB-04 bill type code or the CMS bill type.

binding.name: ClaimType
binding.description: The type or discipline-style of the claim.

element.name: subType
element.definition: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.
element.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes, for example the US UB-04 bill type code or the CMS bill type.

binding.name: ClaimSubType
binding.description: A more granular claim typecode.

element.name: use
element.definition: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: to request adjudication of products and services previously rendered; or requesting authorization and adjudication for provision in the future; or requesting the non-binding adjudication of the listed products and services which could be provided in the future.

binding.name: Use
binding.description: Claim, preauthorization, predetermination.

element.name: patient
element.description: The recipient of the products and services
element.definition: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual for facast reimbursement is sought.

element.name: created
element.definition: The date this resource was created.

element.name: insurer
element.definition: The party responsible for authorization, adjudication and reimbursement.

element.name: requestor
element.definition: The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.
element.comment: Typically this field would be 1..1 where this party is responsible for the claim but not necessarily professionally responsible for the provision of the individual products and services listed below.

element.name: request
element.definition: Original request resource reference.

element.name: outcome
element.definition: The outcome of the claim, predetermination, or preauthorization processing.
element.comment: The resource may be used to indicate that: the request has been held (queued) for processing; that it has been processed and errors found (error); that no errors were found and that some of the adjudication has been undertaken (partial) or that all of the adjudication has been undertaken (complete).

binding.name: RemittanceOutcome
binding.description: The result of the claim processing.

element.name: disposition
element.definition: A human readable description of the status of the adjudication.

element.name: preAuthRef
element.definition: Reference from the Insurer which is used in later communications which refers to this adjudication.
element.comment: This value is only present on preauthorization adjudications.

element.name: preAuthPeriod
element.definition: The time frame during which this authorization is effective.

element.name: payeeType
element.description: Party to be paid any benefits payable
element.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: subscriber, provider, other.

binding.name: PayeeType
binding.description: A code for the party to be reimbursed.

element.name: item
element.definition: A claim line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of details which can also be a simple items or groups of sub-details.

element.name: addItem
element.definition: The first-tier service adjudications for payor added product or service lines.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results which are presented at the header level rather than at the line-item or add-item levels.

element.name: total
element.definition: Categorized monetary totals for the adjudication.
element.comment: Totals for amounts submitted, co-pays, benefits payable etc.

element.name: payment
element.definition: Payment details for the adjudication of the claim.

element.name: fundsReserve
element.definition: A code, used only on a response to a preauthorization, to indicate whether the benefits payable have been reserved and for whom.
element.comment: Fund would be release by a future claim quoting the preAuthRef of this response. Examples of values include: provider, patient, none.

binding.name: FundsReserve
binding.description: For whom funds are to be reserved: (Patient, Provider, None).

element.name: formCode
element.definition: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.
element.comment: May be needed to identify specific jurisdictional forms.

binding.name: Forms
binding.description: The forms codes.

element.name: form
element.definition: The actual form, by reference or inclusion, for printing the content or an EOB.
element.comment: Needed to permit insurers to include the actual form.

element.name: processNote
element.definition: A note that describes or explains adjudication results in a human readable form.

element.name: communicationRequest
element.definition: Request for additional supporting or authorizing information.
element.comment: For example: professional reports, documents, images, clinical resources, or accident reports.

element.name: insurance
element.definition: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.
element.comment: All insurance coverages for the patient which may be applicable for reimbursement, of the products and services listed in the claim, are typically provided in the claim to allow insurers to confirm the ordering of the insurance coverages relative to local 'coordination of benefit' rules. One coverage (and only one) with 'focal=true' is to be used in the adjudication of this claim. Coverages appearing before the focal Coverage in the list, and where 'subrogation=false', should provide a reference to the ClaimResponse containing the adjudication results of the prior claim.

element.name: error
element.definition: Errors encountered during the processing of the adjudication.
element.comment: If the request contains errors then an error element should be provided and no adjudication related sections (item, addItem, or payment) should be present.

element.name: itemSequence
element.definition: Claim items which this service line is intended to replace.

element.name: detailSequence
element.definition: The sequence number of the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.

element.name: subdetailSequence
element.definition: The sequence number of the sub-details within the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.

element.name: provider
element.definition: The providers who are authorized for the services rendered to the patient.

element.name: productOrService
element.description: Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: For example in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or outside of office hours.

binding.name: Modifiers
binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.name: programCode
element.description: Program the product or service is provided under
element.definition: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.
element.comment: For example: Neonatal program, child dental program or drug users recovery program.

binding.name: ProgramCode
binding.description: Program specific reason codes.

element.name: serviced
element.description: Date or dates of service or product delivery
element.definition: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

element.name: location
element.description: Place of service or where product was supplied
element.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

binding.name: ServicePlace
binding.description: Place of service: pharmacy, school, prison, etc.

element.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

element.name: unitPrice
element.description: Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

element.name: net
element.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
element.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

element.name: bodySite
element.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).
element.comment: For example: Providing a tooth code allows an insurer to identify a provider performing a filling on a tooth that was previously removed.

binding.name: OralSites
binding.description: The code for the teeth, quadrant, sextant and arch.

element.name: subSite
element.definition: A region or surface of the bodySite, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).

binding.name: Surface
binding.description: The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

element.name: noteNumber
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results.

element.name: detail
element.definition: The second-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

element.name: itemSequence
element.definition: The sequence number of the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error occurs outside of the item structure.

element.name: detailSequence
element.definition: The sequence number of the detail within the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error occurs outside of the item structure.

element.name: subDetailSequence
element.definition: The sequence number of the sub-detail within the detail within the line item submitted which contains the error. This value is omitted when the error occurs outside of the item structure.

element.name: code
element.definition: An error code, from a specified code system, which details why the claim could not be adjudicated.

binding.name: AdjudicationError
binding.description: The adjudication error codes.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify insurance entries and provide a sequence of coverages to convey coordination of benefit order.

element.name: focal
element.description: Coverage to be used for adjudication
element.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.
element.comment: A patient may (will) have multiple insurance policies which provide reimbursement for healthcare services and products. For example a person may also be covered by their spouse's policy and both appear in the list (and may be from the same insurer). This flag will be set to true for only one of the listed policies and that policy will be used for adjudicating this claim. Other claims would be created to request adjudication against the other listed policies.

element.name: coverage
element.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

element.name: businessArrangement
element.definition: A business agreement number established between the provider and the insurer for special business processing purposes.

element.name: claimResponse
element.definition: The result of the adjudication of the line items for the Coverage specified in this insurance.
element.comment: Must not be specified when 'focal=true' for this insurance.

element.name: itemSequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely reference the claim item entries.

element.name: noteNumber
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: If this item is a group then the values here are a summary of the adjudication of the detail items. If this item is a simple product or service then this is the result of the adjudication of this item.

element.name: detail
element.definition: A claim detail. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of sub-details which are simple items.

element.name: category
element.definition: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that: the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item; amounts paid by other coverages; and, the benefit payable for this item.
element.comment: For example codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.

binding.name: Adjudication
binding.description: The adjudication codes.

element.name: reason
element.definition: A code supporting the understanding of the adjudication result and explaining variance from expected amount.
element.comment: For example may indicate that the funds for this benefit type have been exhausted.

binding.name: AdjudicationReason
binding.description: The adjudication reason codes.

element.name: amount
element.definition: Monetary amount associated with the category.
element.comment: For example: amount submitted, eligible amount, co-payment, and benefit payable.

element.name: value
element.definition: A non-monetary value associated with the category. Mutually exclusive to the amount element above.
element.comment: For example: eligible percentage or co-payment percentage.

element.name: detailSequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely reference the claim detail entry.

element.name: noteNumber
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results.

element.name: subDetail
element.definition: A sub-detail adjudication of a simple product or service.

element.name: subDetailSequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely reference the claim sub-detail entry.

element.name: noteNumber
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results.

element.name: type
element.definition: Whether this represents partial or complete payment of the benefits payable.

binding.name: PaymentType
binding.description: The type (partial, complete) of the payment.

element.name: adjustment
element.definition: Total amount of all adjustments to this payment included in this transaction which are not related to this claim's adjudication.
element.comment: Insurers will deduct amounts owing from the provider (adjustment), such as a prior overpayment, from the amount owing to the provider (benefits payable) when payment is made to the provider.

element.name: adjustmentReason
element.definition: Reason for the payment adjustment.

binding.name: PaymentAdjustmentReason
binding.description: Payment Adjustment reason codes.

element.name: date
element.definition: Estimated date the payment will be issued or the actual issue date of payment.

element.name: amount
element.definition: Benefits payable less any payment adjustment.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Issuer's unique identifier for the payment instrument.
element.comment: For example: EFT number or check number.

element.name: number
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify a note entry.

element.name: type
element.definition: The business purpose of the note text.

binding.name: NoteType
binding.description: The presentation types of notes.

element.name: text
element.definition: The explanation or description associated with the processing.

element.name: language
element.definition: A code to define the language used in the text of the note.
element.comment: Only required if the language is different from the resource language.

binding.name: Language
binding.description: A human language.

element.name: category
element.definition: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.
element.comment: For example codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.

binding.name: Adjudication
binding.description: The adjudication codes.

element.name: amount
element.definition: Monetary total amount associated with the category.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this clinical impression by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

element.name: status
element.definition: Identifies the workflow status of the assessment.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code entered-in-error that marks the clinical impression as not currently valid.

binding.name: ClinicalImpressionStatus
binding.description: The workflow state of a clinical impression.

element.name: statusReason
element.definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the ClinicalImpression.
element.comment:
This is generally only used for "exception" statuses such as "not-done", "suspended" or "cancelled".
[distinct reason codes for different statuses can be enforced using invariants if they are universal bindings].

binding.name: ClinicalImpressionStatusReason
binding.description: Codes identifying the reason for the current state of a clinical impression.

element.name: code
element.definition: Categorizes the type of clinical assessment performed.
element.comment: This is present as a place-holder only and may be removed based on feedback/work group opinion.

binding.name: ClinicalImpressionCode
binding.description: Identifies categories of clinical impressions. This is a place-holder only. It may be removed.

element.name: description
element.definition: A summary of the context and/or cause of the assessment - why / where it was performed, and what patient events/status prompted it.

element.name: subject
element.definition: The patient or group of individuals assessed as part of this record.

element.name: encounter
element.definition: The Encounter during which this ClinicalImpression was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter.

element.name: effective
element.definition: The point in time or period over which the subject was assessed.
element.comment: This SHOULD be accurate to at least the minute, though some assessments only have a known date.

element.name: date
element.definition: Indicates when the documentation of the assessment was complete.

element.name: assessor
element.definition: The clinician performing the assessment.

element.name: previous
element.definition: A reference to the last assessment that was conducted on this patient. Assessments are often/usually ongoing in nature; a care provider (practitioner or team) will make new assessments on an ongoing basis as new data arises or the patient's conditions changes.
element.comment: It is always likely that multiple previous assessments exist for a patient. The point of quoting a previous assessment is that this assessment is relative to it (see resolved).

element.name: problem
element.definition: A list of the relevant problems/conditions for a patient.
element.comment: e.g. The patient is a pregnant, has congestive heart failure, has an Adenocarcinoma, and is allergic to penicillin.

element.name: investigation
element.description: One or more sets of investigations (signs, symptoms, etc.)
element.definition: One or more sets of investigations (signs, symptoms, etc.). The actual grouping of investigations varies greatly depending on the type and context of the assessment. These investigations may include data generated during the assessment process, or data previously generated and recorded that is pertinent to the outcomes.

element.name: protocol
element.definition: Reference to a specific published clinical protocol that was followed during this assessment, and/or that provides evidence in support of the diagnosis.

element.name: summary
element.definition: A text summary of the investigations and the diagnosis.

element.name: finding
element.description: Possible or likely findings and diagnoses
element.definition: Specific findings or diagnoses that were considered likely or relevant to ongoing treatment.

element.name: prognosisCodeableConcept
element.definition: Estimate of likely outcome.

binding.name: ClinicalImpressionPrognosis
binding.description: Prognosis or outlook findings.

element.name: prognosisReference
element.definition: RiskAssessment expressing likely outcome.

element.name: supportingInfo
element.definition: Information supporting the clinical impression.

element.name: note
element.definition: Commentary about the impression, typically recorded after the impression itself was made, though supplemental notes by the original author could also appear.
element.comment: Don't use this element for content that should more properly appear as one of the specific elements of the impression.

element.name: itemCodeableConcept
element.definition: Specific text or code for finding or diagnosis, which may include ruled-out or resolved conditions.

binding.name: ConditionKind
binding.description: Identification of the Condition or diagnosis.

element.name: itemReference
element.definition: Specific reference for finding or diagnosis, which may include ruled-out or resolved conditions.

element.name: basis
element.definition: Which investigations support finding or diagnosis.

element.name: code
element.definition: A name/code for the group ("set") of investigations. Typically, this will be something like "signs", "symptoms", "clinical", "diagnostic", but the list is not constrained, and others such groups such as (exposure|family|travel|nutritional) history may be used.

binding.name: InvestigationGroupType
binding.description: A name/code for a set of investigations.

element.name: item
element.definition: A record of a specific investigation that was undertaken.
element.comment: Most investigations are observations of one kind or another but some other specific types of data collection resources can also be used.

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this code system, represented as a URI (globally unique) (Coding.system)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this code system is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the code system is stored on different servers. This is used in [Coding](datatypes.html#Coding).system.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Additional identifier for the code system (business identifier)
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this code system when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this code system outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI. Note that HL7 defines at least three identifiers for many of its code systems - the FHIR canonical URL, the OID and the V2 Table 0396 mnemonic code.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the code system (Coding.version)
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the code system when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the code system author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. This is used in [Coding](datatypes.html#Coding).version.
element.comment: There may be different code system instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the code system with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this code system (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the code system. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

element.name: title
element.description: Name for this code system (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the code system.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

element.name: status
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the code system resource was created or revised.
element.comment: Allows filtering of code systems that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: experimental
element.description: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this code system is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of code systems that are appropriate for use versus not.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the code system was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the code system changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the code system. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the code system.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the code system is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the code system. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the code system. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the code system
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the code system from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the code system was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the code system as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the code system is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the code system was created).

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate code system instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for code system (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the code system is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the code system to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: purpose
element.description: Why this code system is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this code system is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the code system. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this code system.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the code system and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the code system.
element.comment: ... Sometimes, the copyright differs between the code system and the codes that are included. The copyright statement should clearly differentiate between these when required.

element.name: caseSensitive
element.description: If code comparison is case sensitive
element.definition: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.
element.comment: If this value is missing, then it is not specified whether a code system is case sensitive or not. When the rule is not known, Postel's law should be followed: produce codes with the correct case, and accept codes in any case. This element is primarily provided to support validation software.

element.name: valueSet
element.description: Canonical reference to the value set with entire code system
element.definition: Canonical reference to the value set that contains the entire code system.
element.comment: The definition of the value set SHALL include all codes from this code system and only codes from this code system, and it SHALL be immutable.

element.name: hierarchyMeaning
element.definition: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts as represented in this resource.
element.comment: Note that other representations might have a different hierarchy or none at all, and represent the information using properties.

binding.name: CodeSystemHierarchyMeaning
binding.description: The meaning of the hierarchy of concepts in a code system.

element.name: compositional
element.description: If code system defines a compositional grammar
element.definition: The code system defines a compositional (post-coordination) grammar.
element.comment: Note that the code system resource does not define what the compositional grammar is, only whether or not there is one.

element.name: versionNeeded
element.definition: This flag is used to signify that the code system does not commit to concept permanence across versions. If true, a version must be specified when referencing this code system.
element.comment:
Best practice is that code systems do not redefine concepts, or that if concepts are redefined, a new code system definition is created. But this is not always possible, so some code systems may be defined as 'versionNeeded'.
Most code systems occasionally refine the displays defined for concepts between versions. Contexts in which the concept display values are validated may require that the version be specified for some code systems irrespective of the value of this property.

element.name: content
element.definition: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in this resource instance.

binding.name: CodeSystemContentMode
binding.description: The extent of the content of the code system (the concepts and codes it defines) are represented in a code system resource.

element.name: supplements
element.description: Canonical URL of Code System this adds designations and properties to
element.definition: The canonical URL of the code system that this code system supplement is adding designations and properties to.
element.comment: The most common use of a code system supplement is to add additional language support.

element.name: count
element.description: Total concepts in the code system
element.definition: The total number of concepts defined by the code system. Where the code system has a compositional grammar, the basis of this count is defined by the system steward.
element.comment: The count of concepts defined in this resource cannot be more than this value but may be less for several reasons - see the content element.

element.name: filter
element.description: Filter that can be used in a value set
element.definition: A filter that can be used in a value set compose statement when selecting concepts using a filter.
element.comment: Note that filters defined in code systems usually require custom code on the part of any terminology engine that will make them available for use in value set filters. For this reason, they are generally only seen in high value published terminologies.

element.name: property
element.description: Additional information supplied about each concept
element.definition: A property defines an additional slot through which additional information can be provided about a concept.

element.name: concept
element.definition: Concepts that are in the code system. The concept definitions are inherently hierarchical, but the definitions must be consulted to determine what the meanings of the hierarchical relationships are.
element.comment: If this is empty, it means that the code system resource does not represent the content of the code system.

element.name: code
element.definition: A code - a text symbol - that uniquely identifies the concept within the code system.

element.name: display
element.description: Text to display to the user
element.definition: A human readable string that is the recommended default way to present this concept to a user.

element.name: definition
element.definition: The formal definition of the concept. The code system resource does not make formal definitions required, because of the prevalence of legacy systems. However, they are highly recommended, as without them there is no formal meaning associated with the concept.

element.name: designation
element.definition: Additional representations for the concept - other languages, aliases, specialized purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.
element.comment: Concepts have both a ```display``` and an array of ```designation```. The display is equivalent to a special designation with an implied ```designation.use``` of "primary code" and a language equal to the [Resource Language](resource.html#language).

element.name: property
element.definition: A property value for this concept.

element.name: concept
element.definition: Defines children of a concept to produce a hierarchy of concepts. The nature of the relationships is variable (is-a/contains/categorizes) - see hierarchyMeaning.

element.name: language
element.definition: The language this designation is defined for.
element.comment: In the absence of a language, the resource language applies.

binding.name: Language
binding.description: A human language.

element.name: use
element.description: Details how this designation would be used
element.definition: A code that details how this designation would be used.
element.comment: If no use is provided, the designation can be assumed to be suitable for general display to a human user.

binding.name: ConceptDesignationUse
binding.description: Details of how a designation would be used.

element.name: value
element.description: The text value for this designation
element.definition: The text value for this designation.

element.name: code
element.definition: A code that is a reference to CodeSystem.property.code.

element.name: value
element.description: Value of the property for this concept
element.definition: The value of this property.

element.name: code
element.definition: The code that identifies this filter when it is used as a filter in [ValueSet](valueset.html#).compose.include.filter.

element.name: description
element.description: How or why the filter is used
element.definition: A description of how or why the filter is used.

element.name: operator
element.description: = | is-a | descendent-of | is-not-a | regex | in | not-in | generalizes | exists
element.definition: A list of operators that can be used with the filter.

binding.name: FilterOperator
binding.description: The kind of operation to perform as a part of a property based filter.

element.name: value
element.description: What to use for the value
element.definition: A description of what the value for the filter should be.

element.name: code
element.description: Identifies the property on the concepts, and when referred to in operations
element.definition: A code that is used to identify the property. The code is used internally (in CodeSystem.concept.property.code) and also externally, such as in property filters.

element.name: uri
element.definition: Reference to the formal meaning of the property. One possible source of meaning is the [Concept Properties](codesystem-concept-properties.html) code system.

element.name: description
element.description: Why the property is defined, and/or what it conveys
element.definition: A description of the property- why it is defined, and how its value might be used.

element.name: type
element.description: code | Coding | string | integer | boolean | dateTime | decimal
element.definition: The type of the property value. Properties of type "code" contain a code defined by the code system (e.g. a reference to another defined concept).

binding.name: PropertyType
binding.description: The type of a property value.

element.name: coding
element.description: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information. Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
