element.definition: One or more Contract Provisions, which may be related and conveyed as a group, and may contain nested groups.

element.name: supportingInfo
element.definition: Information that may be needed by/relevant to the performer in their execution of this term action.

element.name: relevantHistory
element.definition: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this Contract definition, derivative, or instance, which identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the Contract. The Provence.entity indicates the target that was changed in the update. http://build.fhir.org/provenance-definitions.html#Provenance.entity.

element.name: signer
element.definition: Parties with legal standing in the Contract, including the principal parties, the grantor(s) and grantee(s), which are any person or organization bound by the contract, and any ancillary parties, which facilitate the execution of the contract such as a notary or witness.
element.comment: Signers who are principal parties to the contract are bound by the Contract.activity related to the Contract.topic, and the Contract.term(s), which either extend or restrict the overall action on the topic by, for example, stipulating specific policies or obligations constraining actions, action reason, or agents with respect to some or all of the topic. For example, specifying how policies or obligations shall constrain actions and action reasons permitted or denied on all or a subset of the Contract.topic (e.g., all or a portion of property being transferred by the contract), agents (e.g., who can resell, assign interests, or alter the property being transferred by the contract), actions, and action reasons; or with respect to Contract.terms, stipulating, extending, or limiting the Contract.period of applicability or valuation of items under consideration.

element.name: friendly
element.definition: The "patient friendly language" versionof the Contract in whole or in parts. "Patient friendly language" means the representation of the Contract and Contract Provisions in a manner that is readily accessible and understandable by a layperson in accordance with best practices for communication styles that ensure that those agreeing to or signing the Contract understand the roles, actions, obligations, responsibilities, and implication of the agreement.

element.name: legal
element.definition: List of Legal expressions or representations of this Contract.

element.name: rule
element.definition: List of Computable Policy Rule Language Representations of this Contract.

element.name: legallyBinding
element.definition: Legally binding Contract: This is the signed and legally recognized representation of the Contract, which is considered the "source of truth" and which would be the basis for legal action related to enforcement of this Contract.

element.name: type
element.definition: Precusory content structure and use, i.e., a boilerplate, template, application for a contract such as an insurance policy or benefits under a program, e.g., workers compensation.

binding.name: ContractDefinitionType
binding.description: Detailed codes for the definition of contracts.

element.name: subType
element.definition: Detailed Precusory content type.

binding.name: ContractDefinitionSubtype
binding.description: Detailed codes for the additional definition of contracts.

element.name: publisher
element.definition: The individual or organization that published the Contract precursor content.

element.name: publicationDate
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the contract was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the contract changes.

element.name: publicationStatus
element.description: amended | appended | cancelled | disputed | entered-in-error | executable | executed | negotiable | offered | policy | rejected | renewed | revoked | resolved | terminated
element.definition: amended | appended | cancelled | disputed | entered-in-error | executable | executed | negotiable | offered | policy | rejected | renewed | revoked | resolved | terminated.

binding.name: ContractPublicationStatus
binding.description: Status of the publication of contract content.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to Contract precursor content. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the Contract precursor content.

element.name: content
element.description: Easily comprehended representation of this Contract
element.definition: Human readable rendering of this Contract in a format and representation intended to enhance comprehension and ensure understandability.

element.name: content
element.definition: Contract legal text in human renderable form.

element.name: content
element.definition: Computable Contract conveyed using a policy rule language (e.g. XACML, DKAL, SecPal).

element.name: type
element.definition: Role of this Contract signer, e.g. notary, grantee.

binding.name: ContractSignerType
binding.description: List of parties who may be signing.

element.name: party
element.definition: Party which is a signator to this Contract.

element.name: signature
element.definition: Legally binding Contract DSIG signature contents in Base64.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Unique identifier for this particular Contract Provision.

element.name: issued
element.definition: When this Contract Provision was issued.

element.name: applies
element.definition: Relevant time or time-period when this Contract Provision is applicable.

element.name: topic
element.definition: The entity that the term applies to.

element.name: type
element.definition: A legal clause or condition contained within a contract that requires one or both parties to perform a particular requirement by some specified time or prevents one or both parties from performing a particular requirement by some specified time.

binding.name: ContractTermType
binding.description: Detailed codes for the types of contract provisions.

element.name: subType
element.definition: A specialized legal clause or condition based on overarching contract type.

binding.name: ContractTermSubType
binding.description: Detailed codes for the subtypes of contract provisions.

element.name: text
element.definition: Statement of a provision in a policy or a contract.

element.name: securityLabel
element.definition: Security labels that protect the handling of information about the term and its elements, which may be specifically identified..

element.name: offer
element.definition: The matter of concern in the context of this provision of the agrement.

element.name: asset
element.definition: Contract Term Asset List.

element.name: action
element.definition: An actor taking a role in an activity for which it can be assigned some degree of responsibility for the activity taking place.
element.comment: Several agents may be associated (i.e. has some responsibility for an activity) with an activity and vice-versa. For example, in cases of actions initiated by one user for other users, or in events that involve more than one user, hardware device, software, or system process. However, only one user may be the initiator/requestor for the event.

element.name: group
element.definition: Nested group of Contract Provisions.

element.name: doNotPerform
element.description: True if the term prohibits the action
element.definition: True if the term prohibits the action.

element.name: type
element.description: Type or form of the action
element.definition: Activity or service obligation to be done or not done, performed or not performed, effectuated or not by this Contract term.

binding.name: ContractAction
binding.description: Detailed codes for the contract action.

element.name: subject
element.definition: Entity of the action.

element.name: intent
element.description: Purpose for the Contract Term Action
element.definition: Reason or purpose for the action stipulated by this Contract Provision.

binding.name: ContractActionReason
binding.description: Detailed codes for the contract action reason.

element.name: linkId
element.definition: Id [identifier??] of the clause or question text related to this action in the referenced form or QuestionnaireResponse.

element.name: status
element.definition: Current state of the term action.

binding.name: ContractActionStatus
binding.description: Codes for the status of an term action.

element.name: context
element.definition: Encounter or Episode with primary association to specified term activity.

element.name: contextLinkId
element.definition: Id [identifier??] of the clause or question text related to the requester of this action in the referenced form or QuestionnaireResponse.

element.name: occurrence
element.definition: When action happens.

element.name: requester
element.definition: Who or what initiated the action and has responsibility for its activation.

element.name: requesterLinkId
element.definition: Id [identifier??] of the clause or question text related to the requester of this action in the referenced form or QuestionnaireResponse.

element.name: performerType
element.definition: The type of individual that is desired or required to perform or not perform the action.

binding.name: ContractActionPerformerType
binding.description: Codes for the types of action perfomer.

element.name: performerRole
element.definition: The type of role or competency of an individual desired or required to perform or not perform the action.

binding.name: ContractActionPerformerRole
binding.description: Codes for the role of the action performer.

element.name: performer
element.description: Actor that wil execute (or not) the action
element.definition: Indicates who or what is being asked to perform (or not perform) the ction.

element.name: performerLinkId
element.definition: Id [identifier??] of the clause or question text related to the reason type or reference of this action in the referenced form or QuestionnaireResponse.

element.name: reasonCode
element.definition: Rationale for the action to be performed or not performed. Describes why the action is permitted or prohibited.

binding.name: ContractActionReason
binding.description: Detailed codes for the contract action reason.

element.name: reasonReference
element.definition: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies permitting or not permitting this action.

element.name: reason
element.description: Why action is to be performed
element.definition: Describes why the action is to be performed or not performed in textual form.

element.name: reasonLinkId
element.definition: Id [identifier??] of the clause or question text related to the reason type or reference of this action in the referenced form or QuestionnaireResponse.

element.name: note
element.definition: Comments made about the term action made by the requester, performer, subject or other participants.

element.name: securityLabelNumber
element.definition: Security labels that protects the action.

element.name: reference
element.definition: The entity the action is performed or not performed on or for.

element.name: role
element.definition: Role type of agent assigned roles in this Contract.

binding.name: ContractActorRole
binding.description: Detailed codes for the contract actor role.

element.name: scope
element.definition: Differentiates the kind of the asset .

binding.name: ContractAssetScope
binding.description: Codes for scoping an asset.

element.name: type
element.definition: Target entity type about which the term may be concerned.

binding.name: ContractAssetType
binding.description: Condes for the type of an asset.

element.name: typeReference
element.definition: Associated entities.

element.name: subtype
element.definition: May be a subtype or part of an offered asset.

binding.name: ContractAssetSubtype
binding.description: Condes for the sub-type of an asset.

element.name: relationship
element.definition: Specifies the applicability of the term to an asset resource instance, and instances it refers to orinstances that refer to it, and/or are owned by the offeree.

binding.name: ConsentContentClass
binding.description: The class (type) of information a consent rule covers.

element.name: context
element.definition: Circumstance of the asset.

element.name: condition
element.definition: Description of the quality and completeness of the asset that imay be a factor in its valuation.

element.name: periodType
element.definition: Type of Asset availability for use or ownership.

binding.name: AssetAvailabilityType
binding.description: Codes for asset availability.

element.name: period
element.definition: Asset relevant contractual time period.

element.name: usePeriod
element.definition: Time period of asset use.

element.name: text
element.definition: Clause or question text (Prose Object) concerning the asset in a linked form, such as a QuestionnaireResponse used in the formation of the contract.

element.name: linkId
element.definition: Id [identifier??] of the clause or question text about the asset in the referenced form or QuestionnaireResponse.

element.name: answer
element.definition: Response to assets.

element.name: securityLabelNumber
element.definition: Security labels that protects the asset.

element.name: valuedItem
element.definition: Contract Valued Item List.

element.name: reference
element.definition: Asset context reference may include the creator, custodian, or owning Person or Organization (e.g., bank, repository), location held, e.g., building, jurisdiction.

element.name: code
element.definition: Coded representation of the context generally or of the Referenced entity, such as the asset holder type or location.

binding.name: ContractAssetContext
binding.description: Codes for the context of the asset.

element.name: text
element.definition: Context description.

element.name: entity
element.definition: Specific type of Contract Valued Item that may be priced.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Identifies a Contract Valued Item instance.

element.name: effectiveTime
element.definition: Indicates the time during which this Contract ValuedItem information is effective.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: Specifies the units by which the Contract Valued Item is measured or counted, and quantifies the countable or measurable Contract Valued Item instances.

element.name: unitPrice
element.description: Contract Valued Item fee, charge, or cost
element.definition: A Contract Valued Item unit valuation measure.

element.name: factor
element.description: Contract Valued Item Price Scaling Factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of the Contract Valued Item delivered. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

element.name: points
element.description: Contract Valued Item Difficulty Scaling Factor
element.definition: An amount that expresses the weighting (based on difficulty, cost and/or resource intensiveness) associated with the Contract Valued Item delivered. The concept of Points allows for assignment of point values for a Contract Valued Item, such that a monetary amount can be assigned to each point.

element.name: net
element.definition: Expresses the product of the Contract Valued Item unitQuantity and the unitPriceAmt. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

element.name: payment
element.definition: Terms of valuation.

element.name: paymentDate
element.definition: When payment is due.

element.name: responsible
element.definition: Who will make payment.

element.name: recipient
element.definition: Who will receive payment.

element.name: linkId
element.definition: Id of the clause or question text related to the context of this valuedItem in the referenced form or QuestionnaireResponse.

element.name: securityLabelNumber
element.description: Security Labels that define affected terms
element.definition: A set of security labels that define which terms are controlled by this condition.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Unique identifier for this particular Contract Provision.

element.name: party
element.definition: Offer Recipient.

element.name: topic
element.definition: The owner of an asset has the residual control rights over the asset: the right to decide all usages of the asset in any way not inconsistent with a prior contract, custom, or law (Hart, 1995, p. 30).
element.comment: The Contract.topic may be an application for or offer of a policy or service (e.g., uri to a consent directive form or a health insurance policy), which becomes the Contract once accepted by both the grantor and grantee. The Contract Resource may function simply as the computable representation of the executed contract, which may be the attached to the Contract Resource as the binding or as the friendly electronic form. For example, a Contract Resource may be automatically populated with the values expressed in a related QuestionnaireResponse. However, the Contract Resource may be considered the legally binding contract if it is the only executed form of this contract, and includes the signatures as *The Contract Resource may function as the computable representation of an application or offer in a pre-executed Contract if the grantor has not entered any values. In this case, it is populated with values in a legal form of the application or offer or by the values in an associated Questionnaire. If the grantor has filled in the legal form or the associated Questionnaire Response, then these values are used to populate a pre-executed Contract Resource. If the Contract.topic is considered an application or offer, then the policy is often required to be attached as the legal basis for the application to ensure informed consent to the contract, and that any discrepancy between the application and the policy are interpreted against the policy. Implementers should check organizational and jurisdictional policies to determine the relationship among multiple representations of a contract pre- and post-execution.

element.name: type
element.definition: Type of Contract Provision such as specific requirements, purposes for actions, obligations, prohibitions, e.g. life time maximum benefit.

binding.name: ContractTermType
binding.description: Detailed codes for the types of contract provisions.

element.name: decision
element.definition: Type of choice made by accepting party with respect to an offer made by an offeror/ grantee.

binding.name: ContractDecisionType
binding.description: The type of decision made by a grantor with respect to an offer made by a grantee.

element.name: decisionMode
element.definition: How the decision about a Contract was conveyed.

binding.name: ContractDecisionMode
binding.description: Codes for conveying a decision.

element.name: answer
element.definition: Response to offer text.

element.name: text
element.definition: Human readable form of this Contract Offer.

element.name: linkId
element.definition: The id of the clause or question text of the offer in the referenced questionnaire/response.

element.name: securityLabelNumber
element.definition: Security labels that protects the offer.

element.name: value
element.definition: Response to an offer clause or question text, which enables selection of values to be agreed to, e.g., the period of participation, the date of occupancy of a rental, warrently duration, or whether biospecimen may be used for further research.

element.name: reference
element.definition: Participant in the offer.

element.name: role
element.definition: How the party participates in the offer.

binding.name: ContractPartyRole
binding.description: Codes for offer participant roles.

element.name: number
element.definition: Number used to link this term or term element to the applicable Security Label.

element.name: classification
element.definition: Security label privacy tag that species the level of confidentiality protection required for this term and/or term elements.

binding.name: ContractSecurityClassification
binding.description: Codes for confidentiality protection.

element.name: category
element.definition: Security label privacy tag that species the applicable privacy and security policies governing this term and/or term elements.

binding.name: ContractSecurityCategory
binding.description: Codes for policy category.

element.name: control
element.definition: Security label privacy tag that species the manner in which term and/or term elements are to be protected.

binding.name: ContractSecurityControl
binding.description: Codes for handling instructions.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of contributor.

binding.name: ContributorType
binding.description: The type of contributor.

element.name: name
element.definition: The name of the individual or organization responsible for the contribution.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the contributor.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this coverage.
element.comment: The main (and possibly only) identifier for the coverage - often referred to as a Member Id, Certificate number, Personal Health Number or Case ID. May be constructed as the concatenation of the Coverage.SubscriberID and the Coverage.dependant.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the resource instance.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the code entered-in-error that marks the coverage as not currently valid.

binding.name: CoverageStatus
binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

element.name: type
element.description: Coverage category such as medical or accident
element.definition: The type of coverage: social program, medical plan, accident coverage (workers compensation, auto), group health or payment by an individual or organization.

binding.name: CoverageType
binding.description: The type of insurance: public health, worker compensation; private accident, auto, private health, etc.) or a direct payment by an individual or organization.

element.name: policyHolder
element.definition: The party who 'owns' the insurance policy.
element.comment: For example: may be an individual, corporation or the subscriber's employer.

element.name: subscriber
element.definition: The party who has signed-up for or 'owns' the contractual relationship to the policy or to whom the benefit of the policy for services rendered to them or their family is due.
element.comment: May be self or a parent in the case of dependants.

element.name: subscriberId
element.definition: The insurer assigned ID for the Subscriber.

element.name: beneficiary
element.definition: The party who benefits from the insurance coverage; the patient when products and/or services are provided.

element.name: dependent
element.definition: A unique identifier for a dependent under the coverage.
element.comment: Periodically the member number is constructed from the subscriberId and the dependant number.

element.name: relationship
element.definition: The relationship of beneficiary (patient) to the subscriber.
element.comment: Typically, an individual uses policies which are theirs (relationship='self') before policies owned by others.

binding.name: Relationship
binding.description: The relationship between the Subscriber and the Beneficiary (insured/covered party/patient).

element.name: period
element.definition: Time period during which the coverage is in force. A missing start date indicates the start date isn't known, a missing end date means the coverage is continuing to be in force.

element.name: payor
element.definition: The program or plan underwriter or payor including both insurance and non-insurance agreements, such as patient-pay agreements.
element.comment: May provide multiple identifiers such as insurance company identifier or business identifier (BIN number). For selfpay it may provide multiple paying persons and/or organizations.

element.name: class
element.definition: A suite of underwriter specific classifiers.
element.comment: For example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group, Policy, Plan.

element.name: order
element.definition: The order of applicability of this coverage relative to other coverages which are currently in force. Note, there may be gaps in the numbering and this does not imply primary, secondary etc. as the specific positioning of coverages depends upon the episode of care.

element.name: network
element.definition: The insurer-specific identifier for the insurer-defined network of providers to which the beneficiary may seek treatment which will be covered at the 'in-network' rate, otherwise 'out of network' terms and conditions apply.

element.name: costToBeneficiary
element.definition: A suite of codes indicating the cost category and associated amount which have been detailed in the policy and may have been included on the health card.
element.comment: For example by knowing the patient visit co-pay, the provider can collect the amount prior to undertaking treatment.

element.name: subrogation
element.definition: When 'subrogation=true' this insurance instance has been included not for adjudication but to provide insurers with the details to recover costs.
element.comment: Typically, automotive and worker's compensation policies would be flagged with 'subrogation=true' to enable healthcare payors to collect against accident claims.

element.name: contract
element.definition: The policy(s) which constitute this insurance coverage.

element.name: type
element.description: Type of class such as 'group' or 'plan'
element.definition: The type of classification for which an insurer-specific class label or number and optional name is provided, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group, Policy, Plan.

binding.name: CoverageClass
binding.description: The policy classifications, eg. Group, Plan, Class, etc.

element.name: value
element.definition: The alphanumeric string value associated with the insurer issued label.
element.comment: For example, the Group or Plan number.

element.name: name
element.description: Human readable description of the type and value
element.definition: A short description for the class.

element.name: type
element.definition: The category of patient centric costs associated with treatment.
element.comment: For example visit, specialist visits, emergency, inpatient care, etc.

binding.name: CopayTypes
binding.description: The types of services to which patient copayments are specified.

element.name: value
element.description: The amount or percentage due from the beneficiary
element.definition: The amount due from the patient for the cost category.
element.comment: Amount may be expressed as a percentage of the service/product cost or a fixed amount of currency.

element.name: exception
element.definition: A suite of codes indicating exceptions or reductions to patient costs and their effective periods.

element.name: type
element.definition: The code for the specific exception.

binding.name: CoverageFinancialException
binding.description: The types of exceptions from the part or full value of financial obligations such as copays.

element.name: period
element.description: The effective period of the exception
element.definition: The timeframe during when the exception is in force.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business Identifier for coverage eligiblity request
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this coverage eligiblity request.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the resource instance.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: EligibilityRequestStatus
binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

element.name: priority
element.definition: When the requestor expects the processor to complete processing.

binding.name: ProcessPriority
binding.description: The timeliness with which processing is required: STAT, normal, Deferred.

element.name: purpose
element.definition: Code to specify whether requesting: prior authorization requirements for some service categories or billing codes; benefits for coverages specified or discovered; discovery and return of coverages for the patient; and/or validation that the specified coverage is in-force at the date/period specified or 'now' if not specified.

binding.name: EligibilityRequestPurpose
binding.description: A code specifying the types of information being requested.

element.name: patient
element.description: Intended recipient of products and services
element.definition: The party who is the beneficiary of the supplied coverage and for whom eligibility is sought.

element.name: serviced
element.description: Estimated date or dates of service
element.definition: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

element.name: created
element.definition: The date when this resource was created.

element.name: enterer
element.definition: Person who created the request.

element.name: provider
element.definition: The provider which is responsible for the request.
element.comment: Typically this field would be 1..1 where this party is responsible for the eligibility request but not necessarily professionally responsible for the provision of the individual products and services listed below.

element.name: insurer
element.definition: The Insurer who issued the coverage in question and is the recipient of the request.

element.name: facility
element.definition: Facility where the services are intended to be provided.

element.name: supportingInfo
element.definition: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.
element.comment: Often there are multiple jurisdiction specific valuesets which are required.

element.name: insurance
element.definition: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services.
element.comment: All insurance coverages for the patient which may be applicable for reimbursement, of the products and services listed in the claim, are typically provided in the claim to allow insurers to confirm the ordering of the insurance coverages relative to local 'coordination of benefit' rules. One coverage (and only one) with 'focal=true' is to be used in the adjudication of this claim. Coverages appearing before the focal Coverage in the list, and where 'subrogation=false', should provide a reference to the ClaimResponse containing the adjudication results of the prior claim.

element.name: item
element.description: Item to be evaluated for eligibiity
element.definition: Service categories or billable services for which benefit details and/or an authorization prior to service delivery may be required by the payor.

element.name: focal
element.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for evaluation of this request when set to true.
element.comment: A patient may (will) have multiple insurance policies which provide reimburement for healthcare services and products. For example a person may also be covered by their spouse's policy and both appear in the list (and may be from the same insurer). This flag will be set to true for only one of the listed policies and that policy will be used for evaluating this request. Other requests would be created to request evaluation against the other listed policies.

element.name: coverage
element.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

element.name: businessArrangement
element.definition: A business agreement number established between the provider and the insurer for special business processing purposes.

element.name: supportingInfoSequence
element.definition: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information applicable for this service or product line.

element.name: category
element.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
element.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.

binding.name: BenefitCategory
binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral, medical, vision etc.

element.name: productOrService
element.description: Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: This contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: Code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI).

binding.name: ServiceProduct
binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.name: modifier
element.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: For example in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

binding.name: Modifiers
binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.name: provider
element.definition: The practitioner who is responsible for the product or service to be rendered to the patient.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

element.name: unitPrice
element.description: Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: The amount charged to the patient by the provider for a single unit.

element.name: facility
element.definition: Facility where the services will be provided.

element.name: diagnosis
element.definition: Patient diagnosis for which care is sought.

element.name: detail
element.definition: The plan/proposal/order describing the proposed service in detail.

element.name: diagnosis
element.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

binding.name: ICD10
binding.description: ICD10 Diagnostic codes.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.

element.name: information
element.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.
element.comment: Could be used to provide references to other resources, document. For example could contain a PDF in an Attachment of the Police Report for an Accident.

element.name: appliesToAll
element.definition: The supporting materials are applicable for all detail items, product/servce categories and specific billing codes.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business Identifier for coverage eligiblity request
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this coverage eligiblity request.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the resource instance.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: EligibilityResponseStatus
binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

element.name: purpose
element.definition: Code to specify whether requesting: prior authorization requirements for some service categories or billing codes; benefits for coverages specified or discovered; discovery and return of coverages for the patient; and/or validation that the specified coverage is in-force at the date/period specified or 'now' if not specified.

binding.name: EligibilityResponsePurpose
binding.description: A code specifying the types of information being requested.

element.name: patient
element.description: Intended recipient of products and services
element.definition: The party who is the beneficiary of the supplied coverage and for whom eligibility is sought.

element.name: serviced
element.description: Estimated date or dates of service
element.definition: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

element.name: created
element.definition: The date this resource was created.

element.name: requestor
element.definition: The provider which is responsible for the request.
element.comment: Typically this field would be 1..1 where this party is responsible for the claim but not necessarily professionally responsible for the provision of the individual products and services listed below.

element.name: request
element.definition: Reference to the original request resource.

element.name: outcome
element.definition: The outcome of the request processing.
element.comment: The resource may be used to indicate that: the request has been held (queued) for processing; that it has been processed and errors found (error); that no errors were found and that some of the adjudication has been undertaken (partial) or that all of the adjudication has been undertaken (complete).

binding.name: RemittanceOutcome
binding.description: The outcome of the processing.

element.name: disposition
element.definition: A human readable description of the status of the adjudication.

element.name: insurer
element.definition: The Insurer who issued the coverage in question and is the author of the response.

element.name: insurance
element.definition: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services.
element.comment: All insurance coverages for the patient which may be applicable for reimbursement, of the products and services listed in the claim, are typically provided in the claim to allow insurers to confirm the ordering of the insurance coverages relative to local 'coordination of benefit' rules. One coverage (and only one) with 'focal=true' is to be used in the adjudication of this claim. Coverages appearing before the focal Coverage in the list, and where 'subrogation=false', should provide a reference to the ClaimResponse containing the adjudication results of the prior claim.

element.name: preAuthRef
element.definition: A reference from the Insurer to which these services pertain to be used on further communication and as proof that the request occurred.

element.name: form
element.definition: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.
element.comment: May be needed to identify specific jurisdictional forms.

binding.name: Forms
binding.description: The forms codes.

element.name: error
element.definition: Errors encountered during the processing of the request.

element.name: code
element.definition: An error code,from a specified code system, which details why the eligibility check could not be performed.

binding.name: AdjudicationError
binding.description: The error codes for adjudication processing.

element.name: coverage
element.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

element.name: inforce
element.definition: Flag indicating if the coverage provided is inforce currently if no service date(s) specified or for the whole duration of the service dates.

element.name: benefitPeriod
element.definition: The term of the benefits documented in this response.

element.name: item
element.definition: Benefits and optionally current balances, and authorization details by category or service.

constraint.name: ces-1
constraint.message: SHALL contain a category or a billcode but not both.

element.name: category
element.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
element.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.

binding.name: BenefitCategory
binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral, medical, vision etc.

element.name: productOrService
element.description: Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: This contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: Code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI).

binding.name: ServiceProduct
binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.name: modifier
element.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: For example in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

binding.name: Modifiers
binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.name: provider
element.definition: The practitioner who is eligible for the provision of the product or service.

element.name: excluded
element.definition: True if the indicated class of service is excluded from the plan, missing or False indicates the product or service is included in the coverage.

element.name: name
element.definition: A short name or tag for the benefit.
element.comment: For example: MED01, or DENT2.

element.name: description
element.description: Description of the benefit or services covered
element.definition: A richer description of the benefit or services covered.
element.comment: For example 'DENT2 covers 100% of basic, 50% of major but excludes Ortho, Implants and Cosmetic services'.

element.name: network
element.definition: Is a flag to indicate whether the benefits refer to in-network providers or out-of-network providers.

binding.name: BenefitNetwork
binding.description: Code to classify in or out of network services.

element.name: unit
element.definition: Indicates if the benefits apply to an individual or to the family.

binding.name: BenefitUnit
binding.description: Unit covered/serviced - individual or family.

element.name: term
element.definition: The term or period of the values such as 'maximum lifetime benefit' or 'maximum annual visits'.

binding.name: BenefitTerm
binding.description: Coverage unit - annual, lifetime.

element.name: benefit
element.definition: Benefits used to date.

element.name: authorizationRequired
element.definition: A boolean flag indicating whether a preauthorization is required prior to actual service delivery.

element.name: authorizationSupporting
element.definition: Codes or comments regarding information or actions associated with the preauthorization.

binding.name: AuthSupporting
binding.description: Type of supporting information to provide with a preauthorization.

element.name: authorizationUrl
element.definition: A web location for obtaining requirements or descriptive information regarding the preauthorization.

element.name: type
element.definition: Classification of benefit being provided.
element.comment: For example: deductible, visits, benefit amount.

binding.name: BenefitType
binding.description: Deductable, visits, co-pay, etc.

element.name: allowed
element.definition: The quantity of the benefit which is permitted under the coverage.

element.name: used
element.definition: The quantity of the benefit which have been consumed to date.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of the required data
element.definition: The type of the required data, specified as the type name of a resource. For profiles, this value is set to the type of the base resource of the profile.

binding.name: FHIRAllTypes
binding.description: A list of all the concrete types defined in this version of the FHIR specification - Abstract Types, Data Types and Resource Types.

element.name: profile
element.description: The profile of the required data
element.definition: The profile of the required data, specified as the uri of the profile definition.

element.name: subject
element.description: E.g. Patient, Practitioner, RelatedPerson, Organization, Location, Device
element.definition: The intended subjects of the data requirement. If this element is not provided, a Patient subject is assumed.
element.comment: The subject of a data requirement is critical, as the data being specified is determined with respect to a particular subject. This corresponds roughly to the notion of a Compartment in that it limits what data is available based on its relationship to the subject. In CQL, this corresponds to the context declaration.

binding.name: SubjectType
binding.description: The possible types of subjects for a data requirement (E.g., Patient, Practitioner, Organization, Location, etc.).

element.name: mustSupport
element.description: Indicates specific structure elements that are referenced by the knowledge module
element.definition:
Indicates that specific elements of the type are referenced by the knowledge module and must be supported by the consumer in order to obtain an effective evaluation. This does not mean that a value is required for this element, only that the consuming system must understand the element and be able to provide values for it if they are available.
The value of mustSupport SHALL be a FHIRPath resolveable on the type of the DataRequirement. The path SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and .resolve() (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](fhirpath.html#simple) for full details).

element.name: codeFilter
element.definition: Code filters specify additional constraints on the data, specifying the value set of interest for a particular element of the data. Each code filter defines an additional constraint on the data, i.e. code filters are AND'ed, not OR'ed.

constraint.name: drq-1
constraint.message: Either a path or a searchParam must be provided, but not both

element.name: dateFilter
element.definition: Date filters specify additional constraints on the data in terms of the applicable date range for specific elements. Each date filter specifies an additional constraint on the data, i.e. date filters are AND'ed, not OR'ed.

constraint.name: drq-2
constraint.message: Either a path or a searchParam must be provided, but not both

element.name: limit
element.definition: Specifies a maximum number of results that are required (uses the _count search parameter).
element.comment: This element can be used in combination with the sort element to specify quota requirements such as "the most recent 5" or "the highest 5".

element.name: sort
element.definition: Specifies the order of the results to be returned.
element.comment: This element can be used in combination with the sort element to specify quota requirements such as "the most recent 5" or "the highest 5". When multiple sorts are specified, they are applied in the order they appear in the resource.

element.name: path
element.description: A code-valued attribute to filter on
element.definition: The code-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolveable on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and .resolve(). The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](fhirpath.html#simple) for full details). Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type code, Coding, or CodeableConcept.
element.comment: The path attribute contains a [Simple FHIRPath Subset](fhirpath.html#simple) that allows path traversal, but not calculation.

element.name: searchParam
element.description: A coded (token) parameter to search on
element.definition: A token parameter that refers to a search parameter defined on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and which searches on elements of type code, Coding, or CodeableConcept.

element.name: valueSet
element.definition: The valueset for the code filter. The valueSet and code elements are additive. If valueSet is specified, the filter will return only those data items for which the value of the code-valued element specified in the path is a member of the specified valueset.

element.name: code
element.definition: The codes for the code filter. If values are given, the filter will return only those data items for which the code-valued attribute specified by the path has a value that is one of the specified codes. If codes are specified in addition to a value set, the filter returns items matching a code in the value set or one of the specified codes.

element.name: path
element.description: A date-valued attribute to filter on
element.definition: The date-valued attribute of the filter. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolveable on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and .resolve(). The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](fhirpath.html#simple) for full details). Note that the index must be an integer constant. The path must resolve to an element of type date, dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.
element.comment: The path attribute contains a [Simple FHIR Subset](fhirpath.html#simple) that allows path traversal, but not calculation.

element.name: searchParam
element.description: A date valued parameter to search on
element.definition: A date parameter that refers to a search parameter defined on the specified type of the DataRequirement, and which searches on elements of type date, dateTime, Period, Schedule, or Timing.

element.name: value
element.description: The value of the filter, as a Period, DateTime, or Duration value
element.definition: The value of the filter. If period is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within the bounds determined by the Period, inclusive of the period boundaries. If dateTime is specified, the filter will return only those data items that are equal to the specified dateTime. If a Duration is specified, the filter will return only those data items that fall within Duration before now.

element.name: path
element.description: The name of the attribute to perform the sort
element.definition: The attribute of the sort. The specified path must be resolvable from the type of the required data. The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements. Note that the index must be an integer constant.

element.name: direction
element.definition: The direction of the sort, ascending or descending.

binding.name: SortDirection
binding.description: The possible sort directions, ascending or descending.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Unique id for the detected issue
element.definition: Business identifier associated with the detected issue record.

element.name: status
element.definition: Indicates the status of the detected issue.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the codes cancelled and entered-in-error that mark the issue as not currently valid.

binding.name: DetectedIssueStatus
binding.description: Indicates the status of the identified issue.

element.name: code
element.description: Issue Category, e.g. drug-drug, duplicate therapy, etc.
element.definition: Identifies the general type of issue identified.

binding.name: DetectedIssueCategory
binding.description: Codes identifying the general type of detected issue; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, Timing issue, Duplicate therapy, etc.

element.name: severity
element.definition: Indicates the degree of importance associated with the identified issue based on the potential impact on the patient.

binding.name: DetectedIssueSeverity
binding.description: Indicates the potential degree of impact of the identified issue on the patient.

element.name: patient
element.definition: Indicates the patient whose record the detected issue is associated with.

element.name: identified
element.definition: The date or period when the detected issue was initially identified.

element.name: author
element.description: The provider or device that identified the issue
element.definition: Individual or device responsible for the issue being raised. For example, a decision support application or a pharmacist conducting a medication review.

element.name: implicated
element.definition: Indicates the resource representing the current activity or proposed activity that is potentially problematic.
element.comment: There's an implicit constraint on the number of implicated resources based on DetectedIssue.type; e.g. For drug-drug, there would be more than one. For timing, there would typically only be one.

element.name: evidence
element.definition: Supporting evidence or manifestations that provide the basis for identifying the detected issue such as a GuidanceResponse or MeasureReport.

element.name: detail
element.definition: A textual explanation of the detected issue.
element.comment: Should focus on information not covered elsewhere as discrete data - no need to duplicate the narrative.

element.name: reference
element.definition: The literature, knowledge-base or similar reference that describes the propensity for the detected issue identified.

element.name: mitigation
element.definition: Indicates an action that has been taken or is committed to reduce or eliminate the likelihood of the risk identified by the detected issue from manifesting. Can also reflect an observation of known mitigating factors that may reduce/eliminate the need for any action.

element.name: code
element.definition: A manifestation that led to the recording of this detected issue.

binding.name: DetectedIssueEvidenceCode
binding.description: Codes that describes the types of evidence for a detected issue.

element.name: detail
element.definition: Links to resources that constitute evidence for the detected issue such as a GuidanceResponse or MeasureReport.

element.name: action
element.definition: Describes the action that was taken or the observation that was made that reduces/eliminates the risk associated with the identified issue.
element.comment: The "text" component can be used for detail or when no appropriate code exists.

binding.name: DetectedIssueMitigationAction
binding.description: Codes describing steps taken to resolve the issue or other circumstances that mitigate the risk associated with the issue; e.g. 'added concurrent therapy', 'prior therapy documented', etc.

element.name: date
element.definition: Indicates when the mitigating action was documented.
element.comment: This might not be the same as when the mitigating step was actually taken.

element.name: author
element.definition: Identifies the practitioner who determined the mitigation and takes responsibility for the mitigation step occurring.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by manufacturers other organizations or owners.
element.comment: The barcode string from a barcode present on a device label or package may identify the instance, include names given to the device in local usage, or may identify the type of device. If the identifier identifies the type of device, Device.type element should be used.

element.name: definition
element.description: The reference to the definition for the device
element.definition: The reference to the definition for the device.

element.name: udiCarrier
element.definition: Unique device identifier (UDI) assigned to device label or package. Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.
element.comment: UDI may identify an unique instance of a device, or it may only identify the type of the device. See [UDI mappings](device-mappings.html#udi) for a complete mapping of UDI parts to Device.

element.name: status
element.definition: Status of the Device availability.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the codes inactive and entered-in-error that mark the device (record)as not currently valid.

binding.name: FHIRDeviceStatus
binding.description: The availability status of the device.

element.name: statusReason
element.description: online | paused | standby | offline | not-ready | transduc-discon | hw-discon | off
element.definition: Reason for the dtatus of the Device availability.

binding.name: FHIRDeviceStatusReason
binding.description: The availability status reason of the device.

element.name: distinctIdentifier
element.definition: The distinct identification string as required by regulation for a human cell, tissue, or cellular and tissue-based product.
element.comment: For example, this applies to devices in the United States regulated under *Code of Federal Regulation 21CFR1271.290(c)*.

element.name: manufacturer
element.definition: A name of the manufacturer.

element.name: manufactureDate
element.description: Date when the device was made
element.definition: The date and time when the device was manufactured.

element.name: expirationDate
element.description: Date and time of expiry of this device (if applicable)
element.definition: The date and time beyond which this device is no longer valid or should not be used (if applicable).

element.name: lotNumber
element.definition: Lot number assigned by the manufacturer.

element.name: serialNumber
element.description: Serial number assigned by the manufacturer
element.definition: The serial number assigned by the organization when the device was manufactured.
element.comment: Alphanumeric Maximum 20.

element.name: deviceName
element.description: The name of the device as given by the manufacturer
element.definition: This represents the manufacturer's name of the device as provided by the device, from a UDI label, or by a person describing the Device. This typically would be used when a person provides the name(s) or when the device represents one of the names available from DeviceDefinition.

element.name: modelNumber
element.description: The model number for the device
element.definition: The model number for the device.

element.name: partNumber
element.description: The part number of the device
element.definition: The part number of the device.
element.comment: Alphanumeric Maximum 20.

element.name: type
element.description: The kind or type of device
element.definition: The kind or type of device.

binding.name: DeviceType
binding.description: Codes to identify medical devices.

element.name: specialization
element.description: The capabilities supported on a device, the standards to which the device conforms for a particular purpose, and used for the communication
element.definition: The capabilities supported on a device, the standards to which the device conforms for a particular purpose, and used for the communication.

element.name: version
element.description: The actual design of the device or software version running on the device
element.definition: The actual design of the device or software version running on the device.

element.name: property
element.description: The actual configuration settings of a device as it actually operates, e.g., regulation status, time properties
element.definition: The actual configuration settings of a device as it actually operates, e.g., regulation status, time properties.

element.name: patient
element.description: Patient to whom Device is affixed
element.definition: Patient information, If the device is affixed to a person.

element.name: owner
element.definition: An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the device.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details for an organization or a particular human that is responsible for the device.
element.comment: used for troubleshooting etc.

element.name: location
element.definition: The place where the device can be found.

element.name: url
element.definition: A network address on which the device may be contacted directly.
element.comment: If the device is running a FHIR server, the network address should be the Base URL from which a conformance statement may be retrieved.

element.name: note
element.definition: Descriptive information, usage information or implantation information that is not captured in an existing element.

element.name: safety
element.definition: Provides additional safety characteristics about a medical device. For example devices containing latex.

element.name: parent
element.definition: The parent device.

element.name: name
element.definition: The name of the device.

element.name: type
element.description: udi-label-name | user-friendly-name | patient-reported-name | manufacturer-name | model-name | other
element.definition: The type of deviceName. UDILabelName | UserFriendlyName | PatientReportedName | ManufactureDeviceName | ModelName.

binding.name: DeviceNameType
binding.description: The type of name the device is referred by.

element.name: type
element.description: Code that specifies the property DeviceDefinitionPropetyCode (Extensible)
element.definition: Code that specifies the property DeviceDefinitionPropetyCode (Extensible).

element.name: valueQuantity
element.definition: Property value as a quantity.

element.name: valueCode
element.description: Property value as a code, e.g., NTP4 (synced to NTP)
element.definition: Property value as a code, e.g., NTP4 (synced to NTP).

element.name: systemType
element.description: The standard that is used to operate and communicate
element.definition: The standard that is used to operate and communicate.

element.name: version
element.description: The version of the standard that is used to operate and communicate
element.definition: The version of the standard that is used to operate and communicate.

element.name: deviceIdentifier
element.definition: The device identifier (DI) is a mandatory, fixed portion of a UDI that identifies the labeler and the specific version or model of a device.

element.name: issuer
element.definition: Organization that is charged with issuing UDIs for devices. For example, the US FDA issuers include : 1) GS1: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/gs1-di, 2) HIBCC: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/hibcc-dI, 3) ICCBBA for blood containers: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-blood-di, 4) ICCBA for other devices: http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/iccbba-other-di.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.definition: The identity of the authoritative source for UDI generation within a jurisdiction. All UDIs are globally unique within a single namespace with the appropriate repository uri as the system. For example, UDIs of devices managed in the U.S. by the FDA, the value is http://hl7.org/fhir/NamingSystem/fda-udi.

element.name: carrierAIDC
element.definition: The full UDI carrier of the Automatic Identification and Data Capture (AIDC) technology representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device - e.g., a barcode or RFID. Because of limitations on character sets in XML and the need to round-trip JSON data through XML, AIDC Formats *SHALL* be base64 encoded.
element.comment: The AIDC form of UDIs should be scanned or otherwise used for the identification of the device whenever possible to minimize errors in records resulting from manual transcriptions. If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

element.name: carrierHRF
element.definition: The full UDI carrier as the human readable form (HRF) representation of the barcode string as printed on the packaging of the device.
element.comment: If separate barcodes for DI and PI are present, concatenate the string with DI first and in order of human readable expression on label.

element.name: entryType
element.definition: A coded entry to indicate how the data was entered.

binding.name: UDIEntryType
binding.description: Codes to identify how UDI data was entered.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of the device version
element.definition: The type of the device version.

element.name: component
element.description: A single component of the device version
element.definition: A single component of the device version.

element.name: value
element.definition: The version text.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by the software, manufacturers, other organizations or owners. For example: handle ID.

element.name: udiDeviceIdentifier
element.definition: Unique device identifier (UDI) assigned to device label or package. Note that the Device may include multiple udiCarriers as it either may include just the udiCarrier for the jurisdiction it is sold, or for multiple jurisdictions it could have been sold.

element.name: manufacturer
element.definition: A name of the manufacturer.

element.name: deviceName
element.description: A name given to the device to identify it
element.definition: A name given to the device to identify it.

element.name: modelNumber
element.description: The model number for the device
element.definition: The model number for the device.

element.name: type
element.description: What kind of device or device system this is
element.definition: What kind of device or device system this is.

binding.name: DeviceKind
binding.description: Type of device e.g. according to official classification.

element.name: specialization
element.description: The capabilities supported on a device, the standards to which the device conforms for a particular purpose, and used for the communication
element.definition: The capabilities supported on a device, the standards to which the device conforms for a particular purpose, and used for the communication.

element.name: version
element.definition: The available versions of the device, e.g., software versions.

element.name: safety
element.definition: Safety characteristics of the device.

element.name: shelfLifeStorage
element.definition: Shelf Life and storage information.

element.name: physicalCharacteristics
element.definition: Dimensions, color etc.

element.name: languageCode
element.description: Language code for the human-readable text strings produced by the device (all supported)
element.definition: Language code for the human-readable text strings produced by the device (all supported).

element.name: capability
element.definition: Device capabilities.

element.name: property
element.description: The actual configuration settings of a device as it actually operates, e.g., regulation status, time properties
element.definition: The actual configuration settings of a device as it actually operates, e.g., regulation status, time properties.

element.name: owner
element.definition: An organization that is responsible for the provision and ongoing maintenance of the device.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details for an organization or a particular human that is responsible for the device.
element.comment: used for troubleshooting etc.

element.name: url
element.definition: A network address on which the device may be contacted directly.
element.comment: If the device is running a FHIR server, the network address should be the Base URL from which a conformance statement may be retrieved.

element.name: onlineInformation
element.definition: Access to on-line information about the device.

element.name: note
element.definition: Descriptive information, usage information or implantation information that is not captured in an existing element.

element.name: quantity
element.description: The quantity of the device present in the packaging (e.g. the number of devices present in a pack, or the number of devices in the same package of the medicinal product)
element.definition: The quantity of the device present in the packaging (e.g. the number of devices present in a pack, or the number of devices in the same package of the medicinal product).

element.name: parentDevice
element.description: The parent device it can be part of
element.definition: The parent device it can be part of.

element.name: material
element.description: A substance used to create the material(s) of which the device is made
element.definition: A substance used to create the material(s) of which the device is made.

element.name: type
element.definition: Type of capability.

element.name: description
element.definition: Description of capability.

element.name: name
element.definition: The name of the device.

element.name: type
element.description: udi-label-name | user-friendly-name | patient-reported-name | manufacturer-name | model-name | other
element.definition: The type of deviceName. UDILabelName | UserFriendlyName | PatientReportedName | ManufactureDeviceName | ModelName.

binding.name: DeviceNameType
binding.description: The type of name the device is referred by.

element.name: substance
element.definition: The substance.

element.name: alternate
element.description: Indicates an alternative material of the device
element.definition: Indicates an alternative material of the device.

element.name: allergenicIndicator
element.description: Whether the substance is a known or suspected allergen
element.definition: Whether the substance is a known or suspected allergen.

element.name: type
element.description: Code that specifies the property DeviceDefinitionPropetyCode (Extensible)
element.definition: Code that specifies the property DeviceDefinitionPropetyCode (Extensible).

element.name: valueQuantity
element.definition: Property value as a quantity.

element.name: valueCode
element.description: Property value as a code, e.g., NTP4 (synced to NTP)
element.definition: Property value as a code, e.g., NTP4 (synced to NTP).

element.name: systemType
element.description: The standard that is used to operate and communicate
element.definition: The standard that is used to operate and communicate.

element.name: version
element.description: The version of the standard that is used to operate and communicate
element.definition: The version of the standard that is used to operate and communicate.

element.name: deviceIdentifier
element.description: The identifier that is to be associated with every Device that references this DeviceDefintiion for the issuer and jurisdication porvided in the DeviceDefinition.udiDeviceIdentifier
element.definition: The identifier that is to be associated with every Device that references this DeviceDefintiion for the issuer and jurisdication porvided in the DeviceDefinition.udiDeviceIdentifier.

element.name: issuer
element.description: The organization that assigns the identifier algorithm
element.definition: The organization that assigns the identifier algorithm.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: The jurisdiction to which the deviceIdentifier applies
element.definition: The jurisdiction to which the deviceIdentifier applies.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Unique instance identifiers assigned to a device by the device or gateway software, manufacturers, other organizations or owners. For example: handle ID.
element.comment: For identifiers assigned to a device by the device or gateway software, the `system` element of the identifier should be set to the unique identifier of the device.

element.name: type
element.description: Identity of metric, for example Heart Rate or PEEP Setting
element.definition: Describes the type of the metric. For example: Heart Rate, PEEP Setting, etc.
element.comment: DeviceMetric.type can be referred to either IEEE 11073-10101 or LOINC.

binding.name: MetricType
binding.description: Describes the metric type.

element.name: unit
element.description: Unit of Measure for the Metric
element.definition: Describes the unit that an observed value determined for this metric will have. For example: Percent, Seconds, etc.
element.comment: DeviceMetric.unit can refer to either UCUM or preferable a RTMMS coding system.

binding.name: MetricUnit
binding.description: Describes the unit of the metric.

element.name: source
element.description: Describes the link to the source Device
element.definition: Describes the link to the Device that this DeviceMetric belongs to and that contains administrative device information such as manufacturer, serial number, etc.

element.name: parent
element.description: Describes the link to the parent Device
element.definition: Describes the link to the Device that this DeviceMetric belongs to and that provide information about the location of this DeviceMetric in the containment structure of the parent Device. An example would be a Device that represents a Channel. This reference can be used by a client application to distinguish DeviceMetrics that have the same type, but should be interpreted based on their containment location.

element.name: operationalStatus
element.definition: Indicates current operational state of the device. For example: On, Off, Standby, etc.

binding.name: DeviceMetricOperationalStatus
binding.description: Describes the operational status of the DeviceMetric.

element.name: color
element.description: black | red | green | yellow | blue | magenta | cyan | white
element.definition: Describes the color representation for the metric. This is often used to aid clinicians to track and identify parameter types by color. In practice, consider a Patient Monitor that has ECG/HR and Pleth for example; the parameters are displayed in different characteristic colors, such as HR-blue, BP-green, and PR and SpO2- magenta.

binding.name: DeviceMetricColor
binding.description: Describes the typical color of representation.

element.name: category
element.definition: Indicates the category of the observation generation process. A DeviceMetric can be for example a setting, measurement, or calculation.

binding.name: DeviceMetricCategory
binding.description: Describes the category of the metric.

element.name: measurementPeriod
element.definition: Describes the measurement repetition time. This is not necessarily the same as the update period. The measurement repetition time can range from milliseconds up to hours. An example for a measurement repetition time in the range of milliseconds is the sampling rate of an ECG. An example for a measurement repetition time in the range of hours is a NIBP that is triggered automatically every hour. The update period may be different than the measurement repetition time, if the device does not update the published observed value with the same frequency as it was measured.

element.name: calibration
element.description: Describes the calibrations that have been performed or that are required to be performed
element.definition: Describes the calibrations that have been performed or that are required to be performed.

element.name: type
element.definition: Describes the type of the calibration method.

binding.name: DeviceMetricCalibrationType
binding.description: Describes the type of a metric calibration.

element.name: state
element.definition: Describes the state of the calibration.

binding.name: DeviceMetricCalibrationState
binding.description: Describes the state of a metric calibration.

element.name: time
element.description: Describes the time last calibration has been performed
element.definition: Describes the time last calibration has been performed.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Identifiers assigned to this order by the orderer or by the receiver.

element.name: instantiatesCanonical
element.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this DeviceRequest.
element.comment: Note: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

element.name: instantiatesUri
element.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this DeviceRequest.
element.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: Plan/proposal/order fulfilled by this request.

element.name: priorRequest
element.definition: The request takes the place of the referenced completed or terminated request(s).

element.name: groupIdentifier
element.definition: Composite request this is part of.

element.name: status
element.description: draft | active | on-hold | revoked | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
element.definition: The status of the request.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains the codes cancelled and entered-in-error that mark the request as not currently valid.

binding.name: DeviceRequestStatus
binding.description: Codes representing the status of the request.

element.name: intent
element.description: proposal | plan | directive | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
element.definition: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, an original order or a reflex order.

binding.name: RequestIntent
binding.description: The kind of diagnostic request.

element.name: priority
element.definition: Indicates how quickly the {{title}} should be addressed with respect to other requests.

binding.name: RequestPriority
binding.description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

element.name: code
element.definition: The details of the device to be used.

binding.name: DeviceRequestCode
binding.description: Codes for devices that can be requested.

element.name: parameter
element.definition: Specific parameters for the ordered item. For example, the prism value for lenses.

element.name: subject
element.definition: The patient who will use the device.

element.name: encounter
element.definition: An encounter that provides additional context in which this request is made.

element.name: occurrence
element.description: Desired time or schedule for use
element.definition: The timing schedule for the use of the device. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

element.name: authoredOn
element.definition: When the request transitioned to being actionable.

element.name: requester
element.definition: The individual who initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

element.name: performerType
