element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the evidence variable.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the evidence variable is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the evidence variable. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the evidence variable. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the evidence variable
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the evidence variable from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the evidence variable was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the evidence variable as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the evidence variable is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the evidence variable was created).

element.name: note
element.description: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the resource.

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate evidence variable instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for evidence variable (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the evidence variable is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the evidence variable to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the evidence variable and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the evidence variable.

element.name: approvalDate
element.description: When the evidence variable was approved by publisher
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.
element.comment: The 'date' element may be more recent than the approval date because of minor changes or editorial corrections.

element.name: lastReviewDate
element.description: When the evidence variable was last reviewed
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.
element.comment: If specified, this date follows the original approval date.

element.name: effectivePeriod
element.description: When the evidence variable is expected to be used
element.definition: The period during which the evidence variable content was or is planned to be in active use.
element.comment: The effective period for a evidence variable determines when the content is applicable for usage and is independent of publication and review dates. For example, a measure intended to be used for the year 2016 might be published in 2015.

element.name: topic
element.description: The category of the EvidenceVariable, such as Education, Treatment, Assessment, etc.
element.definition: Descriptive topics related to the content of the EvidenceVariable. Topics provide a high-level categorization grouping types of EvidenceVariables that can be useful for filtering and searching.

binding.name: DefinitionTopic
binding.description: High-level categorization of the definition, used for searching, sorting, and filtering.

element.name: author
element.definition: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

element.name: editor
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

element.name: reviewer
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

element.name: endorser
element.definition: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

element.name: relatedArtifact
element.definition: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
element.comment: Each related artifact is either an attachment, or a reference to another resource, but not both.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of evidence element, a population, an exposure, or an outcome.

binding.name: EvidenceVariableType
binding.description: The possible types of variables for exposures or outcomes (E.g. Dichotomous, Continuous, Descriptive).

element.name: characteristic
element.description: What defines the members of the evidence element
element.definition: A characteristic that defines the members of the evidence element. Multiple characteristics are applied with "and" semantics.
element.comment: Characteristics can be defined flexibly to accommodate different use cases for membership criteria, ranging from simple codes, all the way to using an expression language to express the criteria.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the characteristic
element.definition: A short, natural language description of the characteristic that could be used to communicate the criteria to an end-user.

element.name: definition
element.description: What code or expression defines members?
element.definition: Define members of the evidence element using Codes (such as condition, medication, or observation), Expressions ( using an expression language such as FHIRPath or CQL) or DataRequirements (such as Diabetes diagnosis onset in the last year).

element.name: usageContext
element.definition: Use UsageContext to define the members of the population, such as Age Ranges, Genders, Settings.

element.name: exclude
element.description: Whether the characteristic includes or excludes members
element.definition: When true, members with this characteristic are excluded from the element.

element.name: participantEffective
element.description: What time period do participants cover
element.definition: Indicates what effective period the study covers.

element.name: timeFromStart
element.definition: Indicates duration from the participant's study entry.

element.name: groupMeasure
element.description: mean | median | mean-of-mean | mean-of-median | median-of-mean | median-of-median
element.definition: Indicates how elements are aggregated within the study effective period.

binding.name: GroupMeasure
binding.description: Possible group measure aggregates (E.g. Mean, Median).

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this example scenario, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this example scenario when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this example scenario is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the example scenario is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Additional identifier for the example scenario
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this example scenario when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this example scenario outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the example scenario
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the example scenario when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the example scenario author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
element.comment: There may be different example scenario instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the example scenario with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this example scenario (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the example scenario. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of this example scenario. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of example scenarios that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: experimental
element.description: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this example scenario is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of example scenarios that are appropriate for use versus not.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the example scenario was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the example scenario changes. (e.g. the 'content logical definition').
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the example scenario. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the example scenario.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the example scenario is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the example scenario. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the example scenario. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate example scenario instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for example scenario (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the example scenario is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the example scenario to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the example scenario and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the example scenario.
element.comment: nullFrequently, the copyright differs between the value set and the codes that are included. The copyright statement should clearly differentiate between these when required.

element.name: purpose
element.description: The purpose of the example, e.g. to illustrate a scenario
element.definition: What the example scenario resource is created for. This should not be used to show the business purpose of the scenario itself, but the purpose of documenting a scenario.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the example scenario. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this example scenario.

element.name: actor
element.definition: Actor participating in the resource.

element.name: instance
element.description: Each resource and each version that is present in the workflow
element.definition: Each resource and each version that is present in the workflow.

element.name: process
element.description: Each major process - a group of operations
element.definition: Each major process - a group of operations.

element.name: workflow
element.definition: Another nested workflow.

element.name: actorId
element.description: ID or acronym of the actor
element.definition: ID or acronym of actor.
element.comment: should this be called ID or acronym?

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of actor - person or system.

binding.name: ExampleScenarioActorType
binding.description: The type of actor - system or human.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the actor as shown in the page
element.definition: The name of the actor as shown in the page.
element.comment: Cardinality: is name and description 1..1?

element.name: description
element.definition: The description of the actor.
element.comment: Cardinality: is name and description 1..1?

element.name: resourceId
element.description: The id of the resource for referencing
element.definition: The id of the resource for referencing.

element.name: resourceType
element.definition: The type of the resource.

binding.name: FHIRResourceType
binding.description: The type of resource.

element.name: name
element.description: A short name for the resource instance
element.definition: A short name for the resource instance.

element.name: description
element.description: Human-friendly description of the resource instance
element.definition: Human-friendly description of the resource instance.

element.name: version
element.description: A specific version of the resource
element.definition: A specific version of the resource.

element.name: containedInstance
element.definition: Resources contained in the instance (e.g. the observations contained in a bundle).

element.name: resourceId
element.description: Each resource contained in the instance
element.definition: Each resource contained in the instance.

element.name: versionId
element.description: A specific version of a resource contained in the instance
element.definition: A specific version of a resource contained in the instance.

element.name: versionId
element.description: The identifier of a specific version of a resource
element.definition: The identifier of a specific version of a resource.

element.name: description
element.description: The description of the resource version
element.definition: The description of the resource version.

element.name: title
element.description: The diagram title of the group of operations
element.definition: The diagram title of the group of operations.

element.name: description
element.description: A longer description of the group of operations
element.definition: A longer description of the group of operations.

element.name: preConditions
element.description: Description of initial status before the process starts
element.definition: Description of initial status before the process starts.

element.name: postConditions
element.description: Description of final status after the process ends
element.definition: Description of final status after the process ends.

element.name: step
element.definition: Each step of the process.

element.name: process
element.definition: Nested process.

element.name: pause
element.description: If there is a pause in the flow
element.definition: If there is a pause in the flow.

element.name: operation
element.definition: Each interaction or action.

element.name: alternative
element.definition: Indicates an alternative step that can be taken instead of the operations on the base step in exceptional/atypical circumstances.

element.name: title
element.definition: The label to display for the alternative that gives a sense of the circumstance in which the alternative should be invoked.

element.name: description
element.description: A human-readable description of each option
element.definition: A human-readable description of the alternative explaining when the alternative should occur rather than the base step.

element.name: step
element.description: What happens in each alternative option
element.definition: What happens in each alternative option.

element.name: number
element.description: The sequential number of the interaction
element.definition: The sequential number of the interaction, e.g. 1.2.5.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of operation - CRUD.

element.name: name
element.description: The human-friendly name of the interaction
element.definition: The human-friendly name of the interaction.

element.name: initiator
element.definition: Who starts the transaction.

element.name: receiver
element.definition: Who receives the transaction.

element.name: description
element.description: A comment to be inserted in the diagram
element.definition: A comment to be inserted in the diagram.

element.name: initiatorActive
element.description: Whether the initiator is deactivated right after the transaction
element.definition: Whether the initiator is deactivated right after the transaction.

element.name: receiverActive
element.description: Whether the receiver is deactivated right after the transaction
element.definition: Whether the receiver is deactivated right after the transaction.

element.name: request
element.description: Each resource instance used by the initiator
element.definition: Each resource instance used by the initiator.

element.name: response
element.description: Each resource instance used by the responder
element.definition: Each resource instance used by the responder.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this explanation of benefit.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the resource instance.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: ExplanationOfBenefitStatus
binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

element.name: type
element.definition: The category of claim, e.g. oral, pharmacy, vision, institutional, professional.
element.comment: The majority of jurisdictions use: oral, pharmacy, vision, professional and institutional, or variants on those terms, as the general styles of claims. The valueset is extensible to accommodate other jurisdictional requirements.

binding.name: ClaimType
binding.description: The type or discipline-style of the claim.

element.name: subType
element.definition: A finer grained suite of claim type codes which may convey additional information such as Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service.
element.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes such as the US UB-04 bill type code.

binding.name: ClaimSubType
binding.description: A more granular claim typecode.

element.name: use
element.definition: A code to indicate whether the nature of the request is: to request adjudication of products and services previously rendered; or requesting authorization and adjudication for provision in the future; or requesting the non-binding adjudication of the listed products and services which could be provided in the future.

binding.name: Use
binding.description: Complete, proposed, exploratory, other.

element.name: patient
element.description: The recipient of the products and services
element.definition: The party to whom the professional services and/or products have been supplied or are being considered and for whom actual for forecast reimbursement is sought.

element.name: billablePeriod
element.description: Relevant time frame for the claim
element.definition: The period for which charges are being submitted.
element.comment: Typically this would be today or in the past for a claim, and today or in the future for preauthorizations and prodeterminations. Typically line item dates of service should fall within the billing period if one is specified.

element.name: created
element.definition: The date this resource was created.
element.comment: This field is independent of the date of creation of the resource as it may reflect the creation date of a source document prior to digitization. Typically for claims all services must be completed as of this date.

element.name: enterer
element.definition: Individual who created the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.

element.name: insurer
element.definition: The party responsible for authorization, adjudication and reimbursement.

element.name: provider
element.definition: The provider which is responsible for the claim, predetermination or preauthorization.
element.comment: Typically this field would be 1..1 where this party is responsible for the claim but not necessarily professionally responsible for the provision of the individual products and services listed below.

element.name: priority
element.definition: The provider-required urgency of processing the request. Typical values include: stat, routine deferred.
element.comment: If a claim processor is unable to complete the processing as per the priority then they should generate and error and not process the request.

binding.name: ProcessPriority
binding.description: The timeliness with which processing is required: stat, normal, deferred.

element.name: fundsReserveRequested
element.definition: A code to indicate whether and for whom funds are to be reserved for future claims.
element.comment: This field is only used for preauthorizations.

binding.name: FundsReserve
binding.description: For whom funds are to be reserved: (Patient, Provider, None).

element.name: fundsReserve
element.definition: A code, used only on a response to a preauthorization, to indicate whether the benefits payable have been reserved and for whom.
element.comment: Fund would be release by a future claim quoting the preAuthRef of this response. Examples of values include: provider, patient, none.

binding.name: FundsReserve
binding.description: For whom funds are to be reserved: (Patient, Provider, None).

element.name: related
element.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior submissions or claims for related services or for the same event.
element.comment: For example, for the original treatment and follow-up exams.

element.name: prescription
element.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy, device or vision products.

element.name: originalPrescription
element.description: Original prescription if superceded by fulfiller
element.definition: Original prescription which has been superseded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products.
element.comment: For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefor issues a new prescription for an alternate medication which has the same therapeutic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.

element.name: payee
element.definition: The party to be reimbursed for cost of the products and services according to the terms of the policy.
element.comment: Often providers agree to receive the benefits payable to reduce the near-term costs to the patient. The insurer may decline to pay the provider and may choose to pay the subscriber instead.

element.name: referral
element.definition: A reference to a referral resource.
element.comment: The referral resource which lists the date, practitioner, reason and other supporting information.

element.name: facility
element.definition: Facility where the services were provided.

element.name: claim
element.definition: The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication request: claim predetermination or preauthorization.

element.name: claimResponse
element.definition: The business identifier for the instance of the adjudication response: claim, predetermination or preauthorization response.

element.name: outcome
element.definition: The outcome of the claim, predetermination, or preauthorization processing.
element.comment: The resource may be used to indicate that: the request has been held (queued) for processing; that it has been processed and errors found (error); that no errors were found and that some of the adjudication has been undertaken (partial) or that all of the adjudication has been undertaken (complete).

binding.name: RemittanceOutcome
binding.description: The result of the claim processing.

element.name: disposition
element.definition: A human readable description of the status of the adjudication.

element.name: preAuthRef
element.definition: Reference from the Insurer which is used in later communications which refers to this adjudication.
element.comment: This value is only present on preauthorization adjudications.

element.name: preAuthRefPeriod
element.definition: The timeframe during which the supplied preauthorization reference may be quoted on claims to obtain the adjudication as provided.
element.comment: This value is only present on preauthorization adjudications.

element.name: careTeam
element.definition: The members of the team who provided the products and services.

element.name: supportingInfo
element.definition: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues.
element.comment: Often there are multiple jurisdiction specific valuesets which are required.

element.name: diagnosis
element.definition: Information about diagnoses relevant to the claim items.

element.name: procedure
element.definition: Procedures performed on the patient relevant to the billing items with the claim.

element.name: precedence
element.definition: This indicates the relative order of a series of EOBs related to different coverages for the same suite of services.

element.name: insurance
element.definition: Financial instruments for reimbursement for the health care products and services specified on the claim.
element.comment: All insurance coverages for the patient which may be applicable for reimbursement, of the products and services listed in the claim, are typically provided in the claim to allow insurers to confirm the ordering of the insurance coverages relative to local 'coordination of benefit' rules. One coverage (and only one) with 'focal=true' is to be used in the adjudication of this claim. Coverages appearing before the focal Coverage in the list, and where 'Coverage.subrogation=false', should provide a reference to the ClaimResponse containing the adjudication results of the prior claim.

element.name: accident
element.definition: Details of a accident which resulted in injuries which required the products and services listed in the claim.

element.name: item
element.definition: A claim line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of details which can also be a simple items or groups of sub-details.

element.name: addItem
element.definition: The first-tier service adjudications for payor added product or service lines.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results which are presented at the header level rather than at the line-item or add-item levels.

element.name: total
element.definition: Categorized monetary totals for the adjudication.
element.comment: Totals for amounts submitted, co-pays, benefits payable etc.

element.name: payment
element.definition: Payment details for the adjudication of the claim.

element.name: formCode
element.definition: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.
element.comment: May be needed to identify specific jurisdictional forms.

binding.name: Forms
binding.description: The forms codes.

element.name: form
element.definition: The actual form, by reference or inclusion, for printing the content or an EOB.
element.comment: Needed to permit insurers to include the actual form.

element.name: processNote
element.definition: A note that describes or explains adjudication results in a human readable form.

element.name: benefitPeriod
element.definition: The term of the benefits documented in this response.
element.comment: Not applicable when use=claim.

element.name: benefitBalance
element.definition: Balance by Benefit Category.

element.name: date
element.definition: Date of an accident event related to the products and services contained in the claim.
element.comment: The date of the accident has to precede the dates of the products and services but within a reasonable timeframe.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type or context of the accident event for the purposes of selection of potential insurance coverages and determination of coordination between insurers.

binding.name: AccidentType
binding.description: Type of accident: work place, auto, etc.

element.name: location
element.definition: The physical location of the accident event.

element.name: itemSequence
element.definition: Claim items which this service line is intended to replace.

element.name: detailSequence
element.definition: The sequence number of the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.

element.name: subDetailSequence
element.definition: The sequence number of the sub-details woithin the details within the claim item which this line is intended to replace.

element.name: provider
element.definition: The providers who are authorized for the services rendered to the patient.

element.name: productOrService
element.description: Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

binding.name: ServiceProduct
binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.name: modifier
element.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: For example, in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

binding.name: Modifiers
binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.name: programCode
element.description: Program the product or service is provided under
element.definition: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.
element.comment: For example: Neonatal program, child dental program or drug users recovery program.

binding.name: ProgramCode
binding.description: Program specific reason codes.

element.name: serviced
element.description: Date or dates of service or product delivery
element.definition: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

element.name: location
element.description: Place of service or where product was supplied
element.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

binding.name: ServicePlace
binding.description: Place where the service is rendered.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

element.name: unitPrice
element.description: Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

element.name: factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

element.name: net
element.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
element.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

element.name: bodySite
element.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).
element.comment: For example, providing a tooth code allows an insurer to identify a provider performing a filling on a tooth that was previously removed.

binding.name: OralSites
binding.description: The code for the teeth, quadrant, sextant and arch.

element.name: subSite
element.definition: A region or surface of the bodySite, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).

binding.name: Surface
binding.description: The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

element.name: noteNumber
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results.

element.name: detail
element.definition: The second-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

element.name: productOrService
element.description: Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

binding.name: ServiceProduct
binding.description: Allowable service and product codes.

element.name: modifier
element.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes to convey additional context for the product or service.
element.comment: For example, in Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for Medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

binding.name: Modifiers
binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

element.name: unitPrice
element.description: Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

element.name: factor
element.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.
element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

element.name: net
element.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
element.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

element.name: noteNumber
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results.

element.name: subDetail
element.definition: The third-tier service adjudications for payor added services.

element.description: Billing, service, product, or drug code
element.definition: When the value is a group code then this item collects a set of related claim details, otherwise this contains the product, service, drug or other billing code for the item.
element.comment: If this is an actual service or product line, i.e. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (e.g. CTP, HCPCS, USCLS, ICD10, NCPDP, DIN, RxNorm, ACHI, CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

element.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

element.name: noteNumber
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results.

element.name: category
element.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
element.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.

binding.name: BenefitCategory
binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral, medical, vision, oral-basic etc.

element.name: excluded
element.definition: True if the indicated class of service is excluded from the plan, missing or False indicates the product or service is included in the coverage.

element.name: name
element.definition: A short name or tag for the benefit.
element.comment: For example: MED01, or DENT2.

element.name: description
element.description: Description of the benefit or services covered
element.definition: A richer description of the benefit or services covered.
element.comment: For example, 'DENT2 covers 100% of basic, 50% of major but excludes Ortho, Implants and Cosmetic services'.

element.name: network
element.definition: Is a flag to indicate whether the benefits refer to in-network providers or out-of-network providers.

binding.name: BenefitNetwork
binding.description: Code to classify in or out of network services.

element.name: unit
element.definition: Indicates if the benefits apply to an individual or to the family.

binding.name: BenefitUnit
binding.description: Unit covered/serviced - individual or family.

element.name: term
element.definition: The term or period of the values such as 'maximum lifetime benefit' or 'maximum annual visits'.

binding.name: BenefitTerm
binding.description: Coverage unit - annual, lifetime.

element.name: financial
element.definition: Benefits Used to date.

element.name: type
element.definition: Classification of benefit being provided.
element.comment: For example: deductible, visits, benefit amount.

binding.name: BenefitType
binding.description: Deductable, visits, co-pay, etc.

element.name: allowed
element.definition: The quantity of the benefit which is permitted under the coverage.

element.name: used
element.definition: The quantity of the benefit which have been consumed to date.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify care team entries.

element.name: provider
element.definition: Member of the team who provided the product or service.

element.name: responsible
element.definition: The party who is billing and/or responsible for the claimed products or services.
element.comment: Responsible might not be required when there is only a single provider listed.

element.name: role
element.definition: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisciplinary team.
element.comment: Role might not be required when there is only a single provider listed.

binding.name: CareTeamRole
binding.description: The role codes for the care team members.

element.name: qualification
element.definition: The qualification of the practitioner which is applicable for this service.

binding.name: ProviderQualification
binding.description: Provider professional qualifications.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify diagnosis entries.
element.comment: Diagnosis are presented in list order to their expected importance: primary, secondary, etc.

element.name: diagnosis
element.definition: The nature of illness or problem in a coded form or as a reference to an external defined Condition.

binding.name: ICD10
binding.description: ICD10 Diagnostic codes.

element.name: type
element.description: Timing or nature of the diagnosis
element.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.
element.comment: For example: admitting, primary, secondary, discharge.

binding.name: DiagnosisType
binding.description: The type of the diagnosis: admitting, principal, discharge.

element.name: onAdmission
element.definition: Indication of whether the diagnosis was present on admission to a facility.

binding.name: DiagnosisOnAdmission
binding.description: Present on admission.

element.name: packageCode
element.definition: A package billing code or bundle code used to group products and services to a particular health condition (such as heart attack) which is based on a predetermined grouping code system.
element.comment: For example, DRG (Diagnosis Related Group) or a bundled billing code. A patient may have a diagnosis of a Myocardio-infarction and a DRG for HeartAttack would assigned. The Claim item (and possible subsequent claims) would refer to the DRG for those line items that were for services related to the heart attack event.

binding.name: DiagnosisRelatedGroup
binding.description: The DRG codes associated with the diagnosis.

element.name: focal
element.description: Coverage to be used for adjudication
element.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is to be used for adjudication of this claim when set to true.
element.comment: A patient may (will) have multiple insurance policies which provide reimbursement for healthcare services and products. For example, a person may also be covered by their spouse's policy and both appear in the list (and may be from the same insurer). This flag will be set to true for only one of the listed policies and that policy will be used for adjudicating this claim. Other claims would be created to request adjudication against the other listed policies.

element.name: coverage
element.definition: Reference to the insurance card level information contained in the Coverage resource. The coverage issuing insurer will use these details to locate the patient's actual coverage within the insurer's information system.

element.name: preAuthRef
element.definition: Reference numbers previously provided by the insurer to the provider to be quoted on subsequent claims containing services or products related to the prior authorization.
element.comment: This value is an alphanumeric string that may be provided over the phone, via text, via paper, or within a ClaimResponse resource and is not a FHIR Identifier.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify item entries.

element.name: careTeamSequence
element.definition: Care team members related to this service or product.

element.name: diagnosisSequence
element.definition: Diagnoses applicable for this service or product.

element.name: procedureSequence
element.definition: Procedures applicable for this service or product.

element.name: informationSequence
element.definition: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information applicable for this service or product.

element.name: revenue
element.definition: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

binding.name: RevenueCenter
binding.description: Codes for the revenue or cost centers supplying the service and/or products.

element.name: category
element.definition: Code to identify the general type of benefits under which products and services are provided.
element.comment: Examples include Medical Care, Periodontics, Renal Dialysis, Vision Coverage.

binding.name: BenefitCategory
binding.description: Benefit categories such as: oral, medical, vision, oral-basic etc.

If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped e.g. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

binding.name: Modifiers
binding.description: Item type or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or an appliance was lost or stolen.

element.name: programCode
element.description: Program the product or service is provided under
element.definition: Identifies the program under which this may be recovered.
element.comment: For example: Neonatal program, child dental program or drug users recovery program.

binding.name: ProgramCode
binding.description: Program specific reason codes.

element.name: serviced
element.description: Date or dates of service or product delivery
element.definition: The date or dates when the service or product was supplied, performed or completed.

element.name: location
element.description: Place of service or where product was supplied
element.definition: Where the product or service was provided.

binding.name: ServicePlace
binding.description: Place where the service is rendered.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

element.name: unitPrice
element.description: Fee, charge or cost per item
element.definition: If the item is not a group then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the details of the group.

element.comment: To show a 10% senior's discount, the value entered is: 0.90 (1.00 - 0.10).

element.name: net
element.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an additional service or product or charge.
element.comment: For example, the formula: quantity * unitPrice * factor = net. Quantity and factor are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

element.name: udi
element.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

element.name: bodySite
element.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc.).
element.comment: For example: Providing a tooth code, allows an insurer to identify a provider performing a filling on a tooth that was previously removed.

binding.name: OralSites
binding.description: The code for the teeth, quadrant, sextant and arch.

element.name: subSite
element.definition: A region or surface of the bodySite, e.g. limb region or tooth surface(s).

binding.name: Surface
binding.description: The code for the tooth surface and surface combinations.

element.name: encounter
element.description: Encounters related to this billed item
element.definition: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.

element.name: noteNumber
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: If this item is a group then the values here are a summary of the adjudication of the detail items. If this item is a simple product or service then this is the result of the adjudication of this item.

element.name: detail
element.definition: Second-tier of goods and services.

element.name: category
element.definition: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in-aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.
element.comment: For example, codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.

binding.name: Adjudication
binding.description: The adjudication codes.

element.name: reason
element.definition: A code supporting the understanding of the adjudication result and explaining variance from expected amount.
element.comment: For example, may indicate that the funds for this benefit type have been exhausted.

binding.name: AdjudicationReason
binding.description: Adjudication reason codes.

element.name: amount
element.definition: Monetary amount associated with the category.
element.comment: For example, amount submitted, eligible amount, co-payment, and benefit payable.

element.name: value
element.definition: A non-monetary value associated with the category. Mutually exclusive to the amount element above.
element.comment: For example: eligible percentage or co-payment percentage.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A claim detail line. Either a simple (a product or service) or a 'group' of sub-details which are simple items.

element.name: revenue
element.definition: The type of revenue or cost center providing the product and/or service.

element.name: udi
element.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

element.name: noteNumber
element.definition: The numbers associated with notes below which apply to the adjudication of this item.

element.name: adjudication
element.definition: The adjudication results.

element.name: type
element.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

binding.name: PayeeType
binding.description: A code for the party to be reimbursed.

element.name: party
element.definition: Reference to the individual or organization to whom any payment will be made.
element.comment: Not required if the payee is 'subscriber' or 'provider'.

element.name: type
element.definition: Whether this represents partial or complete payment of the benefits payable.

binding.name: PaymentType
binding.description: The type (partial, complete) of the payment.

element.name: adjustment
element.definition: Total amount of all adjustments to this payment included in this transaction which are not related to this claim's adjudication.
element.comment: Insurers will deduct amounts owing from the provider (adjustment), such as a prior overpayment, from the amount owing to the provider (benefits payable) when payment is made to the provider.

element.name: adjustmentReason
element.definition: Reason for the payment adjustment.

binding.name: PaymentAdjustmentReason
binding.description: Payment Adjustment reason codes.

element.name: date
element.definition: Estimated date the payment will be issued or the actual issue date of payment.

element.name: amount
element.definition: Benefits payable less any payment adjustment.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Issuer's unique identifier for the payment instrument.
element.comment: For example: EFT number or check number.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify procedure entries.

element.name: type
element.definition: When the condition was observed or the relative ranking.

binding.name: ProcedureType
binding.description: Example procedure type codes.

element.name: date
element.definition: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed.

element.name: procedure
element.definition: The code or reference to a Procedure resource which identifies the clinical intervention performed.

binding.name: ICD10_Procedures
binding.description: ICD10 Procedure codes.

element.name: udi
element.definition: Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

element.name: number
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify a note entry.

element.name: type
element.definition: The business purpose of the note text.

binding.name: NoteType
binding.description: The presentation types of notes.

element.name: text
element.definition: The explanation or description associated with the processing.

element.name: language
element.definition: A code to define the language used in the text of the note.
element.comment: Only required if the language is different from the resource language.

binding.name: Language
binding.description: A human language.

element.name: claim
element.definition: Reference to a related claim.

element.name: relationship
element.description: How the reference claim is related
element.definition: A code to convey how the claims are related.
element.comment: For example, prior claim or umbrella.

binding.name: RelatedClaimRelationship
binding.description: Relationship of this claim to a related Claim.

element.name: reference
element.definition: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains.
element.comment: For example, Property/Casualty insurer claim number or Workers Compensation case number.

element.name: sequence
element.definition: A number to uniquely identify supporting information entries.

element.name: category
element.definition: The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.
element.comment: This may contain a category for the local bill type codes.

binding.name: InformationCategory
binding.description: The valuset used for additional information category codes.

element.name: code
element.definition: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient for which care is sought.
element.comment: This may contain the local bill type codes such as the US UB-04 bill type code.

binding.name: InformationCode
binding.description: The valuset used for additional information codes.

element.name: timing
element.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

element.name: value
element.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.
element.comment: Could be used to provide references to other resources, document. For example, could contain a PDF in an Attachment of the Police Report for an Accident.

element.name: reason
element.definition: Provides the reason in the situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.
element.comment: For example: the reason for the additional stay, or why a tooth is missing.

binding.name: MissingReason
binding.description: Reason codes for the missing teeth.

element.name: category
element.definition: A code to indicate the information type of this adjudication record. Information types may include: the value submitted, maximum values or percentages allowed or payable under the plan, amounts that the patient is responsible for in aggregate or pertaining to this item, amounts paid by other coverages, and the benefit payable for this item.
element.comment: For example, codes indicating: Co-Pay, deductible, eligible, benefit, tax, etc.

binding.name: Adjudication
binding.description: The adjudication codes.

element.name: amount
element.definition: Monetary total amount associated with the category.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the condition
element.definition: A brief, natural language description of the condition that effectively communicates the intended semantics.

element.name: name
element.description: Short name assigned to expression for reuse
element.definition: A short name assigned to the expression to allow for multiple reuse of the expression in the context where it is defined.

element.name: language
element.definition: The media type of the language for the expression.

binding.name: ExpressionLanguage
binding.description: The media type of the expression language.

element.name: expression
element.definition: An expression in the specified language that returns a value.

element.name: reference
element.definition: A URI that defines where the expression is found.
element.comment: If both a reference and an expression is found, the reference SHALL point to the same expression.

element.name: url
element.description: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.name: value
element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this family member history by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

element.name: instantiatesCanonical
element.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this FamilyMemberHistory.

element.name: instantiatesUri
element.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this FamilyMemberHistory.
element.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

element.name: status
element.definition: A code specifying the status of the record of the family history of a specific family member.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: FamilyHistoryStatus
binding.description: A code that identifies the status of the family history record.

element.name: dataAbsentReason
element.definition: Describes why the family member's history is not available.

binding.name: FamilyHistoryAbsentReason
binding.description: Codes describing the reason why a family member's history is not available.

element.name: patient
element.definition: The person who this history concerns.

element.name: date
element.description: When history was recorded or last updated
element.definition: The date (and possibly time) when the family member history was recorded or last updated.
element.comment: This should be captured even if the same as the date on the List aggregating the full family history.

element.name: name
element.definition: This will either be a name or a description; e.g. "Aunt Susan", "my cousin with the red hair".

element.name: relationship
element.definition: The type of relationship this person has to the patient (father, mother, brother etc.).

binding.name: FamilialRelationship
binding.description: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the related person being described in the family member history.

element.name: sex
element.definition: The birth sex of the family member.
element.comment: This element should ideally reflect whether the individual is genetically male or female. However, as reported information based on the knowledge of the patient or reporting friend/relative, there may be situations where the reported sex might not be totally accurate. E.g. 'Aunt Sue' might be XY rather than XX. Questions soliciting this information should be phrased to encourage capture of genetic sex where known. However, systems performing analysis should also allow for the possibility of imprecision with this element.

binding.name: Sex
binding.description: Codes describing the sex assigned at birth as documented on the birth registration.

element.name: born
element.definition: The actual or approximate date of birth of the relative.

element.name: age
element.definition: The age of the relative at the time the family member history is recorded.
element.comment: use estimatedAge to indicate whether the age is actual or not.

element.name: estimatedAge
element.definition: If true, indicates that the age value specified is an estimated value.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the fact that age is estimated can/should change the results of any algorithm that calculates based on the specified age.

element.name: deceased
element.definition: Deceased flag or the actual or approximate age of the relative at the time of death for the family member history record.

element.name: reasonCode
element.description: Why was family member history performed?
element.definition: Describes why the family member history occurred in coded or textual form.
element.comment: Textual reasons can be captured using reasonCode.text.

binding.name: FamilyHistoryReason
binding.description: Codes indicating why the family member history was done.

element.name: reasonReference
element.description: Why was family member history performed?
element.definition: Indicates a Condition, Observation, AllergyIntolerance, or QuestionnaireResponse that justifies this family member history event.

element.name: note
element.definition: This property allows a non condition-specific note to the made about the related person. Ideally, the note would be in the condition property, but this is not always possible.

element.name: condition
element.description: Condition that the related person had
element.definition: The significant Conditions (or condition) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one condition per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per condition.

element.name: code
element.definition: The actual condition specified. Could be a coded condition (like MI or Diabetes) or a less specific string like 'cancer' depending on how much is known about the condition and the capabilities of the creating system.

binding.name: ConditionCode
binding.description: Identification of the Condition or diagnosis.

element.name: outcome
element.definition: Indicates what happened following the condition. If the condition resulted in death, deceased date is captured on the relation.

binding.name: ConditionOutcome
binding.description: The result of the condition for the patient; e.g. death, permanent disability, temporary disability, etc.

element.name: contributedToDeath
element.description: Whether the condition contributed to the cause of death
element.definition: This condition contributed to the cause of death of the related person. If contributedToDeath is not populated, then it is unknown.

element.name: onset
element.definition: Either the age of onset, range of approximate age or descriptive string can be recorded. For conditions with multiple occurrences, this describes the first known occurrence.

element.name: note
element.definition: An area where general notes can be placed about this specific condition.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this flag by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

element.name: status
element.definition: Supports basic workflow.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: FlagStatus
binding.description: Indicates whether this flag is active and needs to be displayed to a user, or whether it is no longer needed or was entered in error.

element.name: category
element.definition: Allows a flag to be divided into different categories like clinical, administrative etc. Intended to be used as a means of filtering which flags are displayed to particular user or in a given context.
element.comment: The value set will often need to be adjusted based on local business rules and usage context.

binding.name: FlagCategory
binding.description: A general category for flags for filtering/display purposes.

element.name: code
element.description: Coded or textual message to display to user
element.definition: The coded value or textual component of the flag to display to the user.
element.comment: If non-coded, use CodeableConcept.text. This element should always be included in the narrative.

binding.name: FlagCode
binding.description: Detail codes identifying specific flagged issues.

element.name: subject
element.definition: The patient, location, group, organization, or practitioner etc. this is about record this flag is associated with.

element.name: period
element.description: Time period when flag is active
element.definition: The period of time from the activation of the flag to inactivation of the flag. If the flag is active, the end of the period should be unspecified.

element.name: encounter
element.definition: This alert is only relevant during the encounter.
element.comment: If both Flag.encounter and Flag.period are valued, then Flag.period.start shall not be before Encounter.period.start and Flag.period.end shall not be after Encounter.period.end.

element.name: author
element.definition: The person, organization or device that created the flag.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this goal by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

element.name: lifecycleStatus
element.description: proposed | planned | accepted | active | on-hold | completed | cancelled | entered-in-error | rejected
element.definition: The state of the goal throughout its lifecycle.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the lifecycleStatus contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: GoalLifecycleStatus
binding.description: Codes that reflect the current state of a goal and whether the goal is still being targeted.

element.name: achievementStatus
element.description: in-progress | improving | worsening | no-change | achieved | sustaining | not-achieved | no-progress | not-attainable
element.definition: Describes the progression, or lack thereof, towards the goal against the target.

binding.name: GoalAchievementStatus
binding.description: Indicates the progression, or lack thereof, towards the goal against the target.

element.name: category
element.definition: Indicates a category the goal falls within.

binding.name: GoalCategory
binding.description: Codes for grouping and sorting goals.

element.name: priority
element.definition: Identifies the mutually agreed level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the goal.
element.comment: Extensions are available to track priorities as established by each participant (i.e. Priority from the patient's perspective, different practitioners' perspectives, family member's perspectives) The ordinal extension on Coding can be used to convey a numerically comparable ranking to priority. (Keep in mind that different coding systems may use a "low value=important".

binding.name: GoalPriority
binding.description: The level of importance associated with a goal.

element.name: description
element.definition: Human-readable and/or coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".
element.comment: If no code is available, use CodeableConcept.text.

binding.name: GoalDescription
binding.description: Codes providing the details of a particular goal. This will generally be system or implementation guide-specific. In many systems, only the text element will be used.

element.name: subject
element.description: Who this goal is intended for
element.definition: Identifies the patient, group or organization for whom the goal is being established.

element.name: start
element.definition: The date or event after which the goal should begin being pursued.

binding.name: GoalStartEvent
binding.description: Codes describing events that can trigger the initiation of a goal.

element.name: target
element.definition: Indicates what should be done by when.
element.comment: When multiple targets are present for a single goal instance, all targets must be met for the overall goal to be met.

constraint.name: gol-1
constraint.message: Goal.target.measure is required if Goal.target.detail is populated

element.name: statusDate
element.definition: Identifies when the current status. I.e. When initially created, when achieved, when cancelled, etc.
element.comment: To see the date for past statuses, query history.

element.name: statusReason
element.definition: Captures the reason for the current status.
element.comment: This will typically be captured for statuses such as rejected, on-hold or cancelled, but could be present for others.

element.name: expressedBy
element.definition: Indicates whose goal this is - patient goal, practitioner goal, etc.
element.comment: This is the individual responsible for establishing the goal, not necessarily who recorded it. (For that, use the Provenance resource.).

element.name: addresses
element.definition: The identified conditions and other health record elements that are intended to be addressed by the goal.

element.name: note
element.definition: Any comments related to the goal.
element.comment: May be used for progress notes, concerns or other related information that doesn't actually describe the goal itself.

element.name: outcomeCode
element.description: What result was achieved regarding the goal?
element.definition: Identifies the change (or lack of change) at the point when the status of the goal is assessed.
element.comment: Note that this should not duplicate the goal status.

binding.name: GoalOutcome
binding.description: The result of the goal; e.g. "25% increase in shoulder mobility", "Anxiety reduced to moderate levels". "15 kg weight loss sustained over 6 months".

element.name: outcomeReference
element.definition: Details of what's changed (or not changed).
element.comment: The goal outcome is independent of the outcome of the related activities. For example, if the Goal is to achieve a target body weight of 150 lb and a care plan activity is defined to diet, then the care plans activity outcome could be calories consumed whereas goal outcome is an observation for the actual body weight measured.

element.name: measure
element.description: The parameter whose value is being tracked
element.definition: The parameter whose value is being tracked, e.g. body weight, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

binding.name: GoalTargetMeasure
binding.description: Codes to identify the value being tracked, e.g. body weight, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

element.name: detail
element.description: The target value to be achieved
element.definition: The target value of the focus to be achieved to signify the fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds, 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any focus value at or above the low value.
element.comment: A CodeableConcept with just a text would be used instead of a string if the field was usually coded, or if the type associated with the Goal.target.measure defines a coded value.

binding.name: GoalTargetDetail
binding.description: Codes to identify the target value of the focus to be achieved to signify the fulfillment of the goal.

element.name: due
element.definition: Indicates either the date or the duration after start by which the goal should be met.

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this graph definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this graph definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this graph definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the graph definition is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the graph definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the graph definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the graph definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
element.comment: There may be different graph definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the graph definition with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this graph definition (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the graph definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of this graph definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of graph definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: experimental
element.description: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this graph definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of graph definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the graph definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the graph definition changes.
