element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the graph definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the graph definition.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the graph definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the graph definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the graph definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the graph definition
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the graph definition from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the graph definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the graph definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the graph definition is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the graph definition was created).

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate graph definition instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for graph definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the graph definition is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the graph definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: purpose
element.description: Why this graph definition is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this graph definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the graph definition. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this graph definition.

element.name: start
element.description: Type of resource at which the graph starts
element.definition: The type of FHIR resource at which instances of this graph start.

binding.name: ResourceType
binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

element.name: profile
element.definition: The profile that describes the use of the base resource.
element.comment: The code does not include the '$' prefix that is always included in the URL when the operation is invoked.

element.name: link
element.description: Links this graph makes rules about
element.definition: Links this graph makes rules about.

element.name: path
element.description: Path in the resource that contains the link
element.definition: A FHIR expression that identifies one of FHIR References to other resources.
element.comment: The path expression cannot contain a resolve() function. If there is no path, the link is a reverse lookup, using target.params. If the path is "*" then this means all references in the resource.

element.name: sliceName
element.definition: Which slice (if profiled).

element.name: min
element.definition: Minimum occurrences for this link.

element.name: max
element.definition: Maximum occurrences for this link.

element.name: description
element.definition: Information about why this link is of interest in this graph definition.

element.name: target
element.definition: Potential target for the link.

element.name: type
element.description: Type of resource this link refers to
element.definition: Type of resource this link refers to.

binding.name: ResourceType
binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

element.name: params
element.definition: A set of parameters to look up.
element.comment: At least one of the parameters must have the value {ref} which identifies the focus resource.

element.name: profile
element.definition: Profile for the target resource.

element.name: compartment
element.definition: Compartment Consistency Rules.

element.name: link
element.definition: Additional links from target resource.

element.name: use
element.definition: Defines how the compartment rule is used - whether it it is used to test whether resources are subject to the rule, or whether it is a rule that must be followed.
element.comment: All conditional rules are evaluated; if they are true, then the rules are evaluated.

binding.name: GraphCompartmentUse
binding.description: Defines how a compartment rule is used.

element.name: code
element.definition: Identifies the compartment.

binding.name: CompartmentCode
binding.description: Identifies a compartment.

element.name: rule
element.definition: identical | matching | different | no-rule | custom.

binding.name: GraphCompartmentRule
binding.description: How a compartment must be linked.

element.name: expression
element.description: Custom rule, as a FHIRPath expression
element.definition: Custom rule, as a FHIRPath expression.

element.name: description
element.definition: Documentation for FHIRPath expression.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: A unique business identifier for this group.

element.name: active
element.description: Whether this group's record is in active use
element.definition: Indicates whether the record for the group is available for use or is merely being retained for historical purposes.

element.name: type
element.description: person | animal | practitioner | device | medication | substance
element.definition: Identifies the broad classification of the kind of resources the group includes.
element.comment: Group members SHALL be of the appropriate resource type (Patient for person or animal; or Practitioner, Device, Medication or Substance for the other types.).

binding.name: GroupType
binding.description: Types of resources that are part of group.

element.name: actual
element.definition: If true, indicates that the resource refers to a specific group of real individuals. If false, the group defines a set of intended individuals.

element.name: code
element.definition: Provides a specific type of resource the group includes; e.g. "cow", "syringe", etc.
element.comment: This would generally be omitted for Person resources.

binding.name: GroupKind
binding.description: Kind of particular resource; e.g. cow, syringe, lake, etc.

element.name: name
element.definition: A label assigned to the group for human identification and communication.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: A count of the number of resource instances that are part of the group.
element.comment: Note that the quantity may be less than the number of members if some of the members are not active.

element.name: managingEntity
element.description: Entity that is the custodian of the Group's definition
element.definition: Entity responsible for defining and maintaining Group characteristics and/or registered members.
element.comment: This does not strictly align with ownership of a herd or flock, but may suffice to represent that relationship in simple cases. More complex cases will require an extension.

element.name: characteristic
element.description: Include / Exclude group members by Trait
element.definition: Identifies traits whose presence r absence is shared by members of the group.
element.comment: All the identified characteristics must be true for an entity to a member of the group.

element.name: member
element.description: Who or what is in group
element.definition: Identifies the resource instances that are members of the group.

element.name: code
element.definition: A code that identifies the kind of trait being asserted.

binding.name: GroupCharacteristicKind
binding.description: List of characteristics used to describe group members; e.g. gender, age, owner, location, etc.

element.name: value
element.definition: The value of the trait that holds (or does not hold - see 'exclude') for members of the group.
element.comment: For Range, it means members of the group have a value that falls somewhere within the specified range.

binding.name: GroupCharacteristicValue
binding.description: Value of descriptive member characteristic; e.g. red, male, pneumonia, Caucasian, etc.

element.name: exclude
element.definition: If true, indicates the characteristic is one that is NOT held by members of the group.
element.comment: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications cannot wrongly include excluded members as included or vice versa.

element.name: period
element.description: Period over which characteristic is tested
element.definition: The period over which the characteristic is tested; e.g. the patient had an operation during the month of June.

element.name: entity
element.definition: A reference to the entity that is a member of the group. Must be consistent with Group.type. If the entity is another group, then the type must be the same.

element.name: period
element.description: Period member belonged to the group
element.definition: The period that the member was in the group, if known.

element.name: inactive
element.description: If member is no longer in group
element.definition: A flag to indicate that the member is no longer in the group, but previously may have been a member.

element.name: requestIdentifier
element.description: The identifier of the request associated with this response, if any
element.definition: The identifier of the request associated with this response. If an identifier was given as part of the request, it will be reproduced here to enable the requester to more easily identify the response in a multi-request scenario.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Allows a service to provide unique, business identifiers for the response.

element.name: module
element.definition: An identifier, CodeableConcept or canonical reference to the guidance that was requested.

element.name: status
element.description: success | data-requested | data-required | in-progress | failure | entered-in-error
element.definition: The status of the response. If the evaluation is completed successfully, the status will indicate success. However, in order to complete the evaluation, the engine may require more information. In this case, the status will be data-required, and the response will contain a description of the additional required information. If the evaluation completed successfully, but the engine determines that a potentially more accurate response could be provided if more data was available, the status will be data-requested, and the response will contain a description of the additional requested information.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: GuidanceResponseStatus
binding.description: The status of a guidance response.

element.name: subject
element.description: Patient the request was performed for
element.definition: The patient for which the request was processed.

element.name: encounter
element.description: Encounter during which the response was returned
element.definition: The encounter during which this response was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official copmletion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter.

element.name: occurrenceDateTime
element.description: When the guidance response was processed
element.definition: Indicates when the guidance response was processed.

element.name: performer
element.definition: Provides a reference to the device that performed the guidance.

element.name: reasonCode
element.definition: Describes the reason for the guidance response in coded or textual form.

element.name: reasonReference
element.definition: Indicates the reason the request was initiated. This is typically provided as a parameter to the evaluation and echoed by the service, although for some use cases, such as subscription- or event-based scenarios, it may provide an indication of the cause for the response.

element.name: note
element.definition: Provides a mechanism to communicate additional information about the response.

element.name: evaluationMessage
element.description: Messages resulting from the evaluation of the artifact or artifacts
element.definition: Messages resulting from the evaluation of the artifact or artifacts. As part of evaluating the request, the engine may produce informational or warning messages. These messages will be provided by this element.

element.name: outputParameters
element.description: The output parameters of the evaluation, if any
element.definition: The output parameters of the evaluation, if any. Many modules will result in the return of specific resources such as procedure or communication requests that are returned as part of the operation result. However, modules may define specific outputs that would be returned as the result of the evaluation, and these would be returned in this element.

element.name: result
element.definition: The actions, if any, produced by the evaluation of the artifact.

element.name: dataRequirement
element.definition: If the evaluation could not be completed due to lack of information, or additional information would potentially result in a more accurate response, this element will a description of the data required in order to proceed with the evaluation. A subsequent request to the service should include this data.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: External identifiers for this item.

element.name: active
element.description: Whether this HealthcareService record is in active use
element.definition: This flag is used to mark the record to not be used. This is not used when a center is closed for maintenance, or for holidays, the notAvailable period is to be used for this.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it may be used to mark that the resource was created in error.

element.name: providedBy
element.definition: The organization that provides this healthcare service.
element.comment: This property is recommended to be the same as the Location's managingOrganization, and if not provided should be interpreted as such. If the Location does not have a managing Organization, then this property should be populated.

element.name: category
element.description: Broad category of service being performed or delivered
element.definition: Identifies the broad category of service being performed or delivered.
element.comment: Selecting a Service Category then determines the list of relevant service types that can be selected in the primary service type.

binding.name: service-category
binding.description: A category of the service(s) that could be provided.

element.name: type
element.description: Type of service that may be delivered or performed
element.definition: The specific type of service that may be delivered or performed.

binding.name: service-type
binding.description: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty).

element.name: specialty
element.definition: Collection of specialties handled by the service site. This is more of a medical term.

binding.name: service-specialty
binding.description: A specialty that a healthcare service may provide.

element.name: location
element.description: Location(s) where service may be provided
element.definition: The location(s) where this healthcare service may be provided.

element.name: name
element.description: Description of service as presented to a consumer while searching
element.definition: Further description of the service as it would be presented to a consumer while searching.

element.name: comment
element.description: Additional description and/or any specific issues not covered elsewhere
element.definition: Any additional description of the service and/or any specific issues not covered by the other attributes, which can be displayed as further detail under the serviceName.
element.comment: Would expect that a user would not see this information on a search results, and it would only be available when viewing the complete details of the service.

element.name: extraDetails
element.description: Extra details about the service that can't be placed in the other fields
element.definition: Extra details about the service that can't be placed in the other fields.

element.name: photo
element.description: Facilitates quick identification of the service
element.definition: If there is a photo/symbol associated with this HealthcareService, it may be included here to facilitate quick identification of the service in a list.

element.name: telecom
element.description: Contacts related to the healthcare service
element.definition: List of contacts related to this specific healthcare service.
element.comment: If this is empty, then refer to the location's contacts.

element.name: coverageArea
element.description: Location(s) service is intended for/available to
element.definition: The location(s) that this service is available to (not where the service is provided).
element.comment: The locations referenced by the coverage area can include both specific locations, including areas, and also conceptual domains too (mode = kind), such as a physical area (tri-state area) and some other attribute (covered by Example Care Organization). These types of Locations are often not managed by any specific organization. This could also include generic locations such as "in-home".

element.name: serviceProvisionCode
element.description: Conditions under which service is available/offered
element.definition: The code(s) that detail the conditions under which the healthcare service is available/offered.
element.comment: The provision means being commissioned by, contractually obliged or financially sourced. Types of costings that may apply to this healthcare service, such if the service may be available for free, some discounts available, or fees apply.

binding.name: ServiceProvisionConditions
binding.description: The code(s) that detail the conditions under which the healthcare service is available/offered.

element.name: eligibility
element.description: Specific eligibility requirements required to use the service
element.definition: Does this service have specific eligibility requirements that need to be met in order to use the service?

element.name: program
element.description: Programs that this service is applicable to
element.definition: Programs that this service is applicable to.
element.comment: Programs are often defined externally to an Organization, commonly by governments; e.g. Home and Community Care Programs, Homeless Program, .

binding.name: Program
binding.description: Government or local programs that this service applies to.

element.name: characteristic
element.definition: Collection of characteristics (attributes).
element.comment: These could be such things as is wheelchair accessible.

binding.name: ServiceCharacteristic
binding.description: A custom attribute that could be provided at a service (e.g. Wheelchair accessibiliy).

element.name: communication
element.description: The language that this service is offered in
element.definition: Some services are specifically made available in multiple languages, this property permits a directory to declare the languages this is offered in. Typically this is only provided where a service operates in communities with mixed languages used.
element.comment: When using this property it indicates that the service is available with this language, it is not derived from the practitioners, and not all are required to use this language, just that this language is available while scheduling.

binding.name: Language
binding.description: A human language.

element.name: referralMethod
element.description: Ways that the service accepts referrals
element.definition: Ways that the service accepts referrals, if this is not provided then it is implied that no referral is required.

binding.name: ReferralMethod
binding.description: The methods of referral can be used when referring to a specific HealthCareService resource.

element.name: appointmentRequired
element.description: If an appointment is required for access to this service
element.definition: Indicates whether or not a prospective consumer will require an appointment for a particular service at a site to be provided by the Organization. Indicates if an appointment is required for access to this service.

element.name: availableTime
element.description: Times the Service Site is available
element.definition: A collection of times that the Service Site is available.
element.comment: More detailed availability information may be provided in associated Schedule/Slot resources.

element.name: notAvailable
element.description: Not available during this time due to provided reason
element.definition: The HealthcareService is not available during this period of time due to the provided reason.

element.name: availabilityExceptions
element.definition: A description of site availability exceptions, e.g. public holiday availability. Succinctly describing all possible exceptions to normal site availability as details in the available Times and not available Times.

element.name: endpoint
element.description: Technical endpoints providing access to electronic services operated for the healthcare service
element.definition: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the specific healthcare services defined at this resource.

element.name: daysOfWeek
element.description: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
element.definition: Indicates which days of the week are available between the start and end Times.

binding.name: DaysOfWeek
binding.description: The days of the week.

element.name: allDay
element.definition: Is this always available? (hence times are irrelevant) e.g. 24 hour service.

element.name: availableStartTime
element.description: Opening time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
element.definition: The opening time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.
element.comment: The time zone is expected to be for where this HealthcareService is provided at.

element.name: availableEndTime
element.description: Closing time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
element.definition: The closing time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.
element.comment: The time zone is expected to be for where this HealthcareService is provided at.

element.name: code
element.definition: Coded value for the eligibility.

binding.name: ServiceEligibility
binding.description: Coded values underwhich a specific service is made available.

element.name: comment
element.description: Describes the eligibility conditions for the service
element.definition: Describes the eligibility conditions for the service.
element.comment: The description of service eligibility should, in general, not exceed one or two paragraphs. It should be sufficient for a prospective consumer to determine if they are likely to be eligible or not. Where eligibility requirements and conditions are complex, it may simply be noted that an eligibility assessment is required. Where eligibility is determined by an outside source, such as an Act of Parliament, this should be noted, preferably with a reference to a commonly available copy of the source document such as a web page.

element.name: description
element.description: Reason presented to the user explaining why time not available
element.definition: The reason that can be presented to the user as to why this time is not available.

element.name: during
element.description: Service not available from this date
element.definition: Service is not available (seasonally or for a public holiday) from this date.

element.name: use
element.description: usual | official | temp | nickname | anonymous | old | maiden
element.definition: Identifies the purpose for this name.
element.comment: Applications can assume that a name is current unless it explicitly says that it is temporary or old.

binding.name: NameUse
binding.description: The use of a human name.

element.name: text
element.description: Text representation of the full name
element.definition: Specifies the entire name as it should be displayed e.g. on an application UI. This may be provided instead of or as well as the specific parts.
element.comment: Can provide both a text representation and parts. Applications updating a name SHALL ensure that when both text and parts are present, no content is included in the text that isn't found in a part.

element.name: family
element.definition: The part of a name that links to the genealogy. In some cultures (e.g. Eritrea) the family name of a son is the first name of his father.
element.comment: Family Name may be decomposed into specific parts using extensions (de, nl, es related cultures).

element.name: given
element.description: Given names (not always 'first'). Includes middle names
element.definition: Given name.
element.comment: If only initials are recorded, they may be used in place of the full name parts. Initials may be separated into multiple given names but often aren't due to paractical limitations. This element is not called "first name" since given names do not always come first.

element.name: prefix
element.description: Parts that come before the name
element.definition: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the start of the name.

element.name: suffix
element.description: Parts that come after the name
element.definition: Part of the name that is acquired as a title due to academic, legal, employment or nobility status, etc. and that appears at the end of the name.

element.name: period
element.description: Time period when name was/is in use
element.definition: Indicates the period of time when this name was valid for the named person.

element.name: use
element.description: usual | official | temp | secondary | old (If known)
element.definition: The purpose of this identifier.
element.comment: Applications can assume that an identifier is permanent unless it explicitly says that it is temporary.

binding.name: IdentifierUse
binding.description: Identifies the purpose for this identifier, if known .

element.name: type
element.definition: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.
element.comment: This element deals only with general categories of identifiers. It SHOULD not be used for codes that correspond 1..1 with the Identifier.system. Some identifiers may fall into multiple categories due to common usage. Where the system is known, a type is unnecessary because the type is always part of the system definition. However systems often need to handle identifiers where the system is not known. There is not a 1:1 relationship between type and system, since many different systems have the same type.

binding.name: IdentifierType
binding.description: A coded type for an identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

element.name: system
element.description: The namespace for the identifier value
element.definition: Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.
element.comment: Identifier.system is always case sensitive.

element.name: value
element.definition: The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.
element.comment: If the value is a full URI, then the system SHALL be urn:ietf:rfc:3986. The value's primary purpose is computational mapping. As a result, it may be normalized for comparison purposes (e.g. removing non-significant whitespace, dashes, etc.) A value formatted for human display can be conveyed using the [Rendered Value extension](extension-rendered-value.html). Identifier.value is to be treated as case sensitive unless knowledge of the Identifier.system allows the processer to be confident that non-case-sensitive processing is safe.

element.name: period
element.description: Time period when id is/was valid for use
element.definition: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

element.name: assigner
element.description: Organization that issued id (may be just text)
element.definition: Organization that issued/manages the identifier.
element.comment: The Identifier.assigner may omit the .reference element and only contain a .display element reflecting the name or other textual information about the assigning organization.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Identifiers for the ImagingStudy such as DICOM Study Instance UID, and Accession Number.
element.comment: See discussion under [Imaging Study Implementation Notes](imagingstudy.html#notes) for encoding of DICOM Study Instance UID. Accession Number should use ACSN Identifier type.

element.name: status
element.definition: The current state of the ImagingStudy.
element.comment: Unknown does not represent "other" - one of the defined statuses must apply. Unknown is used when the authoring system is not sure what the current status is.

binding.name: ImagingStudyStatus
binding.description: The status of the ImagingStudy.

element.name: modality
element.description: All series modality if actual acquisition modalities
element.definition: A list of all the series.modality values that are actual acquisition modalities, i.e. those in the DICOM Context Group 29 (value set OID 1.2.840.10008.6.1.19).

binding.name: ImagingModality
binding.description: Type of acquired data in the instance.

element.name: subject
element.description: Who or what is the subject of the study
element.definition: The subject, typically a patient, of the imaging study.
element.comment: QA phantoms can be recorded with a Device; multiple subjects (such as mice) can be recorded with a Group.

element.name: encounter
element.description: Encounter with which this imaging study is associated
element.definition: The healthcare event (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this ImagingStudy is made.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some events may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter (e.g. pre-admission test).

element.name: started
element.definition: Date and time the study started.

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

element.name: referrer
element.definition: The requesting/referring physician.

element.name: interpreter
element.definition: Who read the study and interpreted the images or other content.

element.name: endpoint
element.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for the study. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A study-level endpoint applies to each series in the study, unless overridden by a series-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.connectionType.
element.comment: Typical endpoint types include DICOM WADO-RS, which is used to retrieve DICOM instances in native or rendered (e.g., JPG, PNG), formats using a RESTful API; DICOM WADO-URI, which can similarly retrieve native or rendered instances, except using an HTTP query-based approach; DICOM QIDO-RS, which allows RESTful query for DICOM information without retrieving the actual instances; or IHE Invoke Image Display (IID), which provides standard invocation of an imaging web viewer.

element.name: numberOfSeries
element.definition: Number of Series in the Study. This value given may be larger than the number of series elements this Resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any series elements are present.

element.name: numberOfInstances
element.definition: Number of SOP Instances in Study. This value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present.

element.name: procedureReference
element.definition: The procedure which this ImagingStudy was part of.

element.name: procedureCode
element.definition: The code for the performed procedure type.

binding.name: ImagingProcedureCode
binding.description: The performed procedure type.

element.name: location
element.definition: The principal physical location where the ImagingStudy was performed.

element.name: reasonCode
element.definition: Description of clinical condition indicating why the ImagingStudy was requested.

binding.name: ImagingReason
binding.description: The reason for the study.

element.name: reasonReference
element.definition: Indicates another resource whose existence justifies this Study.

element.name: note
element.definition: Per the recommended DICOM mapping, this element is derived from the Study Description attribute (0008,1030). Observations or findings about the imaging study should be recorded in another resource, e.g. Observation, and not in this element.

element.name: description
element.definition: The Imaging Manager description of the study. Institution-generated description or classification of the Study (component) performed.

element.name: series
element.description: Each study has one or more series of instances
element.definition: Each study has one or more series of images or other content.

element.name: uid
element.description: DICOM Series Instance UID for the series
element.definition: The DICOM Series Instance UID for the series.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.7.3](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.7.3.html).

element.name: number
element.definition: The numeric identifier of this series in the study.

element.name: modality
element.description: The modality of the instances in the series
element.definition: The modality of this series sequence.

binding.name: ImagingModality
binding.description: Type of acquired data in the instance.

element.name: description
element.description: A short human readable summary of the series
element.definition: A description of the series.

element.name: numberOfInstances
element.definition: Number of SOP Instances in the Study. The value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present.

element.name: endpoint
element.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for this series. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A series-level endpoint, if present, has precedence over a study-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.connectionType.
element.comment: Typical endpoint types include DICOM WADO-RS, which is used to retrieve DICOM instances in native or rendered (e.g., JPG, PNG) formats using a RESTful API; DICOM WADO-URI, which can similarly retrieve native or rendered instances, except using an HTTP query-based approach; and DICOM QIDO-RS, which allows RESTful query for DICOM information without retrieving the actual instances.

element.name: bodySite
element.definition: The anatomic structures examined. See DICOM Part 16 Annex L (http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/chapter_L.html) for DICOM to SNOMED-CT mappings. The bodySite may indicate the laterality of body part imaged; if so, it shall be consistent with any content of ImagingStudy.series.laterality.

binding.name: BodySite
binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

element.name: laterality
element.definition: The laterality of the (possibly paired) anatomic structures examined. E.g., the left knee, both lungs, or unpaired abdomen. If present, shall be consistent with any laterality information indicated in ImagingStudy.series.bodySite.

binding.name: Laterality
binding.description: Codes describing body site laterality (left, right, etc.).

element.name: specimen
element.definition: The specimen imaged, e.g., for whole slide imaging of a biopsy.

element.name: started
element.definition: The date and time the series was started.

element.name: performer
element.definition: Indicates who or what performed the series and how they were involved.
element.comment: If the person who performed the series is not known, their Organization may be recorded. A patient, or related person, may be the performer, e.g. for patient-captured images.

element.name: instance
element.description: A single SOP instance from the series
element.definition: A single SOP instance within the series, e.g. an image, or presentation state.

element.name: uid
element.definition: The DICOM SOP Instance UID for this image or other DICOM content.
element.comment: See [DICOM PS3.3 C.12.1](http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part03/sect_C.12.html#sect_C.12.1).

element.name: sopClass
element.definition: DICOM instance type.

binding.name: sopClass
binding.description: The sopClass for the instance.

element.name: number
element.description: The number of this instance in the series
element.definition: The number of instance in the series.

element.name: title
element.definition: The description of the instance.
element.comment: Particularly for post-acquisition analytic objects, such as SR, presentation states, value mapping, etc.

element.name: function
element.definition: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer in the series.

binding.name: EventPerformerFunction
binding.description: The type of involvement of the performer.

element.name: actor
element.definition: Indicates who or what performed the series.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.

element.name: status
element.definition: Indicates the current status of the immunization event.
element.comment: Will generally be set to show that the immunization has been completed or not done. This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: ImmunizationStatus
binding.description: A set of codes indicating the current status of an Immunization.

element.name: statusReason
element.definition: Indicates the reason the immunization event was not performed.
element.comment: This is generally only used for the status of "not-done". The reason for performing the immunization event is captured in reasonCode, not here.

binding.name: ImmunizationStatusReason
binding.description: The reason why a vaccine was not administered.

element.name: vaccineCode
element.definition: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.

binding.name: VaccineCode
binding.description: The code for vaccine product administered.

element.name: patient
element.definition: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.

element.name: encounter
element.definition: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.

element.name: occurrence
element.definition: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.
element.comment: When immunizations are given a specific date and time should always be known. When immunizations are patient reported, a specific date might not be known. Although partial dates are allowed, an adult patient might not be able to recall the year a childhood immunization was given. An exact date is always preferable, but the use of the String data type is acceptable when an exact date is not known. A small number of vaccines (e.g. live oral typhoid vaccine) are given as a series of patient self-administered dose over a span of time. In cases like this, often, only the first dose (typically a provider supervised dose) is recorded with the occurrence indicating the date/time of the first dose.

element.name: recorded
element.description: When the immunization was first captured in the subject's record
element.definition: The date the occurrence of the immunization was first captured in the record - potentially significantly after the occurrence of the event.

element.name: primarySource
element.description: Indicates context the data was recorded in
element.definition: An indication that the content of the record is based on information from the person who administered the vaccine. This reflects the context under which the data was originally recorded.
element.comment: Reflects the reliability of the content.

element.name: reportOrigin
element.description: Indicates the source of a secondarily reported record
element.definition: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.
element.comment: Should not be populated if primarySource = True, not required even if primarySource = False.

binding.name: ImmunizationReportOrigin
binding.description: The source of the data for a record which is not from a primary source.

element.name: location
element.definition: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

element.name: manufacturer
element.definition: Name of vaccine manufacturer.

element.name: lotNumber
element.definition: Lot number of the vaccine product.

element.name: expirationDate
element.definition: Date vaccine batch expires.

element.name: site
element.definition: Body site where vaccine was administered.

binding.name: ImmunizationSite
binding.description: The site at which the vaccine was administered.

element.name: route
element.definition: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

binding.name: ImmunizationRoute
binding.description: The route by which the vaccine was administered.

element.name: doseQuantity
element.definition: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

element.name: performer
element.definition: Indicates who performed the immunization event.

element.name: note
element.definition: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

element.name: reasonCode
element.definition: Reasons why the vaccine was administered.

binding.name: ImmunizationReason
binding.description: The reason why a vaccine was administered.

element.name: reasonReference
element.definition: Condition, Observation or DiagnosticReport that supports why the immunization was administered.

element.name: isSubpotent
element.definition: Indication if a dose is considered to be subpotent. By default, a dose should be considered to be potent.
element.comment: Typically, the recognition of the dose being sub-potent is retrospective, after the administration (ex. notification of a manufacturer recall after administration). However, in the case of a partial administration (the patient moves unexpectedly and only some of the dose is actually administered), subpotency may be recognized immediately, but it is still important to record the event.

element.name: subpotentReason
element.definition: Reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

binding.name: SubpotentReason
binding.description: The reason why a dose is considered to be subpotent.

element.name: education
element.definition: Educational material presented to the patient (or guardian) at the time of vaccine administration.

constraint.name: imm-1
constraint.message: One of documentType or reference SHALL be present

element.name: programEligibility
element.description: Patient eligibility for a vaccination program
element.definition: Indicates a patient's eligibility for a funding program.

binding.name: ProgramEligibility
binding.description: The patient's eligibility for a vaccation program.

element.name: fundingSource
element.definition: Indicates the source of the vaccine actually administered. This may be different than the patient eligibility (e.g. the patient may be eligible for a publically purchased vaccine but due to inventory issues, vaccine purchased with private funds was actually administered).

binding.name: FundingSource
binding.description: The source of funding used to purchase the vaccine administered.

element.name: reaction
element.description: Details of a reaction that follows immunization
element.definition: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.
element.comment: A reaction may be an indication of an allergy or intolerance and, if this is determined to be the case, it should be recorded as a new AllergyIntolerance resource instance as most systems will not query against past Immunization.reaction elements.

element.name: protocolApplied
element.definition: The protocol (set of recommendations) being followed by the provider who administered the dose.

element.name: documentType
element.definition: Identifier of the material presented to the patient.

element.name: reference
element.definition: Reference pointer to the educational material given to the patient if the information was on line.

element.name: publicationDate
element.definition: Date the educational material was published.

element.name: presentationDate
element.definition: Date the educational material was given to the patient.

element.name: function
element.description: What type of performance was done
element.definition: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

binding.name: ImmunizationFunction
binding.description: The role a practitioner or organization plays in the immunization event.

element.name: actor
element.description: Individual or organization who was performing
element.definition: The practitioner or organization who performed the action.
element.comment: When the individual practitioner who performed the action is known, it is best to send.

element.name: series
element.definition: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

element.name: authority
element.description: Who is responsible for publishing the recommendations
element.definition: Indicates the authority who published the protocol (e.g. ACIP) that is being followed.

element.name: targetDisease
element.definition: The vaccine preventable disease the dose is being administered against.

binding.name: TargetDisease
binding.description: The vaccine preventable disease the dose is being administered for.

element.name: doseNumber
element.definition: Nominal position in a series.
element.comment: The use of an integer is preferred if known. A string should only be used in cases where an integer is not available (such as when documenting a recurring booster dose).

element.name: seriesDoses
element.description: Recommended number of doses for immunity
element.definition: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity.
element.comment: The use of an integer is preferred if known. A string should only be used in cases where an integer is not available (such as when documenting a recurring booster dose).

element.name: date
element.definition: Date of reaction to the immunization.

element.name: detail
element.definition: Details of the reaction.

element.name: reported
element.definition: Self-reported indicator.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization evaluation record.

element.name: status
element.definition: Indicates the current status of the evaluation of the vaccination administration event.

binding.name: ImmunizationEvaluationStatus
binding.description: The status of the evaluation being done.

element.name: patient
element.definition: The individual for whom the evaluation is being done.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date the evaluation of the vaccine administration event was performed.

element.name: authority
element.description: Who is responsible for publishing the recommendations
element.definition: Indicates the authority who published the protocol (e.g. ACIP).

element.name: targetDisease
element.definition: The vaccine preventable disease the dose is being evaluated against.

binding.name: EvaluationTargetDisease
binding.description: The vaccine preventable disease the dose is being evaluated against.

element.name: immunizationEvent
element.definition: The vaccine administration event being evaluated.

element.name: doseStatus
element.description: Status of the dose relative to published recommendations
element.definition: Indicates if the dose is valid or not valid with respect to the published recommendations.

binding.name: EvaluationDoseStatus
binding.description: The status of the administered dose relative to the published recommendations for the target disease.

element.name: doseStatusReason
element.definition: Provides an explanation as to why the vaccine administration event is valid or not relative to the published recommendations.

binding.name: EvaluationDoseStatusReason
binding.description: The reason the dose status was assigned.

element.name: description
element.definition: Additional information about the evaluation.

element.name: series
element.definition: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

element.name: doseNumber
element.definition: Nominal position in a series.
element.comment: The use of an integer is preferred if known. A string should only be used in cases where an integer is not available (such as when documenting a recurring booster dose).

element.name: seriesDoses
element.description: Recommended number of doses for immunity
element.definition: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity.
element.comment: The use of an integer is preferred if known. A string should only be used in cases where an integer is not available (such as when documenting a recurring booster dose).

element.name: identifier
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this particular recommendation record.

element.name: patient
element.definition: The patient the recommendation(s) are for.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date the immunization recommendation(s) were created.

element.name: authority
element.definition: Indicates the authority who published the protocol (e.g. ACIP).

element.name: recommendation
element.definition: Vaccine administration recommendations.

constraint.name: imr-1
constraint.message: One of vaccineCode or targetDisease SHALL be present

element.name: vaccineCode
element.description: Vaccine or vaccine group recommendation applies to
element.definition: Vaccine(s) or vaccine group that pertain to the recommendation.

binding.name: VaccineCode
binding.description: The type of vaccine administered.

element.name: targetDisease
element.definition: The targeted disease for the recommendation.

binding.name: TargetDisease
binding.description: The disease that the recommended vaccination targets.

element.name: contraindicatedVaccineCode
element.description: Vaccine which is contraindicated to fulfill the recommendation
element.definition: Vaccine(s) which should not be used to fulfill the recommendation.

binding.name: VaccineCode
binding.description: The type of vaccine administered.

element.name: forecastStatus
element.definition: Indicates the patient status with respect to the path to immunity for the target disease.

binding.name: ImmunizationRecommendationStatus
binding.description: The patient's status with respect to a vaccination protocol.

element.name: forecastReason
element.definition: The reason for the assigned forecast status.

binding.name: ImmunizationRecommendationReason
binding.description: The reason for the patient's status with respect to a vaccination protocol.

element.name: dateCriterion
element.definition: Vaccine date recommendations. For example, earliest date to administer, latest date to administer, etc.

element.name: description
element.definition: Contains the description about the protocol under which the vaccine was administered.

element.name: series
element.definition: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

element.name: doseNumber
element.definition: Nominal position of the recommended dose in a series (e.g. dose 2 is the next recommended dose).
element.comment: The use of an integer is prefered if known. A string should only be used in cases where an interger is not available (such as when documenting a recurring booster dose).

element.name: seriesDoses
element.description: Recommended number of doses for immunity
element.definition: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity.
element.comment: The use of an integer is prefered if known. A string should only be used in cases where an interger is not available (such as when documenting a recurring booster dose).

element.name: supportingImmunization
element.definition: Immunization event history and/or evaluation that supports the status and recommendation.

element.name: supportingPatientInformation
element.definition: Patient Information that supports the status and recommendation. This includes patient observations, adverse reactions and allergy/intolerance information.

element.name: code
element.definition: Date classification of recommendation. For example, earliest date to give, latest date to give, etc.

binding.name: ImmunizationRecommendationDateCriterion
binding.description: Classifies date criterion with respect to conveying information about a patient's vaccination status (e.g. due date, latest to give date, etc.).

element.name: value
element.definition: The date whose meaning is specified by dateCriterion.code.

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this implementation guide, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this implementation guide when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this implementation guide is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the implementation guide is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the implementation guide
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the implementation guide when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the implementation guide author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
element.comment: There may be different implementation guide instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the implementation guide with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this implementation guide (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the implementation guide. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

element.name: title
element.description: Name for this implementation guide (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the implementation guide.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of this implementation guide. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of implementation guides that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: experimental
element.description: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this implementation guide is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of implementation guides that are appropriate for use versus not.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the implementation guide was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the implementation guide changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the implementation guide. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the implementation guide.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the implementation guide is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the implementation guide. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the implementation guide. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the implementation guide
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the implementation guide from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the implementation guide was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the implementation guide as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the implementation guide is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the implementation guide was created).

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate implementation guide instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for implementation guide (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the implementation guide is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the implementation guide to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the implementation guide and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the implementation guide.

element.name: packageId
element.definition: The NPM package name for this Implementation Guide, used in the NPM package distribution, which is the primary mechanism by which FHIR based tooling manages IG dependencies. This value must be globally unique, and should be assigned with care.
element.comment: Many (if not all) IG publishing tools will require that this element be present. For implementation guides published through HL7 or the FHIR foundation, the FHIR product director assigns package IDs.

element.name: license
element.description: SPDX license code for this IG (or not-open-source)
element.definition: The license that applies to this Implementation Guide, using an SPDX license code, or 'not-open-source'.

binding.name: SPDXLicense
binding.description: The license that applies to an Implementation Guide (using an SPDX license Identifiers, or 'not-open-source'). The binding is required but new SPDX license Identifiers are allowed to be used (https://spdx.org/licenses/).

element.name: fhirVersion
element.description: FHIR Version(s) this Implementation Guide targets
element.definition: The version(s) of the FHIR specification that this ImplementationGuide targets - e.g. describes how to use. The value of this element is the formal version of the specification, without the revision number, e.g. [publication].[major].[minor], which is 4.3.0-cibuild. for this version.
element.comment: Most implementation guides target a single version - e.g. they describe how to use a particular version, and the profiles and examples etc are valid for that version. But some implementation guides describe how to use multiple different versions of FHIR to solve the same problem, or in concert with each other. Typically, the requirement to support multiple versions arises as implementation matures and different implementation communities are stuck at different versions by regulation or market dynamics.

binding.name: FHIRVersion
binding.description: All published FHIR Versions.

element.name: dependsOn
element.description: Another Implementation guide this depends on
element.definition: Another implementation guide that this implementation depends on. Typically, an implementation guide uses value sets, profiles etc.defined in other implementation guides.

element.name: global
element.definition: A set of profiles that all resources covered by this implementation guide must conform to.
element.comment: See [Default Profiles](implementationguide.html#default) for a discussion of which resources are 'covered' by an implementation guide.

element.name: definition
element.description: Information needed to build the IG
element.definition: The information needed by an IG publisher tool to publish the whole implementation guide.
element.comment: Principally, this consists of information abuot source resource and file locations, and build parameters and templates.

constraint.name: ig-1
constraint.message: If a resource has a groupingId, it must refer to a grouping defined in the Implementation Guide

element.name: manifest
element.definition: Information about an assembled implementation guide, created by the publication tooling.

element.name: grouping
element.description: Grouping used to present related resources in the IG
element.definition: A logical group of resources. Logical groups can be used when building pages.
element.comment: Groupings are arbitrary sub-divisions of content. Typically, they are used to help build Table of Contents automatically.

element.name: resource
element.definition: A resource that is part of the implementation guide. Conformance resources (value set, structure definition, capability statements etc.) are obvious candidates for inclusion, but any kind of resource can be included as an example resource.

element.name: page
element.definition: A page / section in the implementation guide. The root page is the implementation guide home page.
element.comment: Pages automatically become sections if they have sub-pages. By convention, the home page is called index.html.

element.name: parameter
element.description: Defines how IG is built by tools
element.definition: Defines how IG is built by tools.

element.name: template
element.definition: A template for building resources.

element.name: name
element.definition: The human-readable title to display for the package of resources when rendering the implementation guide.

element.name: description
element.description: Human readable text describing the package
element.definition: Human readable text describing the package.

element.name: name
element.definition: The source address for the page.
element.comment: The publishing tool will autogenerate source for list (source = n/a) and inject included implementations for include (source = uri of guide to include).

element.name: title
element.description: Short title shown for navigational assistance
element.definition: A short title used to represent this page in navigational structures such as table of contents, bread crumbs, etc.

element.name: generation
element.definition: A code that indicates how the page is generated.

binding.name: GuidePageGeneration
binding.description: A code that indicates how the page is generated.

element.name: page
element.definition: Nested Pages/Sections under this page.
element.comment: The implementation guide breadcrumbs are generated from this structure.

element.name: code
element.description: apply | path-resource | path-pages | path-tx-cache | expansion-parameter | rule-broken-links | generate-xml | generate-json | generate-turtle | html-template
element.definition: apply | path-resource | path-pages | path-tx-cache | expansion-parameter | rule-broken-links | generate-xml | generate-json | generate-turtle | html-template.

binding.name: GuideParameterCode
binding.description: Code of parameter that is input to the guide.

element.name: value
element.definition: Value for named type.

element.name: reference
element.definition: Where this resource is found.
element.comment: Usually this is a relative URL that locates the resource within the implementation guide. If you authoring an implementation guide, and will publish it using the FHIR publication tooling, use a URI that may point to a resource, or to one of various alternative representations (e.g. spreadsheet). The tooling will convert this when it publishes it.

element.name: fhirVersion
element.description: Versions this applies to (if different to IG)
element.definition: Indicates the FHIR Version(s) this artifact is intended to apply to. If no versions are specified, the resource is assumed to apply to all the versions stated in ImplementationGuide.fhirVersion.
element.comment: The resource SHALL be valid against all the versions it is specified to apply to. If the resource referred to is a StructureDefinition, the fhirVersion stated in the StructureDefinition cannot disagree with the version specified here; the specified versions SHALL include the version specified by the StructureDefinition, and may include additional versions using the [applicable-version](extension-structuredefinition-applicable-version.html) extension.

binding.name: FHIRVersion
binding.description: All published FHIR Versions.

element.name: name
element.definition: A human assigned name for the resource. All resources SHOULD have a name, but the name may be extracted from the resource (e.g. ValueSet.name).

element.name: description
element.definition: A description of the reason that a resource has been included in the implementation guide.
element.comment: This is mostly used with examples to explain why it is present (though they can have extensive comments in the examples).

element.name: example
element.description: Is an example/What is this an example of?
element.definition: If true or a reference, indicates the resource is an example instance. If a reference is present, indicates that the example is an example of the specified profile.
element.comment:
Examples:
* StructureDefinition -> Any * ValueSet -> expansion * OperationDefinition -> Parameters * Questionnaire -> QuestionnaireResponse.

element.name: groupingId
element.definition: Reference to the id of the grouping this resource appears in.
element.comment: This must correspond to a package.id element within this implementation guide.

element.name: code
element.definition: Type of template specified.

element.name: source
element.description: The source location for the template
element.definition: The source location for the template.

element.name: scope
element.description: The scope in which the template applies
element.definition: The scope in which the template applies.

element.name: uri
element.description: Identity of the IG that this depends on
element.definition: A canonical reference to the Implementation guide for the dependency.
element.comment: Usually, A canonical reference to the implementation guide is the same as the master location at which the implementation guide is published.

element.name: packageId
element.description: NPM Package name for IG this depends on
element.definition: The NPM package name for the Implementation Guide that this IG depends on.

element.name: version
element.definition: The version of the IG that is depended on, when the correct version is required to understand the IG correctly.
element.comment: This follows the syntax of the NPM packaging version field - see [[reference]].

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of resource that all instances must conform to.
element.comment: The type must match that of the profile that is referred to but is made explicit here as a denormalization so that a system processing the implementation guide resource knows which resources the profile applies to even if the profile itself is not available.

binding.name: ResourceType
binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

element.name: profile
element.description: Profile that all resources must conform to
element.definition: A reference to the profile that all instances must conform to.

element.name: rendering
element.definition: A pointer to official web page, PDF or other rendering of the implementation guide.

element.name: resource
element.definition: A resource that is part of the implementation guide. Conformance resources (value set, structure definition, capability statements etc.) are obvious candidates for inclusion, but any kind of resource can be included as an example resource.

element.name: page
element.description: HTML page within the parent IG
element.definition: Information about a page within the IG.

element.name: image
element.definition: Indicates a relative path to an image that exists within the IG.

element.name: other
element.definition: Indicates the relative path of an additional non-page, non-image file that is part of the IG - e.g. zip, jar and similar files that could be the target of a hyperlink in a derived IG.

element.name: name
element.definition: Relative path to the page.
element.comment: Appending 'rendering' + "/" + this should resolve to the page.

element.name: title
element.description: Title of the page, for references
element.definition: Label for the page intended for human display.

element.name: anchor
element.definition: The name of an anchor available on the page.
element.comment: Appending 'rendering' + "/" + page.name + "#" + page.anchor should resolve to the anchor.

element.name: reference
element.definition: Where this resource is found.
element.comment: Usually this is a relative URL that locates the resource within the implementation guide. If you authoring an implementation guide, and will publish it using the FHIR publication tooling, use a URI that may point to a resource, or to one of various alternative representations (e.g. spreadsheet). The tooling will convert this when it publishes it.

element.name: example
element.description: Is an example/What is this an example of?
element.definition: If true or a reference, indicates the resource is an example instance. If a reference is present, indicates that the example is an example of the specified profile.
element.comment: Typically, conformance resources and knowledge resources are directly part of the implementation guide, with their normal meaning, and patient linked resources are usually examples. However this is not always true.

element.name: relativePath
element.description: Relative path for page in IG
element.definition: The relative path for primary page for this resource within the IG.
element.comment: Appending 'rendering' + "/" + this should resolve to the resource page.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this health insurance product which remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.

element.name: status
element.definition: The current state of the health insurance product.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: type
element.definition: The kind of health insurance product.

binding.name: InsurancePlanType
binding.description: Used to categorize the product/plan.

element.name: name
element.definition: Official name of the health insurance product as designated by the owner.
element.comment: If the name of the product/plan changes, consider putting the old name in the alias column so that it can still be located through searches.

element.name: alias
element.definition: A list of alternate names that the product is known as, or was known as in the past.
element.comment: There are no dates associated with the alias/historic names, as this is not intended to track when names were used, but to assist in searching so that older names can still result in identifying the product/plan.

element.name: period
element.definition: The period of time that the health insurance product is available.

element.name: ownedBy
element.definition: The entity that is providing the health insurance product and underwriting the risk. This is typically an insurance carriers, other third-party payers, or health plan sponsors comonly referred to as 'payers'.

element.name: administeredBy
element.definition: An organization which administer other services such as underwriting, customer service and/or claims processing on behalf of the health insurance product owner.

element.name: coverageArea
element.definition: The geographic region in which a health insurance product's benefits apply.

element.name: contact
element.definition: The contact for the health insurance product for a certain purpose.
element.comment: Where multiple contacts for the same purpose are provided there is a standard extension that can be used to determine which one is the preferred contact to use.

element.name: endpoint
element.definition: The technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the health insurance product.

element.name: network
element.definition: Reference to the network included in the health insurance product.
element.comment: Networks are represented as a hierarchy of organization resources.

element.name: coverage
element.definition: Details about the coverage offered by the insurance product.

element.name: plan
element.definition: Details about an insurance plan.

element.name: purpose
element.definition: Indicates a purpose for which the contact can be reached.

binding.name: ContactPartyType
binding.description: The purpose for which you would contact a contact party.

element.name: name
element.description: A name associated with the contact
element.definition: A name associated with the contact.

element.name: telecom
element.description: Contact details (telephone, email, etc.) for a contact
element.definition: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the party may be contacted.

element.name: address
element.description: Visiting or postal addresses for the contact
element.definition: Visiting or postal addresses for the contact.

element.name: type
element.definition: Type of coverage (Medical; Dental; Mental Health; Substance Abuse; Vision; Drug; Short Term; Long Term Care; Hospice; Home Health).

element.name: network
element.definition: Reference to the network that providing the type of coverage.
element.comment: Networks are represented as a hierarchy of organization resources.

element.name: benefit
element.definition: Specific benefits under this type of coverage.

element.name: type
element.definition: Type of benefit (primary care; speciality care; inpatient; outpatient).

element.name: requirement
element.definition: The referral requirements to have access/coverage for this benefit.

element.name: limit
element.definition: The specific limits on the benefit.

element.name: value
element.definition: The maximum amount of a service item a plan will pay for a covered benefit. For examples. wellness visits, or eyeglasses.
element.comment: May also be called eligible expense, payment allowance, or negotiated rate..

element.name: code
