They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier.

element.name: partOf
element.description: Event that dispense is part of
element.definition: The procedure that trigger the dispense.

element.name: status
element.description: preparation | in-progress | cancelled | on-hold | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | declined | unknown
element.definition: A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: MedicationDispenseStatus
binding.description: A coded concept specifying the state of the dispense event.

element.name: statusReason
element.description: Why a dispense was not performed
element.definition: Indicates the reason why a dispense was not performed.

binding.name: MedicationDispenseStatusReason
binding.description: A code describing why a dispense was not performed.

element.name: category
element.definition: Indicates the type of medication dispense (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).
element.comment: The category can be used to include where the medication is expected to be consumed or other types of dispenses. Invariants can be used to bind to different value sets when profiling to bind.

binding.name: MedicationDispenseCategory
binding.description: A code describing where the dispensed medication is expected to be consumed or administered.

element.name: medication
element.definition: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
element.comment: If only a code is specified, then it needs to be a code for a specific product. If more information is required, then the use of the medication resource is recommended. For example, if you require form or lot number, then you must reference the Medication resource.

binding.name: MedicationCode
binding.description: A coded concept identifying which substance or product can be dispensed.

element.name: subject
element.definition: A link to a resource representing the person or the group to whom the medication will be given.

element.name: context
element.definition: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this event.

element.name: supportingInformation
element.description: Information that supports the dispensing of the medication
element.definition: Additional information that supports the medication being dispensed.

element.name: performer
element.definition: Indicates who or what performed the event.

element.name: location
element.definition: The principal physical location where the dispense was performed.

element.name: authorizingPrescription
element.description: Medication order that authorizes the dispense
element.definition: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.
element.comment: Maps to basedOn in Event logical model.

element.name: type
element.description: Trial fill, partial fill, emergency fill, etc.
element.definition: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

binding.name: MedicationDispenseType
binding.description: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. For example, Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

element.name: daysSupply
element.description: Amount of medication expressed as a timing amount
element.definition: The amount of medication expressed as a timing amount.

element.name: whenPrepared
element.description: When product was packaged and reviewed
element.definition: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.

element.name: whenHandedOver
element.definition: The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.

element.name: destination
element.definition: Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.

element.name: receiver
element.definition: Identifies the person who picked up the medication. This will usually be a patient or their caregiver, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional.

element.name: note
element.definition: Extra information about the dispense that could not be conveyed in the other attributes.

element.name: dosageInstruction
element.description: How the medication is to be used by the patient or administered by the caregiver
element.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.
element.comment: When the dose or rate is intended to change over the entire administration period (e.g. Tapering dose prescriptions), multiple instances of dosage instructions will need to be supplied to convey the different doses/rates. The pharmacist reviews the medication order prior to dispense and updates the dosageInstruction based on the actual product being dispensed.

element.name: substitution
element.description: Whether a substitution was performed on the dispense
element.definition: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution will be expected but does not happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen. This block explains what substitution did or did not happen and why. If nothing is specified, substitution was not done.

element.name: detectedIssue
element.definition: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.
element.comment: This element can include a detected issue that has been identified either by a decision support system or by a clinician and may include information on the steps that were taken to address the issue.

element.name: eventHistory
element.description: A list of relevant lifecycle events
element.definition: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred, such as when the dispense was verified.
element.comment: This might not include provenances for all versions of the request only those deemed relevant or important. This SHALL NOT include the Provenance associated with this current version of the resource. (If that provenance is deemed to be a relevant change, it will need to be added as part of a later update. Until then, it can be queried directly as the Provenance that points to this version using _revinclude All Provenances should have some historical version of this Request as their subject.).

element.name: function
element.description: Who performed the dispense and what they did
element.definition: Distinguishes the type of performer in the dispense. For example, date enterer, packager, final checker.

binding.name: MedicationDispensePerformerFunction
binding.description: A code describing the role an individual played in dispensing a medication.

element.name: actor
element.definition: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed the action. It should be assumed that the actor is the dispenser of the medication.

element.name: wasSubstituted
element.description: Whether a substitution was or was not performed on the dispense
element.definition: True if the dispenser dispensed a different drug or product from what was prescribed.

element.name: type
element.description: Code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed
element.definition: A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.

binding.name: MedicationIntendedSubstitutionType
binding.description: A coded concept describing whether a different medicinal product may be dispensed other than the product as specified exactly in the prescription.

element.name: reason
element.definition: Indicates the reason for the substitution (or lack of substitution) from what was prescribed.

binding.name: MedicationIntendedSubstitutionReason
binding.description: A coded concept describing the reason that a different medication should (or should not) be substituted from what was prescribed.

element.name: responsibleParty
element.description: Who is responsible for the substitution
element.definition: The person or organization that has primary responsibility for the substitution.

element.name: code
element.definition: A code that specifies this medication, or a textual description if no code is available. Usage note: This could be a standard medication code such as a code from RxNorm, SNOMED CT, IDMP etc. It could also be a national or local formulary code, optionally with translations to other code systems.
element.comment: Depending on the context of use, the code that was actually selected by the user (prescriber, dispenser, etc.) will have the coding.userSelected set to true. As described in the coding datatype: "A coding may be marked as a "userSelected" if a user selected the particular coded value in a user interface (e.g. the user selects an item in a pick-list). If a user selected coding exists, it is the preferred choice for performing translations etc. Other codes can only be literal translations to alternative code systems, or codes at a lower level of granularity (e.g. a generic code for a vendor-specific primary one).

binding.name: MedicationFormalRepresentation
binding.description: A coded concept that defines the type of a medication.

element.name: status
element.definition: A code to indicate if the medication is in active use. The status refers to the validity about the information of the medication and not to its medicinal properties.
element.comment: This status is intended to identify if the medication in a local system is in active use within a drug database or inventory. For example, a pharmacy system may create a new drug file record for a compounded product "ABC Hospital Special Cream" with an active status. At some point in the future, it may be determined that the drug record was created with an error and the status is changed to "entered in error". This status is not intended to specify if a medication is part of a particular formulary. It is possible that the drug record may be referenced by multiple formularies or catalogues and each of those entries would have a separate status.

binding.name: MedicationKnowledgeStatus
binding.description: A coded concept defining if the medication is in active use.

element.name: manufacturer
element.definition: Describes the details of the manufacturer of the medication product. This is not intended to represent the distributor of a medication product.

element.name: doseForm
element.definition: Describes the form of the item. Powder; tablets; capsule.
element.comment: When Medication is referenced from MedicationRequest, this is the ordered form. When Medication is referenced within MedicationDispense, this is the dispensed form. When Medication is referenced within MedicationAdministration, this is administered form.

binding.name: MedicationForm
binding.description: A coded concept defining the form of a medication.

element.name: amount
element.definition: Specific amount of the drug in the packaged product. For example, when specifying a product that has the same strength (For example, Insulin glargine 100 unit per mL solution for injection), this attribute provides additional clarification of the package amount (For example, 3 mL, 10mL, etc.).
element.comment: This is the quantity of medication in a package. To specify the strength of the medication, the Ingredient.strength attribute is used.

element.name: synonym
element.definition: Additional names for a medication, for example, the name(s) given to a medication in different countries. For example, acetaminophen and paracetamol or salbutamol and albuterol.

element.name: relatedMedicationKnowledge
element.definition: Associated or related knowledge about a medication.

element.name: associatedMedication
element.description: A medication resource that is associated with this medication
element.definition: Associated or related medications. For example, if the medication is a branded product (e.g. Crestor), this is the Therapeutic Moeity (e.g. Rosuvastatin) or if this is a generic medication (e.g. Rosuvastatin), this would link to a branded product (e.g. Crestor).

element.name: productType
element.description: Category of the medication or product
element.definition: Category of the medication or product (e.g. branded product, therapeutic moeity, generic product, innovator product, etc.).

element.name: monograph
element.definition: Associated documentation about the medication.

element.name: ingredient
element.definition: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product.

element.name: preparationInstruction
element.description: The instructions for preparing the medication
element.definition: The instructions for preparing the medication.

element.name: intendedRoute
element.description: The intended or approved route of administration
element.definition: The intended or approved route of administration.

binding.name: MedicationRoute
binding.description: A coded concept defining the intended route of administration.

element.name: cost
element.definition: The price of the medication.

element.name: monitoringProgram
element.description: Program under which a medication is reviewed
element.definition: The program under which the medication is reviewed.

element.name: administrationGuidelines
element.description: Guidelines for administration of the medication
element.definition: Guidelines for the administration of the medication.

element.name: medicineClassification
element.description: Categorization of the medication within a formulary or classification system
element.definition: Categorization of the medication within a formulary or classification system.

element.name: packaging
element.definition: Information that only applies to packages (not products).

element.name: drugCharacteristic
element.description: Specifies descriptive properties of the medicine
element.definition: Specifies descriptive properties of the medicine, such as color, shape, imprints, etc.

element.name: contraindication
element.description: Potential clinical issue with or between medication(s)
element.definition: Potential clinical issue with or between medication(s) (for example, drug-drug interaction, drug-disease contraindication, drug-allergy interaction, etc.).

element.name: regulatory
element.definition: Regulatory information about a medication.

element.name: kinetics
element.description: The time course of drug absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of a medication from the body
element.definition: The time course of drug absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of a medication from the body.

element.name: dosage
element.description: Dosage for the medication for the specific guidelines
element.definition: Dosage for the medication for the specific guidelines.

element.name: indication
element.description: Indication for use that apply to the specific administration guidelines
element.definition: Indication for use that apply to the specific administration guidelines.

element.name: patientCharacteristics
element.description: Characteristics of the patient that are relevant to the administration guidelines
element.definition: Characteristics of the patient that are relevant to the administration guidelines (for example, height, weight, gender, etc.).

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of dosage (for example, prophylaxis, maintenance, therapeutic, etc.).

element.name: dosage
element.description: Dosage for the medication for the specific guidelines
element.definition: Dosage for the medication for the specific guidelines.

element.name: characteristic
element.description: Specific characteristic that is relevant to the administration guideline
element.definition: Specific characteristic that is relevant to the administration guideline (e.g. height, weight, gender).

element.name: value
element.definition: The specific characteristic (e.g. height, weight, gender, etc.).

element.name: type
element.description: The category of the cost information
element.definition: The category of the cost information. For example, manufacturers' cost, patient cost, claim reimbursement cost, actual acquisition cost.

element.name: source
element.description: The source or owner for the price information
element.definition: The source or owner that assigns the price to the medication.

element.name: cost
element.definition: The price of the medication.

element.name: type
element.description: Code specifying the type of characteristic of medication
element.definition: A code specifying which characteristic of the medicine is being described (for example, colour, shape, imprint).

binding.name: MedicationCharacteristic
binding.description: A coded concept defining the characteristic types of a medication.

element.name: value
element.definition: Description of the characteristic.
element.comment: The description should be provided as a CodeableConcept, SimpleQuantity or an image. The description can be a string only when these others are not available.

element.name: item
element.description: Medication(s) or substance(s) contained in the medication
element.definition: The actual ingredient - either a substance (simple ingredient) or another medication.

element.name: isActive
element.definition: Indication of whether this ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug.

element.name: strength
element.definition: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication. For example, 250 mg per tablet. This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet.

element.name: areaUnderCurve
element.description: The drug concentration measured at certain discrete points in time
element.definition: The drug concentration measured at certain discrete points in time.

element.name: lethalDose50
element.description: The median lethal dose of a drug
element.definition: The median lethal dose of a drug.

element.name: halfLifePeriod
element.description: Time required for concentration in the body to decrease by half
element.definition: The time required for any specified property (e.g., the concentration of a substance in the body) to decrease by half.

element.name: type
element.description: The type of category for the medication (for example, therapeutic classification, therapeutic sub-classification)
element.definition: The type of category for the medication (for example, therapeutic classification, therapeutic sub-classification).

element.name: classification
element.description: Specific category assigned to the medication
element.definition: Specific category assigned to the medication (e.g. anti-infective, anti-hypertensive, antibiotic, etc.).

element.name: type
element.description: Type of program under which the medication is monitored
element.definition: Type of program under which the medication is monitored.

element.name: name
element.definition: Name of the reviewing program.

element.name: type
element.definition: The category of documentation about the medication. (e.g. professional monograph, patient education monograph).

element.name: source
element.definition: Associated documentation about the medication.

element.name: type
element.description: A code that defines the specific type of packaging that the medication can be found in
element.definition: A code that defines the specific type of packaging that the medication can be found in (e.g. blister sleeve, tube, bottle).

binding.name: MedicationPackageType
binding.description: A coded concept defining the type of packaging of a medication.

element.name: quantity
element.description: The number of product units the package would contain if fully loaded
element.definition: The number of product units the package would contain if fully loaded.

element.name: regulatoryAuthority
element.description: Specifies the authority of the regulation
element.definition: The authority that is specifying the regulations.

element.name: substitution
element.description: Specifies if changes are allowed when dispensing a medication from a regulatory perspective
element.definition: Specifies if changes are allowed when dispensing a medication from a regulatory perspective.

element.name: schedule
element.description: Specifies the schedule of a medication in jurisdiction
element.definition: Specifies the schedule of a medication in jurisdiction.

element.name: maxDispense
element.description: The maximum number of units of the medication that can be dispensed in a period
element.definition: The maximum number of units of the medication that can be dispensed in a period.

element.name: quantity
element.description: The maximum number of units of the medication that can be dispensed
element.definition: The maximum number of units of the medication that can be dispensed.

element.name: period
element.description: The period that applies to the maximum number of units
element.definition: The period that applies to the maximum number of units.

element.name: schedule
element.definition: Specifies the specific drug schedule.

element.name: type
element.description: Specifies the type of substitution allowed
element.definition: Specifies the type of substitution allowed.

element.name: allowed
element.description: Specifies if regulation allows for changes in the medication when dispensing
element.definition: Specifies if regulation allows for changes in the medication when dispensing.

element.name: type
element.definition: The category of the associated medication knowledge reference.

element.name: reference
element.description: Associated documentation about the associated medication knowledge
element.definition: Associated documentation about the associated medication knowledge.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Identifiers associated with this medication request that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier.

element.name: status
element.description: active | on-hold | cancelled | completed | entered-in-error | stopped | draft | unknown
element.definition: A code specifying the current state of the order. Generally, this will be active or completed state.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: MedicationRequestStatus
binding.description: A coded concept specifying the state of the prescribing event. Describes the lifecycle of the prescription.

element.name: statusReason
element.definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationRequest.
element.comment: This is generally only used for "exception" statuses such as "suspended" or "cancelled". The reason why the MedicationRequest was created at all is captured in reasonCode, not here.

binding.name: MedicationRequestStatusReason
binding.description: Identifies the reasons for a given status.

element.name: intent
element.description: proposal | plan | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
element.definition: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.
element.comment: It is expected that the type of requester will be restricted for different stages of a MedicationRequest. For example, Proposals can be created by a patient, relatedPerson, Practitioner or Device. Plans can be created by Practitioners, Patients, RelatedPersons and Devices. Original orders can be created by a Practitioner only. An instance-order is an instantiation of a request or order and may be used to populate Medication Administration Record. This element is labeled as a modifier because the intent alters when and how the resource is actually applicable.

binding.name: MedicationRequestIntent
binding.description: The kind of medication order.

element.name: category
element.definition: Indicates the type of medication request (for example, where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered (i.e. inpatient or outpatient)).
element.comment: The category can be used to include where the medication is expected to be consumed or other types of requests.

binding.name: MedicationRequestCategory
binding.description: A coded concept identifying the category of medication request. For example, where the medication is to be consumed or administered, or the type of medication treatment.

element.name: priority
element.definition: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

binding.name: MedicationRequestPriority
binding.description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

element.name: doNotPerform
element.description: True if request is prohibiting action
element.definition: If true indicates that the provider is asking for the medication request not to occur.
element.comment: If do not perform is not specified, the request is a positive request e.g. "do perform".

element.name: reported
element.definition: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record. It may also indicate the source of the report.

element.name: medication
element.definition: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
element.comment: If only a code is specified, then it needs to be a code for a specific product. If more information is required, then the use of the Medication resource is recommended. For example, if you require form or lot number or if the medication is compounded or extemporaneously prepared, then you must reference the Medication resource.

binding.name: MedicationCode
binding.description: A coded concept identifying substance or product that can be ordered.

element.name: subject
element.description: Who or group medication request is for
element.definition: A link to a resource representing the person or set of individuals to whom the medication will be given.
element.comment: The subject on a medication request is mandatory. For the secondary use case where the actual subject is not provided, there still must be an anonymized subject specified.

element.name: encounter
element.description: Encounter created as part of encounter/admission/stay
element.definition: The Encounter during which this [x] was created or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter." If there is a need to link to episodes of care they will be handled with an extension.

element.name: supportingInformation
element.description: Information to support ordering of the medication
element.definition: Include additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the ordering of the medication.

element.name: authoredOn
element.definition: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

element.name: requester
element.definition: The individual, organization, or device that initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

element.name: performer
element.definition: The specified desired performer of the medication treatment (e.g. the performer of the medication administration).

element.name: performerType
element.description: Desired kind of performer of the medication administration
element.definition: Indicates the type of performer of the administration of the medication.
element.comment: If specified without indicating a performer, this indicates that the performer must be of the specified type. If specified with a performer then it indicates the requirements of the performer if the designated performer is not available.

binding.name: MedicationRequestPerformerType
binding.description: Identifies the type of individual that is desired to administer the medication.

element.name: recorder
element.definition: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

element.name: reasonCode
element.description: Reason or indication for ordering or not ordering the medication
element.definition: The reason or the indication for ordering or not ordering the medication.
element.comment: This could be a diagnosis code. If a full condition record exists or additional detail is needed, use reasonReference.

binding.name: MedicationRequestReason
binding.description: A coded concept indicating why the medication was ordered.

element.name: reasonReference
element.description: Condition or observation that supports why the prescription is being written
element.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.
element.comment: This is a reference to a condition or observation that is the reason for the medication order. If only a code exists, use reasonCode.

element.name: instantiatesCanonical
element.definition: The URL pointing to a protocol, guideline, orderset, or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this MedicationRequest.

element.name: instantiatesUri
element.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this MedicationRequest.

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

element.name: groupIdentifier
element.description: Composite request this is part of
element.definition: A shared identifier common to all requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the identifier of the requisition or prescription.

element.name: courseOfTherapyType
element.definition: The description of the overall patte3rn of the administration of the medication to the patient.
element.comment: This attribute should not be confused with the protocol of the medication.

binding.name: MedicationRequestCourseOfTherapy
binding.description: Identifies the overall pattern of medication administratio.

element.name: insurance
element.definition: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be required for delivering the requested service.

element.name: note
element.definition: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

element.name: dosageInstruction
element.description: How the medication should be taken
element.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.
element.comment: There are examples where a medication request may include the option of an oral dose or an Intravenous or Intramuscular dose. For example, "Ondansetron 8mg orally or IV twice a day as needed for nausea" or "Compazine (prochlorperazine) 5-10mg PO or 25mg PR bid prn nausea or vomiting". In these cases, two medication requests would be created that could be grouped together. The decision on which dose and route of administration to use is based on the patient's condition at the time the dose is needed.

element.name: dispenseRequest
element.definition: Indicates the specific details for the dispense or medication supply part of a medication request (also known as a Medication Prescription or Medication Order). Note that this information is not always sent with the order. There may be in some settings (e.g. hospitals) institutional or system support for completing the dispense details in the pharmacy department.

element.name: substitution
element.definition: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases, substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen. This block explains the prescriber's intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

element.name: priorPrescription
element.description: An order/prescription that is being replaced
element.definition: A link to a resource representing an earlier order related order or prescription.

element.name: detectedIssue
element.definition: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.
element.comment: This element can include a detected issue that has been identified either by a decision support system or by a clinician and may include information on the steps that were taken to address the issue.

element.name: eventHistory
element.description: A list of events of interest in the lifecycle
element.definition: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this resource or fulfilling request or event resources that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the resource.
element.comment: This might not include provenances for all versions of the request only those deemed relevant or important. This SHALL NOT include the provenance associated with this current version of the resource. (If that provenance is deemed to be a relevant change, it will need to be added as part of a later update. Until then, it can be queried directly as the provenance that points to this version using _revinclude All Provenances should have some historical version of this Request as their subject.).

element.name: initialFill
element.definition: Indicates the quantity or duration for the first dispense of the medication.
element.comment: If populating this element, either the quantity or the duration must be included.

element.name: dispenseInterval
element.description: Minimum period of time between dispenses
element.definition: The minimum period of time that must occur between dispenses of the medication.

element.name: validityPeriod
element.description: Time period supply is authorized for
element.definition: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription).
element.comment: It reflects the prescribers' perspective for the validity of the prescription. Dispenses must not be made against the prescription outside of this period. The lower-bound of the Dispensing Window signifies the earliest date that the prescription can be filled for the first time. If an upper-bound is not specified then the Prescription is open-ended or will default to a stale-date based on regulations.

element.name: numberOfRepeatsAllowed
element.definition: An integer indicating the number of times, in addition to the original dispense, (aka refills or repeats) that the patient can receive the prescribed medication. Usage Notes: This integer does not include the original order dispense. This means that if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus "3 repeats", then the order can be dispensed a total of 4 times and the patient can receive a total of 120 tablets. A prescriber may explicitly say that zero refills are permitted after the initial dispense.
element.comment: If displaying "number of authorized fills", add 1 to this number.

element.name: quantity
element.description: Amount of medication to supply per dispense
element.definition: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.

element.name: expectedSupplyDuration
element.description: Number of days supply per dispense
element.definition: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.
element.comment: In some situations, this attribute may be used instead of quantity to identify the amount supplied by how long it is expected to last, rather than the physical quantity issued, e.g. 90 days supply of medication (based on an ordered dosage). When possible, it is always better to specify quantity, as this tends to be more precise. expectedSupplyDuration will always be an estimate that can be influenced by external factors.

element.name: performer
element.definition: Indicates the intended dispensing Organization specified by the prescriber.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: The amount or quantity to provide as part of the first dispense.

element.name: duration
element.definition: The length of time that the first dispense is expected to last.

element.name: allowed
element.description: Whether substitution is allowed or not
element.definition: True if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because whether substitution is allow or not, it cannot be ignored.

binding.name: MedicationRequestSubstitution
binding.description: Identifies the type of substitution allowed.

element.name: reason
element.definition: Indicates the reason for the substitution, or why substitution must or must not be performed.

binding.name: MedicationIntendedSubstitutionReason
binding.description: A coded concept describing the reason that a different medication should (or should not) be substituted from what was prescribed.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Identifiers associated with this Medication Statement that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. They are business identifiers assigned to this resource by the performer or other systems and remain constant as the resource is updated and propagates from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier.

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

element.name: partOf
element.definition: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.

element.name: status
element.description: active | completed | entered-in-error | intended | stopped | on-hold | unknown | not-taken
element.definition: A code representing the patient or other source's judgment about the state of the medication used that this statement is about. Generally, this will be active or completed.
element.comment: MedicationStatement is a statement at a point in time. The status is only representative at the point when it was asserted. The value set for MedicationStatement.status contains codes that assert the status of the use of the medication by the patient (for example, stopped or on hold) as well as codes that assert the status of the medication statement itself (for example, entered in error). This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: MedicationStatementStatus
binding.description: A coded concept indicating the current status of a MedicationStatement.

element.name: statusReason
element.definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the MedicationStatement.
element.comment: This is generally only used for "exception" statuses such as "not-taken", "on-hold", "cancelled" or "entered-in-error". The reason for performing the event at all is captured in reasonCode, not here.

binding.name: MedicationStatementStatusReason
binding.description: A coded concept indicating the reason for the status of the statement.

element.name: category
element.definition: Indicates where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered.

binding.name: MedicationStatementCategory
binding.description: A coded concept identifying where the medication included in the MedicationStatement is expected to be consumed or administered.

element.name: medication
element.definition: Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
element.comment: If only a code is specified, then it needs to be a code for a specific product. If more information is required, then the use of the medication resource is recommended. For example, if you require form or lot number, then you must reference the Medication resource.

binding.name: MedicationCode
binding.description: A coded concept identifying the substance or product being taken.

element.name: subject
element.definition: The person, animal or group who is/was taking the medication.

element.name: context
element.definition: The encounter or episode of care that establishes the context for this MedicationStatement.

element.name: effective
element.description: The date/time or interval when the medication is/was/will be taken
element.definition: The interval of time during which it is being asserted that the patient is/was/will be taking the medication (or was not taking, when the MedicationStatement.taken element is No).
element.comment: This attribute reflects the period over which the patient consumed the medication and is expected to be populated on the majority of Medication Statements. If the medication is still being taken at the time the statement is recorded, the "end" date will be omitted. The date/time attribute supports a variety of dates - year, year/month and exact date. If something more than this is required, this should be conveyed as text.

element.name: dateAsserted
element.definition: The date when the medication statement was asserted by the information source.

element.name: informationSource
element.description: Person or organization that provided the information about the taking of this medication
element.definition: The person or organization that provided the information about the taking of this medication. Note: Use derivedFrom when a MedicationStatement is derived from other resources, e.g. Claim or MedicationRequest.

element.name: derivedFrom
element.definition: Allows linking the MedicationStatement to the underlying MedicationRequest, or to other information that supports or is used to derive the MedicationStatement.
element.comment: Likely references would be to MedicationRequest, MedicationDispense, Claim, Observation or QuestionnaireAnswers. The most common use cases for deriving a MedicationStatement comes from creating a MedicationStatement from a MedicationRequest or from a lab observation or a claim. it should be noted that the amount of information that is available varies from the type resource that you derive the MedicationStatement from.

element.name: reasonCode
element.description: Reason for why the medication is being/was taken
element.definition: A reason for why the medication is being/was taken.
element.comment: This could be a diagnosis code. If a full condition record exists or additional detail is needed, use reasonForUseReference.

binding.name: MedicationReason
binding.description: A coded concept identifying why the medication is being taken.

element.name: reasonReference
element.description: Condition or observation that supports why the medication is being/was taken
element.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication is being/was taken.
element.comment: This is a reference to a condition that is the reason why the medication is being/was taken. If only a code exists, use reasonForUseCode.

element.name: note
element.definition: Provides extra information about the medication statement that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

element.name: dosage
element.description: Details of how medication is/was taken or should be taken
element.definition: Indicates how the medication is/was or should be taken by the patient.
element.comment: The dates included in the dosage on a Medication Statement reflect the dates for a given dose. For example, "from November 1, 2016 to November 3, 2016, take one tablet daily and from November 4, 2016 to November 7, 2016, take two tablets daily." It is expected that this specificity may only be populated where the patient brings in their labeled container or where the Medication Statement is derived from a MedicationRequest.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID
element.definition: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID.

element.name: type
element.description: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized
element.definition: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized.

element.name: domain
element.description: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses
element.definition: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses.

element.name: combinedPharmaceuticalDoseForm
element.description: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product

element.definition: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons.

element.definition: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons.

element.definition: Allows the product to be classified by various systems.

element.definition: Marketing status of the medicinal product, in contrast to marketing authorizaton.

element.definition: Coded expression for the route.

element.name: firstDose
element.description: The first dose (dose quantity) administered in humans can be specified, for a product under investigation, using a numerical value and its unit of measurement
element.definition: The first dose (dose quantity) administered in humans can be specified, for a product under investigation, using a numerical value and its unit of measurement.

element.name: maxSingleDose
element.description: The maximum single dose that can be administered as per the protocol of a clinical trial can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement
element.definition: The maximum single dose that can be administered as per the protocol of a clinical trial can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement.

element.name: maxDosePerDay
element.description: The maximum dose per day (maximum dose quantity to be administered in any one 24-h period) that can be administered as per the protocol referenced in the clinical trial authorisation
element.definition: The maximum dose per day (maximum dose quantity to be administered in any one 24-h period) that can be administered as per the protocol referenced in the clinical trial authorisation.

element.name: maxDosePerTreatmentPeriod
element.description: The maximum dose per treatment period that can be administered as per the protocol referenced in the clinical trial authorisation
element.definition: The maximum dose per treatment period that can be administered as per the protocol referenced in the clinical trial authorisation.

element.name: maxTreatmentPeriod
element.description: The maximum treatment period during which an Investigational Medicinal Product can be administered as per the protocol referenced in the clinical trial authorisation
element.definition: The maximum treatment period during which an Investigational Medicinal Product can be administered as per the protocol referenced in the clinical trial authorisation.

element.name: targetSpecies
element.description: A species for which this route applies
element.definition: A species for which this route applies.

element.name: code
element.definition: Coded expression for the species.

element.name: withdrawalPeriod
element.description: A species specific time during which consumption of animal product is not appropriate
element.definition: A species specific time during which consumption of animal product is not appropriate.

element.name: tissue
element.description: Coded expression for the type of tissue for which the withdrawal period applues, e.g. meat, milk
element.definition: Coded expression for the type of tissue for which the withdrawal period applues, e.g. meat, milk.

element.name: value
element.definition: A value for the time.

element.name: supportingInformation
element.description: Extra information about the withdrawal period
element.definition: Extra information about the withdrawal period.

element.name: subject
element.description: The medication for which this is an indication
element.definition: The medication for which this is an indication.

element.name: symptomConditionEffect
element.description: The symptom, condition or undesirable effect
element.definition: The symptom, condition or undesirable effect.

element.name: classification
element.definition: Classification of the effect.

element.name: frequencyOfOccurrence
element.description: The frequency of occurrence of the effect
element.definition: The frequency of occurrence of the effect.

element.name: population
element.description: The population group to which this applies
element.definition: The population group to which this applies.

element.name: url
element.description: Business Identifier for a given MessageDefinition
element.definition: The business identifier that is used to reference the MessageDefinition and *is* expected to be consistent from server to server.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Primary key for the message definition on a given server
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this message definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this message definition outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the message definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the message definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the message definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
element.comment: There may be different message definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the message definition with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this message definition (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the message definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

element.name: title
element.description: Name for this message definition (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the message definition.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

element.name: replaces
element.definition: A MessageDefinition that is superseded by this definition.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of this message definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of message definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: experimental
element.description: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this message definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of message definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the message definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the message definition changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the message definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the message definition.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the message definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the message definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the message definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the message definition
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the message definition from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the message definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the message definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the message definition is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the message definition was created).

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate message definition instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for message definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the message definition is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the message definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: purpose
element.description: Why this message definition is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this message definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the message definition. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this message definition.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the message definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the message definition.

element.name: base
element.description: Definition this one is based on
element.definition: The MessageDefinition that is the basis for the contents of this resource.

element.name: parent
element.definition: Identifies a protocol or workflow that this MessageDefinition represents a step in.
element.comment: It should be possible to use MessageDefinition to describe a message to be used by certain steps in a particular protocol as part of a PlanDefinition or ActivityDefinition.

element.name: event
element.description: Event code or link to the EventDefinition
element.definition: Event code or link to the EventDefinition.

binding.name: MessageEvent
binding.description: One of the message events defined as part of this version of FHIR.

element.name: category
element.definition: The impact of the content of the message.

binding.name: MessageSignificanceCategory
binding.description: The impact of the content of a message.

element.name: focus
element.description: Resource(s) that are the subject of the event
element.definition: Identifies the resource (or resources) that are being addressed by the event. For example, the Encounter for an admit message or two Account records for a merge.

constraint.name: md-1
constraint.message: Max must be postive int or *

element.name: responseRequired
element.definition: Declare at a message definition level whether a response is required or only upon error or success, or never.
element.comment: This enables the capability currently available through MSH-16 (Application Level acknowledgement) in HL7 Version 2 to declare at a message instance level whether a response is required or only upon error or success, or never.

binding.name: messageheader-response-request
binding.description: HL7-defined table of codes which identify conditions under which acknowledgments are required to be returned in response to a message.

element.name: allowedResponse
element.definition: Indicates what types of messages may be sent as an application-level response to this message.
element.comment: This indicates an application level response to "close" a transaction implicit in a particular request message. To define a complete workflow scenario, look to the [[PlanDefinition]] resource which allows the definition of complex orchestrations, conditionality, etc.

element.name: graph
element.definition: Canonical reference to a GraphDefinition. If a URL is provided, it is the canonical reference to a [GraphDefinition](graphdefinition.html) that it controls what resources are to be added to the bundle when building the document. The GraphDefinition can also specify profiles that apply to the various resources.

element.name: message
element.description: Reference to allowed message definition response
element.definition: A reference to the message definition that must be adhered to by this supported response.

element.name: situation
element.description: When should this response be used
element.definition: Provides a description of the circumstances in which this response should be used (as opposed to one of the alternative responses).

element.name: code
element.definition: The kind of resource that must be the focus for this message.
element.comment: Multiple focuses addressing different resources may occasionally occur. E.g. to link or unlink a resource from a particular account or encounter, etc.

binding.name: ResourceType
binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

element.name: profile
element.description: Profile that must be adhered to by focus
element.definition: A profile that reflects constraints for the focal resource (and potentially for related resources).
element.comment: This should be present for most message definitions. However, if the message focus is only a single resource and there is no need to include referenced resources or otherwise enforce the presence of particular elements, it can be omitted.

element.name: min
element.description: Minimum number of focuses of this type
element.definition: Identifies the minimum number of resources of this type that must be pointed to by a message in order for it to be valid against this MessageDefinition.

element.name: max
element.description: Maximum number of focuses of this type
element.definition: Identifies the maximum number of resources of this type that must be pointed to by a message in order for it to be valid against this MessageDefinition.

element.name: event
element.description: Code for the event this message represents or link to event definition
element.definition: Code that identifies the event this message represents and connects it with its definition. Events defined as part of the FHIR specification have the system value "http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/message-events". Alternatively uri to the EventDefinition.
element.comment: The time of the event will be found in the focus resource. The time of the message will be found in [Bundle.timestamp](bundle-definitions.html#Bundle.timestamp).

binding.name: MessageEvent
binding.description: One of the message events defined as part of this version of FHIR.

element.name: destination
element.definition: The destination application which the message is intended for.
element.comment: There SHOULD be at least one destination, but in some circumstances, the source system is unaware of any particular destination system.

element.name: sender
element.description: Real world sender of the message
element.definition: Identifies the sending system to allow the use of a trust relationship.
element.comment: Use case is for where a (trusted) sending system is responsible for multiple organizations, and therefore cannot differentiate based on source endpoint / authentication alone.

element.name: enterer
element.description: The source of the data entry
element.definition: The person or device that performed the data entry leading to this message. When there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the message. Can provide other enterers in extensions.
element.comment: Usually only for the request but can be used in a response.

element.name: author
element.definition: The logical author of the message - the person or device that decided the described event should happen. When there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the MessageHeader. Can provide other authors in extensions.
element.comment: Usually only for the request but can be used in a response.

element.name: source
element.definition: The source application from which this message originated.

element.name: responsible
element.definition: The person or organization that accepts overall responsibility for the contents of the message. The implication is that the message event happened under the policies of the responsible party.
element.comment: Usually only for the request but can be used in a response.

element.name: reason
element.definition: Coded indication of the cause for the event - indicates a reason for the occurrence of the event that is a focus of this message.

binding.name: EventReason
binding.description: Reason for event occurrence.

element.name: response
element.description: If this is a reply to prior message
element.definition: Information about the message that this message is a response to. Only present if this message is a response.

element.name: focus
element.description: The actual content of the message
element.definition: The actual data of the message - a reference to the root/focus class of the event.
element.comment: The data is defined where the transaction type is defined. The transaction data is always included in the bundle that is the full message. Only the root resource is specified. The resources it references should be contained in the bundle but are not also listed here. Multiple repetitions are allowed to cater for merges and other situations with multiple focal targets.

element.name: definition
element.description: Link to the definition for this message
element.definition: Permanent link to the MessageDefinition for this message.

element.name: name
element.definition: Human-readable name for the target system.

element.name: target
element.description: Particular delivery destination within the destination
element.definition: Identifies the target end system in situations where the initial message transmission is to an intermediary system.

element.name: endpoint
element.definition: Indicates where the message should be routed to.
element.comment: The id may be a non-resolvable URI for systems that do not use standard network-based addresses.

element.name: receiver
element.definition: Allows data conveyed by a message to be addressed to a particular person or department when routing to a specific application isn't sufficient.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: The MessageHeader.id of the message to which this message is a response.

element.name: code
element.definition: Code that identifies the type of response to the message - whether it was successful or not, and whether it should be resent or not.
element.comment: This is a generic response to the request message. Specific data for the response will be found in MessageHeader.focus.

binding.name: ResponseType
binding.description: The kind of response to a message.

element.name: details
element.definition: Full details of any issues found in the message.
element.comment: This SHALL be contained in the bundle. If any of the issues are errors, the response code SHALL be an error.

element.name: name
element.definition: Human-readable name for the source system.

element.name: software
element.description: Name of software running the system
element.definition: May include configuration or other information useful in debugging.

element.name: version
element.definition: Can convey versions of multiple systems in situations where a message passes through multiple hands.

element.name: contact
element.definition: An e-mail, phone, website or other contact point to use to resolve issues with message communications.

element.name: endpoint
element.description: Actual message source address or id
element.definition: Identifies the routing target to send acknowledgements to.
element.comment: The id may be a non-resolvable URI for systems that do not use standard network-based addresses.

element.name: versionId
element.definition: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the URL. This value changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.
element.comment: The server assigns this value, and ignores what the client specifies, except in the case that the server is imposing version integrity on updates/deletes.

element.name: lastUpdated
element.description: When the resource version last changed
element.definition: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.
element.comment: This value is always populated except when the resource is first being created. The server / resource manager sets this value; what a client provides is irrelevant. This is equivalent to the HTTP Last-Modified and SHOULD have the same value on a [read](http.html#read) interaction.

element.name: source
element.description: Identifies where the resource comes from
element.definition: A uri that identifies the source system of the resource. This provides a minimal amount of [Provenance](provenance.html#) information that can be used to track or differentiate the source of information in the resource. The source may identify another FHIR server, document, message, database, etc.
element.comment:
In the provenance resource, this corresponds to Provenance.entity.what[x]. The exact use of the source (and the implied Provenance.entity.role) is left to implementer discretion. Only one nominated source is allowed; for additional provenance details, a full Provenance resource should be used.
This element can be used to indicate where the current master source of a resource that has a canonical URL if the resource is no longer hosted at the canonical URL.

element.name: profile
element.description: Profiles this resource claims to conform to
element.definition: A list of profiles (references to [StructureDefinition](structuredefinition.html#) resources) that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to [StructureDefinition.url](structuredefinition-definitions.html#StructureDefinition.url).
element.comment: It is up to the server and/or other infrastructure of policy to determine whether/how these claims are verified and/or updated over time. The list of profile URLs is a set.

element.name: security
element.description: Security Labels applied to this resource
element.definition: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.
element.comment: The security labels can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of security labels is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

binding.name: SecurityLabels
binding.description: Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.

element.name: tag
element.definition: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.
element.comment: The tags can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of tags is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

binding.name: Tags
binding.description: Codes that represent various types of tags, commonly workflow-related; e.g. "Needs review by Dr. Jones".

element.name: identifier
element.description: Unique ID for this particular sequence. This is a FHIR-defined id
element.definition: A unique identifier for this particular sequence instance. This is a FHIR-defined id.

element.name: type
element.definition: Amino Acid Sequence/ DNA Sequence / RNA Sequence.

binding.name: sequenceType
binding.description: Type if a sequence -- DNA, RNA, or amino acid sequence.

element.name: coordinateSystem
element.description: Base number of coordinate system (0 for 0-based numbering or coordinates, inclusive start, exclusive end, 1 for 1-based numbering, inclusive start, inclusive end)
element.definition: Whether the sequence is numbered starting at 0 (0-based numbering or coordinates, inclusive start, exclusive end) or starting at 1 (1-based numbering, inclusive start and inclusive end).

element.name: patient
element.description: Who and/or what this is about
element.definition: The patient whose sequencing results are described by this resource.

element.name: specimen
element.definition: Specimen used for sequencing.

element.name: device
element.definition: The method for sequencing, for example, chip information.

element.name: performer
element.description: Who should be responsible for test result
element.definition: The organization or lab that should be responsible for this result.

element.name: quantity
element.description: The number of copies of the sequence of interest. (RNASeq)
element.definition: The number of copies of the sequence of interest. (RNASeq).

element.name: referenceSeq
element.definition: A sequence that is used as a reference to describe variants that are present in a sequence analyzed.

constraint.name: msq-6
constraint.message: Have and only have one of the following elements in referenceSeq : 1. genomeBuild ; 2 referenceSeqId; 3. referenceSeqPointer; 4. referenceSeqString;

constraint.name: msq-5
constraint.message: GenomeBuild and chromosome must be both contained if either one of them is contained

element.name: variant
element.definition: The definition of variant here originates from Sequence ontology ([variant_of](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/variant_of)). This element can represent amino acid or nucleic sequence change(including insertion,deletion,SNP,etc.) It can represent some complex mutation or segment variation with the assist of CIGAR string.

element.name: observedSeq
element.definition: Sequence that was observed. It is the result marked by referenceSeq along with variant records on referenceSeq. This shall start from referenceSeq.windowStart and end by referenceSeq.windowEnd.

element.name: quality
element.description: An set of value as quality of sequence
element.definition: An experimental feature attribute that defines the quality of the feature in a quantitative way, such as a phred quality score ([SO:0001686](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/SO:0001686)).

element.name: readCoverage
element.description: Average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence
element.definition: Coverage (read depth or depth) is the average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.

element.name: repository
element.description: External repository which contains detailed report related with observedSeq in this resource
element.definition: Configurations of the external repository. The repository shall store target's observedSeq or records related with target's observedSeq.

element.name: pointer
element.definition: Pointer to next atomic sequence which at most contains one variant.

element.name: structureVariant
element.definition: Information about chromosome structure variation.

element.name: type
element.definition: INDEL / SNP / Undefined variant.

binding.name: qualityType
binding.description: Type for quality report.

element.name: standardSequence
element.definition: Gold standard sequence used for comparing against.

binding.name: qualityStandardSequence
binding.description: Reference identifier of the sequence that used to mark the quality of tested samples.

element.name: start
element.definition: Start position of the sequence. If the coordinate system is either 0-based or 1-based, then start position is inclusive.

element.name: end
element.definition: End position of the sequence. If the coordinate system is 0-based then end is exclusive and does not include the last position. If the coordinate system is 1-base, then end is inclusive and includes the last position.

element.name: score
element.definition: The score of an experimentally derived feature such as a p-value ([SO:0001685](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/SO:0001685)).

element.name: method
element.definition: Which method is used to get sequence quality.

binding.name: qualityMethod
binding.description: The method used to evaluate the numerical quality of the observed sequence.

element.name: truthTP
element.description: True positives from the perspective of the truth data
element.definition: True positives, from the perspective of the truth data, i.e. the number of sites in the Truth Call Set for which there are paths through the Query Call Set that are consistent with all of the alleles at this site, and for which there is an accurate genotype call for the event.

element.name: queryTP
element.description: True positives from the perspective of the query data
element.definition: True positives, from the perspective of the query data, i.e. the number of sites in the Query Call Set for which there are paths through the Truth Call Set that are consistent with all of the alleles at this site, and for which there is an accurate genotype call for the event.

element.name: truthFN
element.definition: False negatives, i.e. the number of sites in the Truth Call Set for which there is no path through the Query Call Set that is consistent with all of the alleles at this site, or sites for which there is an inaccurate genotype call for the event. Sites with correct variant but incorrect genotype are counted here.

element.name: queryFP
element.definition: False positives, i.e. the number of sites in the Query Call Set for which there is no path through the Truth Call Set that is consistent with this site. Sites with correct variant but incorrect genotype are counted here.

element.name: gtFP
element.description: False positives where the non-REF alleles in the Truth and Query Call Sets match
element.definition: The number of false positives where the non-REF alleles in the Truth and Query Call Sets match (i.e. cases where the truth is 1/1 and the query is 0/1 or similar).

element.name: precision
element.definition: QUERY.TP / (QUERY.TP + QUERY.FP).

element.name: recall
element.definition: TRUTH.TP / (TRUTH.TP + TRUTH.FN).

element.name: fScore
element.definition: Harmonic mean of Recall and Precision, computed as: 2 * precision * recall / (precision + recall).

element.name: roc
element.definition: Receiver Operator Characteristic (ROC) Curve to give sensitivity/specificity tradeoff.

element.name: score
element.definition: Invidual data point representing the GQ (genotype quality) score threshold.

element.name: numTP
element.definition: The number of true positives if the GQ score threshold was set to "score" field value.

element.name: numFP
element.definition: The number of false positives if the GQ score threshold was set to "score" field value.

element.name: numFN
element.definition: The number of false negatives if the GQ score threshold was set to "score" field value.

element.name: precision
element.definition: Calculated precision if the GQ score threshold was set to "score" field value.

element.name: sensitivity
element.definition: Calculated sensitivity if the GQ score threshold was set to "score" field value.

element.name: fMeasure
element.definition: Calculated fScore if the GQ score threshold was set to "score" field value.

element.name: chromosome
element.definition: Structural unit composed of a nucleic acid molecule which controls its own replication through the interaction of specific proteins at one or more origins of replication ([SO:0000340](http://www.sequenceontology.org/browser/current_svn/term/SO:0000340)).

binding.name: chromosome-human
