element.description: Contact details (telephone, email, etc.) for a contact
element.definition: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the party may be contacted.

element.name: address
element.description: Visiting or postal addresses for the contact
element.definition: Visiting or postal addresses for the contact.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business identifiers that are specific to this role
element.definition: Business identifiers that are specific to this role.

element.name: active
element.description: Whether this organization affiliation record is in active use
element.definition: Whether this organization affiliation record is in active use.
element.comment: If this value is false, you may refer to the period to see when the role was in active use. If there is no period specified, no inference can be made about when it was active.

element.name: period
element.description: The period during which the participatingOrganization is affiliated with the primary organization
element.definition: The period during which the participatingOrganization is affiliated with the primary organization.

element.name: organization
element.description: Organization where the role is available
element.definition: Organization where the role is available (primary organization/has members).

element.name: participatingOrganization
element.description: Organization that provides/performs the role (e.g. providing services or is a member of)
element.definition: The Participating Organization provides/performs the role(s) defined by the code to the Primary Organization (e.g. providing services or is a member of).

element.name: network
element.description: Health insurance provider network in which the participatingOrganization provides the role's services (if defined) at the indicated locations (if defined)
element.definition: Health insurance provider network in which the participatingOrganization provides the role's services (if defined) at the indicated locations (if defined).

element.name: code
element.description: Definition of the role the participatingOrganization plays
element.definition: Definition of the role the participatingOrganization plays in the association.

binding.name: OrganizationAffiliation
binding.description: The role the participating organization providing services to the primary organization.

element.name: specialty
element.description: Specific specialty of the participatingOrganization in the context of the role
element.definition: Specific specialty of the participatingOrganization in the context of the role.

binding.name: OrganizationSpecialty
binding.description: Specific specialty associated with the participating organization.

element.name: location
element.description: The location(s) at which the role occurs
element.definition: The location(s) at which the role occurs.

element.name: healthcareService
element.description: Healthcare services provided through the role
element.definition: Healthcare services provided through the role.

element.name: telecom
element.description: Contact details at the participatingOrganization relevant to this Affiliation
element.definition: Contact details at the participatingOrganization relevant to this Affiliation.

element.name: endpoint
element.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for this role
element.definition: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for this role.

element.name: name
element.description: Name used to access the parameter value
element.definition: The name of the parameter used to allow access to the value of the parameter in evaluation contexts.

element.name: use
element.definition: Whether the parameter is input or output for the module.

binding.name: ParameterUse
binding.description: Whether the parameter is input or output.

element.name: min
element.definition: The minimum number of times this parameter SHALL appear in the request or response.

element.name: max
element.definition: The maximum number of times this element is permitted to appear in the request or response.

element.name: documentation
element.description: A brief description of the parameter
element.definition: A brief discussion of what the parameter is for and how it is used by the module.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of the parameter.

binding.name: FHIRAllTypes
binding.description: A list of all the concrete types defined in this version of the FHIR specification - Abstract Types, Data Types and Resource Types.

element.name: profile
element.description: What profile the value is expected to be
element.definition: If specified, this indicates a profile that the input data must conform to, or that the output data will conform to.

element.name: parameter
element.definition: A parameter passed to or received from the operation.

constraint.name: inv-1
constraint.message: A parameter must have one and only one of (value, resource, part)

expression.expression: (part.exists() and value.empty() and resource.empty()) or (part.empty() and (value.exists() xor resource.exists()))

element.name: name
element.definition: The name of the parameter (reference to the operation definition).

element.name: value
element.description: If parameter is a data type
element.definition: If the parameter is a data type.

element.name: resource
element.description: If parameter is a whole resource
element.definition: If the parameter is a whole resource.
element.comment: When resolving references in resources, the operation definition may specify how references may be resolved between parameters. If a reference cannot be resolved between the parameters, the application should fall back to it's general resource resolution methods.

element.name: part
element.description: Named part of a multi-part parameter
element.definition: A named part of a multi-part parameter.
element.comment: Only one level of nested parameters is allowed.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: An identifier for this patient.

element.name: active
element.description: Whether this patient's record is in active use
element.definition:
Whether this patient record is in active use. Many systems use this property to mark as non-current patients, such as those that have not been seen for a period of time based on an organization's business rules.
It is often used to filter patient lists to exclude inactive patients
Deceased patients may also be marked as inactive for the same reasons, but may be active for some time after death.
element.comment: If a record is inactive, and linked to an active record, then future patient/record updates should occur on the other patient.

element.name: name
element.description: A name associated with the patient
element.definition: A name associated with the individual.
element.comment: A patient may have multiple names with different uses or applicable periods. For animals, the name is a "HumanName" in the sense that is assigned and used by humans and has the same patterns.

element.name: telecom
element.description: A contact detail for the individual
element.definition: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the individual may be contacted.
element.comment: A Patient may have multiple ways to be contacted with different uses or applicable periods. May need to have options for contacting the person urgently and also to help with identification. The address might not go directly to the individual, but may reach another party that is able to proxy for the patient (i.e. home phone, or pet owner's phone).

element.name: gender
element.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.
element.comment: The gender might not match the biological sex as determined by genetics or the individual's preferred identification. Note that for both humans and particularly animals, there are other legitimate possibilities than male and female, though the vast majority of systems and contexts only support male and female. Systems providing decision support or enforcing business rules should ideally do this on the basis of Observations dealing with the specific sex or gender aspect of interest (anatomical, chromosomal, social, etc.) However, because these observations are infrequently recorded, defaulting to the administrative gender is common practice. Where such defaulting occurs, rule enforcement should allow for the variation between administrative and biological, chromosomal and other gender aspects. For example, an alert about a hysterectomy on a male should be handled as a warning or overridable error, not a "hard" error. See the Patient Gender and Sex section for additional information about communicating patient gender and sex.

binding.name: AdministrativeGender
binding.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

element.name: birthDate
element.description: The date of birth for the individual
element.definition: The date of birth for the individual.
element.comment: At least an estimated year should be provided as a guess if the real DOB is unknown There is a standard extension "patient-birthTime" available that should be used where Time is required (such as in maternity/infant care systems).

element.name: deceased
element.description: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not
element.definition: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not.
element.comment: If there's no value in the instance, it means there is no statement on whether or not the individual is deceased. Most systems will interpret the absence of a value as a sign of the person being alive.

element.name: address
element.definition: An address for the individual.
element.comment: Patient may have multiple addresses with different uses or applicable periods.

element.name: maritalStatus
element.definition: This field contains a patient's most recent marital (civil) status.

binding.name: MaritalStatus
binding.description: The domestic partnership status of a person.

element.name: multipleBirth
element.description: Whether patient is part of a multiple birth
element.definition: Indicates whether the patient is part of a multiple (boolean) or indicates the actual birth order (integer).
element.comment: Where the valueInteger is provided, the number is the birth number in the sequence. E.g. The middle birth in triplets would be valueInteger=2 and the third born would have valueInteger=3 If a boolean value was provided for this triplets example, then all 3 patient records would have valueBoolean=true (the ordering is not indicated).

element.name: photo
element.definition: Image of the patient.
element.comment: Guidelines: * Use id photos, not clinical photos. * Limit dimensions to thumbnail. * Keep byte count low to ease resource updates.

element.name: contact
element.description: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient
element.definition: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient.
element.comment: Contact covers all kinds of contact parties: family members, business contacts, guardians, caregivers. Not applicable to register pedigree and family ties beyond use of having contact.

constraint.name: pat-1
constraint.message: SHALL at least contain a contact's details or a reference to an organization

expression.expression: name.exists() or telecom.exists() or address.exists() or organization.exists()

element.name: communication
element.description: A language which may be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health
element.definition: A language which may be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health.
element.comment: If no language is specified, this *implies* that the default local language is spoken. If you need to convey proficiency for multiple modes, then you need multiple Patient.Communication associations. For animals, language is not a relevant field, and should be absent from the instance. If the Patient does not speak the default local language, then the Interpreter Required Standard can be used to explicitly declare that an interpreter is required.

element.name: generalPractitioner
element.definition: Patient's nominated care provider.
element.comment:
This may be the primary care provider (in a GP context), or it may be a patient nominated care manager in a community/disability setting, or even organization that will provide people to perform the care provider roles. It is not to be used to record Care Teams, these should be in a CareTeam resource that may be linked to the CarePlan or EpisodeOfCare resources. Multiple GPs may be recorded against the patient for various reasons, such as a student that has his home GP listed along with the GP at university during the school semesters, or a "fly-in/fly-out" worker that has the onsite GP also included with his home GP to remain aware of medical issues.
Jurisdictions may decide that they can profile this down to 1 if desired, or 1 per type.

element.name: managingOrganization
element.description: Organization that is the custodian of the patient record
element.definition: Organization that is the custodian of the patient record.
element.comment: There is only one managing organization for a specific patient record. Other organizations will have their own Patient record, and may use the Link property to join the records together (or a Person resource which can include confidence ratings for the association).

element.name: link
element.description: Link to another patient resource that concerns the same actual person
element.definition: Link to another patient resource that concerns the same actual patient.
element.comment: There is no assumption that linked patient records have mutual links.

element.name: language
element.description: The language which can be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health
element.definition: The ISO-639-1 alpha 2 code in lower case for the language, optionally followed by a hyphen and the ISO-3166-1 alpha 2 code for the region in upper case; e.g. "en" for English, or "en-US" for American English versus "en-EN" for England English.
element.comment: The structure aa-BB with this exact casing is one the most widely used notations for locale. However not all systems actually code this but instead have it as free text. Hence CodeableConcept instead of code as the data type.

binding.name: Language
binding.description: A human language.

element.name: preferred
element.definition: Indicates whether or not the patient prefers this language (over other languages he masters up a certain level).
element.comment: This language is specifically identified for communicating healthcare information.

element.name: relationship
element.definition: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the contact person.

binding.name: ContactRelationship
binding.description: The nature of the relationship between a patient and a contact person for that patient.

element.name: name
element.description: A name associated with the contact person
element.definition: A name associated with the contact person.

element.name: telecom
element.description: A contact detail for the person
element.definition: A contact detail for the person, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.
element.comment: Contact may have multiple ways to be contacted with different uses or applicable periods. May need to have options for contacting the person urgently, and also to help with identification.

element.name: address
element.definition: Address for the contact person.

element.name: gender
element.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the contact person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

binding.name: AdministrativeGender
binding.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

element.name: organization
element.description: Organization that is associated with the contact
element.definition: Organization on behalf of which the contact is acting or for which the contact is working.

element.name: period
element.description: The period during which this contact person or organization is valid to be contacted relating to this patient
element.definition: The period during which this contact person or organization is valid to be contacted relating to this patient.

element.name: other
element.description: The other patient or related person resource that the link refers to
element.definition: The other patient resource that the link refers to.
element.comment: Referencing a RelatedPerson here removes the need to use a Person record to associate a Patient and RelatedPerson as the same individual.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of link between this patient resource and another patient resource.

binding.name: LinkType
binding.description: The type of link between this patient resource and another patient resource.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business Identifier for the payment noctice
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this payment notice.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the resource instance.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: PaymentNoticeStatus
binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

element.name: request
element.definition: Reference of resource for which payment is being made.

element.name: response
element.definition: Reference of response to resource for which payment is being made.

element.name: created
element.definition: The date when this resource was created.

element.name: provider
element.definition: The practitioner who is responsible for the services rendered to the patient.

element.name: payment
element.definition: A reference to the payment which is the subject of this notice.

element.name: paymentDate
element.definition: The date when the above payment action occurred.

element.name: payee
element.definition: The party who will receive or has received payment that is the subject of this notification.

element.name: recipient
element.definition: The party who is notified of the payment status.

element.name: amount
element.definition: The amount sent to the payee.

element.name: paymentStatus
element.description: Issued or cleared Status of the payment
element.definition: A code indicating whether payment has been sent or cleared.
element.comment: Typically paid: payment sent, cleared: payment received.

binding.name: PaymentStatus
binding.description: The payment conveyance status codes.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business Identifier for a payment reconciliation
element.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this payment reconciliation.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the resource instance.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: PaymentReconciliationStatus
binding.description: A code specifying the state of the resource instance.

element.name: period
element.definition: The period of time for which payments have been gathered into this bulk payment for settlement.

element.name: created
element.definition: The date when the resource was created.

element.name: paymentIssuer
element.definition: The party who generated the payment.
element.comment: This party is also responsible for the reconciliation.

element.name: request
element.definition: Original request resource reference.

element.name: requestor
element.definition: The practitioner who is responsible for the services rendered to the patient.

element.name: outcome
element.definition: The outcome of a request for a reconciliation.
element.comment: The resource may be used to indicate that: the request has been held (queued) for processing; that it has been processed and errors found (error); that no errors were found and that some of the adjudication has been undertaken (partial) or that all of the adjudication has been undertaken (complete).

binding.name: RemittanceOutcome
binding.description: The outcome of the processing.

element.name: disposition
element.definition: A human readable description of the status of the request for the reconciliation.

element.name: paymentDate
element.definition: The date of payment as indicated on the financial instrument.

element.name: paymentAmount
element.definition: Total payment amount as indicated on the financial instrument.

element.name: paymentIdentifier
element.definition: Issuer's unique identifier for the payment instrument.
element.comment: For example: EFT number or check number.

element.name: detail
element.definition: Distribution of the payment amount for a previously acknowledged payable.

element.name: formCode
element.definition: A code for the form to be used for printing the content.
element.comment: May be needed to identify specific jurisdictional forms.

binding.name: Forms
binding.description: The forms codes.

element.name: processNote
element.definition: A note that describes or explains the processing in a human readable form.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business identifier of the payment detail
element.definition: Unique identifier for the current payment item for the referenced payable.

element.name: predecessor
element.description: Business identifier of the prior payment detail
element.definition: Unique identifier for the prior payment item for the referenced payable.

element.name: type
element.definition: Code to indicate the nature of the payment.
element.comment: For example: payment, adjustment, funds advance, etc.

binding.name: PaymentType
binding.description: The reason for the amount: payment, adjustment, advance.

element.name: request
element.description: Request giving rise to the payment
element.definition: A resource, such as a Claim, the evaluation of which could lead to payment.

element.name: submitter
element.definition: The party which submitted the claim or financial transaction.

element.name: response
element.definition: A resource, such as a ClaimResponse, which contains a commitment to payment.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date from the response resource containing a commitment to pay.

element.name: responsible
element.definition: A reference to the individual who is responsible for inquiries regarding the response and its payment.

element.name: payee
element.definition: The party which is receiving the payment.

element.name: amount
element.definition: The monetary amount allocated from the total payment to the payable.

element.name: type
element.definition: The business purpose of the note text.

binding.name: NoteType
binding.description: The presentation types of notes.

element.name: text
element.definition: The explanation or description associated with the processing.

element.name: start
element.definition: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.
element.comment: If the low element is missing, the meaning is that the low boundary is not known.

element.name: end
element.description: End time with inclusive boundary, if not ongoing
element.definition: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means no end was known or planned at the time the instance was created. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.
element.comment: The high value includes any matching date/time. i.e. 2012-02-03T10:00:00 is in a period that has an end value of 2012-02-03.

element.name: identifier
element.description: A human identifier for this person
element.definition: Identifier for a person within a particular scope.

element.name: name
element.description: A name associated with the person
element.definition: A name associated with the person.
element.comment: Person may have multiple names with different uses or applicable periods.

element.name: telecom
element.description: A contact detail for the person
element.definition: A contact detail for the person, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.
element.comment: Person may have multiple ways to be contacted with different uses or applicable periods. May need to have options for contacting the person urgently and also to help with identification.

element.name: gender
element.definition: Administrative Gender.
element.comment: The gender might not match the biological sex as determined by genetics, or the individual's preferred identification. Note that for both humans and particularly animals, there are other legitimate possibilities than M and F, though a clear majority of systems and contexts only support M and F.

binding.name: AdministrativeGender
binding.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

element.name: birthDate
element.description: The date on which the person was born
element.definition: The birth date for the person.
element.comment: At least an estimated year should be provided as a guess if the real DOB is unknown.

element.name: address
element.description: One or more addresses for the person
element.definition: One or more addresses for the person.
element.comment: Person may have multiple addresses with different uses or applicable periods.

element.name: photo
element.definition: An image that can be displayed as a thumbnail of the person to enhance the identification of the individual.

element.name: managingOrganization
element.description: The organization that is the custodian of the person record
element.definition: The organization that is the custodian of the person record.

element.name: active
element.description: This person's record is in active use
element.definition: Whether this person's record is in active use.

element.name: link
element.description: Link to a resource that concerns the same actual person
element.definition: Link to a resource that concerns the same actual person.

element.name: target
element.description: The resource to which this actual person is associated
element.definition: The resource to which this actual person is associated.

element.name: assurance
element.definition: Level of assurance that this link is associated with the target resource.

binding.name: IdentityAssuranceLevel
binding.description: The level of confidence that this link represents the same actual person, based on NIST Authentication Levels.

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this plan definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this plan definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this plan definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the plan definition is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Additional identifier for the plan definition
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this plan definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this plan definition outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the plan definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the plan definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the plan definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.
element.comment: There may be different plan definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the plan definition with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this plan definition (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the plan definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

element.name: title
element.description: Name for this plan definition (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the plan definition.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

element.name: subtitle
element.description: Subordinate title of the plan definition
element.definition: An explanatory or alternate title for the plan definition giving additional information about its content.

element.name: type
element.definition: A high-level category for the plan definition that distinguishes the kinds of systems that would be interested in the plan definition.

binding.name: PlanDefinitionType
binding.description: The type of PlanDefinition.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of this plan definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of plan definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: experimental
element.description: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this plan definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of plan definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

element.name: subject
element.description: Type of individual the plan definition is focused on
element.definition: A code or group definition that describes the intended subject of the plan definition.

binding.name: SubjectType
binding.description: The possible types of subjects for a plan definition (E.g. Patient, Practitioner, Organization, Location, etc.).

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the plan definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the plan definition changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the plan definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the plan definition.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the plan definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the plan definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the plan definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the plan definition
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the plan definition from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the plan definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the plan definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the plan definition is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the plan definition was created).

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate plan definition instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for plan definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the plan definition is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the plan definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: purpose
element.description: Why this plan definition is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this plan definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the plan definition. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this plan definition.

element.name: usage
element.description: Describes the clinical usage of the plan
element.definition: A detailed description of how the plan definition is used from a clinical perspective.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the plan definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the plan definition.

element.name: approvalDate
element.description: When the plan definition was approved by publisher
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.
element.comment: The 'date' element may be more recent than the approval date because of minor changes or editorial corrections.

element.name: lastReviewDate
element.description: When the plan definition was last reviewed
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.
element.comment: If specified, this date follows the original approval date.

element.name: effectivePeriod
element.description: When the plan definition is expected to be used
element.definition: The period during which the plan definition content was or is planned to be in active use.
element.comment: The effective period for a plan definition determines when the content is applicable for usage and is independent of publication and review dates. For example, a measure intended to be used for the year 2016 might be published in 2015.

element.name: topic
element.definition: Descriptive topics related to the content of the plan definition. Topics provide a high-level categorization of the definition that can be useful for filtering and searching.

binding.name: DefinitionTopic
binding.description: High-level categorization of the definition, used for searching, sorting, and filtering.

element.name: author
element.definition: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

element.name: editor
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

element.name: reviewer
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

element.name: endorser
element.definition: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

element.name: relatedArtifact
element.definition: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
element.comment: Each related artifact is either an attachment, or a reference to another resource, but not both.

element.name: library
element.description: Logic used by the plan definition
element.definition: A reference to a Library resource containing any formal logic used by the plan definition.

element.name: goal
element.description: What the plan is trying to accomplish
element.definition: Goals that describe what the activities within the plan are intended to achieve. For example, weight loss, restoring an activity of daily living, obtaining herd immunity via immunization, meeting a process improvement objective, etc.

element.name: action
element.definition: An action or group of actions to be taken as part of the plan.
element.comment: Note that there is overlap between many of the elements defined here and the ActivityDefinition resource. When an ActivityDefinition is referenced (using the definition element), the overlapping elements in the plan override the content of the referenced ActivityDefinition unless otherwise documented in the specific elements. See the PlanDefinition resource for more detailed information.

element.name: prefix
element.description: User-visible prefix for the action (e.g. 1. or A.)
element.definition: A user-visible prefix for the action.

element.name: title
element.definition: The title of the action displayed to a user.

element.name: description
element.definition: A brief description of the action used to provide a summary to display to the user.

element.name: textEquivalent
element.description: Static text equivalent of the action, used if the dynamic aspects cannot be interpreted by the receiving system
element.definition: A text equivalent of the action to be performed. This provides a human-interpretable description of the action when the definition is consumed by a system that might not be capable of interpreting it dynamically.

element.name: priority
element.definition: Indicates how quickly the action should be addressed with respect to other actions.

binding.name: RequestPriority
binding.description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

element.name: code
element.description: Code representing the meaning of the action or sub-actions
element.definition: A code that provides meaning for the action or action group. For example, a section may have a LOINC code for the section of a documentation template.

element.name: reason
element.description: Why the action should be performed
element.definition: A description of why this action is necessary or appropriate.
element.comment: This is different than the clinical evidence documentation, it's an actual business description of the reason for performing the action.

element.name: documentation
element.description: Supporting documentation for the intended performer of the action
element.definition: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the action that can be provided to the CDS recipient. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

element.name: goalId
element.definition: Identifies goals that this action supports. The reference must be to a goal element defined within this plan definition.

element.name: subject
element.description: Type of individual the action is focused on
element.definition: A code or group definition that describes the intended subject of the action and its children, if any.
element.comment:
The subject of an action overrides the subject at a parent action or on the root of the PlanDefinition if specified.
In addition, because the subject needs to be resolved during realization, use of subjects in actions (or in the ActivityDefinition referenced by the action) resolves based on the set of subjects supplied in context and by type (i.e. the patient subject would resolve to a resource of type Patient).

binding.name: SubjectType
binding.description: The possible types of subjects for a plan definition (E.g. Patient, Practitioner, Organization, Location, etc.).

element.name: trigger
element.description: When the action should be triggered
element.definition: A description of when the action should be triggered.

element.name: condition
element.description: Whether or not the action is applicable
element.definition: An expression that describes applicability criteria or start/stop conditions for the action.
element.comment: When multiple conditions of the same kind are present, the effects are combined using AND semantics, so the overall condition is true only if all the conditions are true.

element.name: input
element.definition: Defines input data requirements for the action.

element.name: output
element.definition: Defines the outputs of the action, if any.

element.name: relatedAction
element.definition: A relationship to another action such as "before" or "30-60 minutes after start of".
element.comment: When an action depends on multiple actions, the meaning is that all actions are dependencies, rather than that any of the actions are a dependency.

element.name: timing
element.description: When the action should take place
element.definition: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

element.name: participant
element.description: Who should participate in the action
element.definition: Indicates who should participate in performing the action described.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of action to perform (create, update, remove).

binding.name: ActionType
binding.description: The type of action to be performed.

element.name: groupingBehavior
element.definition: Defines the grouping behavior for the action and its children.

binding.name: ActionGroupingBehavior
binding.description: Defines organization behavior of a group.

element.name: selectionBehavior
element.description: any | all | all-or-none | exactly-one | at-most-one | one-or-more
element.definition: Defines the selection behavior for the action and its children.

binding.name: ActionSelectionBehavior
binding.description: Defines selection behavior of a group.

element.name: requiredBehavior
element.definition: Defines the required behavior for the action.

binding.name: ActionRequiredBehavior
binding.description: Defines expectations around whether an action or action group is required.

element.name: precheckBehavior
element.definition: Defines whether the action should usually be preselected.

binding.name: ActionPrecheckBehavior
binding.description: Defines selection frequency behavior for an action or group.

element.name: cardinalityBehavior
element.definition: Defines whether the action can be selected multiple times.

binding.name: ActionCardinalityBehavior
binding.description: Defines behavior for an action or a group for how many times that item may be repeated.

element.name: definition
element.description: Description of the activity to be performed
element.definition: A reference to an ActivityDefinition that describes the action to be taken in detail, or a PlanDefinition that describes a series of actions to be taken.
element.comment: Note that the definition is optional, and if no definition is specified, a dynamicValue with a root ($this) path can be used to define the entire resource dynamically.

element.name: transform
element.definition: A reference to a StructureMap resource that defines a transform that can be executed to produce the intent resource using the ActivityDefinition instance as the input.
element.comment: Note that when a referenced ActivityDefinition also defines a transform, the transform specified here generally takes precedence. In addition, if both a transform and dynamic values are specific, the dynamic values are applied to the result of the transform.

element.name: dynamicValue
element.definition: Customizations that should be applied to the statically defined resource. For example, if the dosage of a medication must be computed based on the patient's weight, a customization would be used to specify an expression that calculated the weight, and the path on the resource that would contain the result.
element.comment: Dynamic values are applied in the order in which they are defined in the PlanDefinition resource. Note that when dynamic values are also specified by a referenced ActivityDefinition, the dynamicValues from the ActivityDefinition are applied first, followed by the dynamicValues specified here. In addition, if both a transform and dynamic values are specific, the dynamic values are applied to the result of the transform.

element.name: action
element.definition: Sub actions that are contained within the action. The behavior of this action determines the functionality of the sub-actions. For example, a selection behavior of at-most-one indicates that of the sub-actions, at most one may be chosen as part of realizing the action definition.

element.name: kind
element.definition: The kind of condition.
element.comment: Applicability criteria are used to determine immediate applicability when a plan definition is applied to a given context. Start and stop criteria are carried through application and used to describe enter/exit criteria for an action.

binding.name: ActionConditionKind
binding.description: Defines the kinds of conditions that can appear on actions.

element.name: expression
element.definition: An expression that returns true or false, indicating whether the condition is satisfied.
element.comment: The expression may be inlined or may be a reference to a named expression within a logic library referenced by the library element.

element.name: path
element.description: The path to the element to be set dynamically
element.definition: The path to the element to be customized. This is the path on the resource that will hold the result of the calculation defined by the expression. The specified path SHALL be a FHIRPath resolveable on the specified target type of the ActivityDefinition, and SHALL consist only of identifiers, constant indexers, and a restricted subset of functions. The path is allowed to contain qualifiers (.) to traverse sub-elements, as well as indexers ([x]) to traverse multiple-cardinality sub-elements (see the [Simple FHIRPath Profile](fhirpath.html#simple) for full details).
element.comment: To specify the path to the current action being realized, the %action environment variable is available in this path. For example, to specify the description element of the target action, the path would be %action.description. The path attribute contains a [Simple FHIRPath Subset](fhirpath.html#simple) that allows path traversal, but not calculation.

element.name: expression
element.description: An expression that provides the dynamic value for the customization
element.definition: An expression specifying the value of the customized element.
element.comment: The expression may be inlined or may be a reference to a named expression within a logic library referenced by the library element.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of participant in the action.

binding.name: ActionParticipantType
binding.description: The type of participant for the action.

element.name: role
element.definition: The role the participant should play in performing the described action.

binding.name: ActionParticipantRole
binding.description: Defines roles played by participants for the action.

element.name: actionId
element.description: What action is this related to
element.definition: The element id of the related action.

element.name: relationship
element.description: before-start | before | before-end | concurrent-with-start | concurrent | concurrent-with-end | after-start | after | after-end
element.definition: The relationship of this action to the related action.

binding.name: ActionRelationshipType
binding.description: Defines the types of relationships between actions.

element.name: offset
element.definition: A duration or range of durations to apply to the relationship. For example, 30-60 minutes before.

element.name: category
element.definition: Indicates a category the goal falls within.

binding.name: GoalCategory
binding.description: Example codes for grouping goals for filtering or presentation.

element.name: description
element.description: Code or text describing the goal
element.definition: Human-readable and/or coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".
element.comment: If no code is available, use CodeableConcept.text.

binding.name: GoalDescription
binding.description: Describes goals that can be achieved.

element.name: priority
element.definition: Identifies the expected level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the defined goal.

binding.name: GoalPriority
binding.description: Indicates the level of importance associated with reaching or sustaining a goal.

element.name: start
element.definition: The event after which the goal should begin being pursued.

binding.name: GoalStartEvent
binding.description: Identifies the types of events that might trigger the start of a goal.

element.name: addresses
element.definition: Identifies problems, conditions, issues, or concerns the goal is intended to address.

binding.name: GoalAddresses
binding.description: Identifies problems, conditions, issues, or concerns that goals may address.

element.name: documentation
element.definition: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the goal that provide further supporting information about the goal. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

element.name: target
element.definition: Indicates what should be done and within what timeframe.

element.name: measure
element.description: The parameter whose value is to be tracked
element.definition: The parameter whose value is to be tracked, e.g. body weight, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

binding.name: GoalTargetMeasure
binding.description: Identifies types of parameters that can be tracked to determine goal achievement.

element.name: detail
element.description: The target value to be achieved
element.definition: The target value of the measure to be achieved to signify fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds or 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or above the low value.

element.name: due
element.definition: Indicates the timeframe after the start of the goal in which the goal should be met.

element.name: age
element.description: The age of the specific population
element.definition: The age of the specific population.

element.name: gender
element.description: The gender of the specific population
element.definition: The gender of the specific population.

element.name: race
element.definition: Race of the specific population.

element.name: physiologicalCondition
element.description: The existing physiological conditions of the specific population to which this applies
element.definition: The existing physiological conditions of the specific population to which this applies.

element.name: identifier
element.description: An identifier for the person as this agent
element.definition: An identifier that applies to this person in this role.

element.name: active
element.description: Whether this practitioner's record is in active use
element.definition: Whether this practitioner's record is in active use.
element.comment: If the practitioner is not in use by one organization, then it should mark the period on the PractitonerRole with an end date (even if they are active) as they may be active in another role.

element.name: name
element.description: The name(s) associated with the practitioner
element.definition: The name(s) associated with the practitioner.
element.comment: The selection of the use property should ensure that there is a single usual name specified, and others use the nickname (alias), old, or other values as appropriate. In general, select the value to be used in the ResourceReference.display based on this: 1. There is more than 1 name 2. Use = usual 3. Period is current to the date of the usage 4. Use = official 5. Other order as decided by internal business rules.

element.name: telecom
element.description: A contact detail for the practitioner (that apply to all roles)
element.definition: A contact detail for the practitioner, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.
element.comment: Person may have multiple ways to be contacted with different uses or applicable periods. May need to have options for contacting the person urgently and to help with identification. These typically will have home numbers, or mobile numbers that are not role specific.

element.name: address
element.description: Address(es) of the practitioner that are not role specific (typically home address)
element.definition: Address(es) of the practitioner that are not role specific (typically home address). Work addresses are not typically entered in this property as they are usually role dependent.
element.comment: The PractitionerRole does not have an address value on it, as it is expected that the location property be used for this purpose (which has an address).

element.name: gender
element.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

binding.name: AdministrativeGender
binding.description: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes.

element.name: birthDate
element.description: The date on which the practitioner was born
element.definition: The date of birth for the practitioner.

element.name: photo
element.definition: Image of the person.

element.name: qualification
element.description: Certification, licenses, or training pertaining to the provision of care
element.definition: The official certifications, training, and licenses that authorize or otherwise pertain to the provision of care by the practitioner. For example, a medical license issued by a medical board authorizing the practitioner to practice medicine within a certian locality.

element.name: communication
element.description: A language the practitioner can use in patient communication
element.definition: A language the practitioner can use in patient communication.
element.comment: The structure aa-BB with this exact casing is one the most widely used notations for locale. However not all systems code this but instead have it as free text. Hence CodeableConcept instead of code as the data type.

binding.name: Language
binding.description: A human language.

element.name: identifier
element.description: An identifier for this qualification for the practitioner
element.definition: An identifier that applies to this person's qualification in this role.

element.name: code
element.definition: Coded representation of the qualification.

binding.name: Qualification
binding.description: Specific qualification the practitioner has to provide a service.

element.name: period
element.description: Period during which the qualification is valid
element.definition: Period during which the qualification is valid.

element.name: issuer
element.description: Organization that regulates and issues the qualification
element.definition: Organization that regulates and issues the qualification.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business Identifiers that are specific to a role/location
element.definition: Business Identifiers that are specific to a role/location.

element.name: active
element.description: Whether this practitioner role record is in active use
element.definition: Whether this practitioner role record is in active use.
element.comment: If this value is false, you may refer to the period to see when the role was in active use. If there is no period specified, no inference can be made about when it was active.

element.name: period
element.description: The period during which the practitioner is authorized to perform in these role(s)
element.definition: The period during which the person is authorized to act as a practitioner in these role(s) for the organization.

element.name: practitioner
element.description: Practitioner that is able to provide the defined services for the organization
element.definition: Practitioner that is able to provide the defined services for the organization.

element.name: organization
element.description: Organization where the roles are available
element.definition: The organization where the Practitioner performs the roles associated.

element.name: code
element.description: Roles which this practitioner may perform
element.definition: Roles which this practitioner is authorized to perform for the organization.
element.comment: A person may have more than one role.

binding.name: PractitionerRole
binding.description: The role a person plays representing an organization.

element.name: specialty
element.definition: Specific specialty of the practitioner.

binding.name: PractitionerSpecialty
binding.description: Specific specialty associated with the agency.

element.name: location
element.description: The location(s) at which this practitioner provides care
element.definition: The location(s) at which this practitioner provides care.

element.name: healthcareService
element.description: The list of healthcare services that this worker provides for this role's Organization/Location(s)
element.definition: The list of healthcare services that this worker provides for this role's Organization/Location(s).

element.name: telecom
element.description: Contact details that are specific to the role/location/service
element.definition: Contact details that are specific to the role/location/service.

element.name: availableTime
element.description: Times the Service Site is available
element.definition: A collection of times the practitioner is available or performing this role at the location and/or healthcareservice.
element.comment: More detailed availability information may be provided in associated Schedule/Slot resources.

element.name: notAvailable
element.description: Not available during this time due to provided reason
element.definition: The practitioner is not available or performing this role during this period of time due to the provided reason.

element.name: availabilityExceptions
element.definition: A description of site availability exceptions, e.g. public holiday availability. Succinctly describing all possible exceptions to normal site availability as details in the available Times and not available Times.

element.name: endpoint
element.description: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the practitioner with this role
element.definition: Technical endpoints providing access to services operated for the practitioner with this role.

element.name: daysOfWeek
element.description: mon | tue | wed | thu | fri | sat | sun
element.definition: Indicates which days of the week are available between the start and end Times.

binding.name: DaysOfWeek
binding.description: The days of the week.

element.name: allDay
element.definition: Is this always available? (hence times are irrelevant) e.g. 24 hour service.

element.name: availableStartTime
element.description: Opening time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
element.definition: The opening time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.
element.comment: The timezone is expected to be for where this HealthcareService is provided at.

element.name: availableEndTime
element.description: Closing time of day (ignored if allDay = true)
element.definition: The closing time of day. Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.
element.comment: The timezone is expected to be for where this HealthcareService is provided at.

element.name: description
element.description: Reason presented to the user explaining why time not available
element.definition: The reason that can be presented to the user as to why this time is not available.

element.name: during
element.description: Service not available from this date
element.definition: Service is not available (seasonally or for a public holiday) from this date.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifiers assigned to this procedure by the performer or other systems which remain constant as the resource is updated and is propagated from server to server.
element.comment: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and Person resource instances might share the same social insurance number.

element.name: instantiatesCanonical
element.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, order set or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Procedure.

element.name: instantiatesUri
element.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, order set or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Procedure.
element.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: A reference to a resource that contains details of the request for this procedure.

element.name: partOf
element.definition: A larger event of which this particular procedure is a component or step.
element.comment: The MedicationAdministration resource has a partOf reference to Procedure, but this is not a circular reference. For example, the anesthesia MedicationAdministration is part of the surgical Procedure (MedicationAdministration.partOf = Procedure). For example, the procedure to insert the IV port for an IV medication administration is part of the medication administration (Procedure.partOf = MedicationAdministration).

element.name: status
element.description: preparation | in-progress | not-done | on-hold | stopped | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
element.definition: A code specifying the state of the procedure. Generally, this will be the in-progress or completed state.
element.comment:
The "unknown" code is not to be used to convey other statuses. The "unknown" code should be used when one of the statuses applies, but the authoring system doesn't know the current state of the procedure.
This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: ProcedureStatus
binding.description: A code specifying the state of the procedure.

element.name: statusReason
element.definition: Captures the reason for the current state of the procedure.
element.comment: This is generally only used for "exception" statuses such as "not-done", "suspended" or "aborted". The reason for performing the event at all is captured in reasonCode, not here.

binding.name: ProcedureNegationReason
binding.description: A code that identifies the reason a procedure was not performed.

element.name: category
element.definition: A code that classifies the procedure for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. "Surgical Procedure").

binding.name: ProcedureCategory
binding.description: A code that classifies a procedure for searching, sorting and display purposes.

element.name: code
element.definition: The specific procedure that is performed. Use text if the exact nature of the procedure cannot be coded (e.g. "Laparoscopic Appendectomy").

binding.name: ProcedureCode
binding.description: A code to identify a specific procedure .

element.name: subject
element.description: Who the procedure was performed on
element.definition: The person, animal or group on which the procedure was performed.

element.name: encounter
element.definition: The Encounter during which this Procedure was created or performed or to which the creation of this record is tightly associated.
element.comment: This will typically be the encounter the event occurred within, but some activities may be initiated prior to or after the official completion of an encounter but still be tied to the context of the encounter.

element.name: performed
element.definition: Estimated or actual date, date-time, period, or age when the procedure was performed. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured.
element.comment: Age is generally used when the patient reports an age at which the procedure was performed. Range is generally used when the patient reports an age range when the procedure was performed, such as sometime between 20-25 years old. dateTime supports a range of precision due to some procedures being reported as past procedures that might not have millisecond precision while other procedures performed and documented during the encounter might have more precise UTC timestamps with timezone.

element.name: recorder
element.definition: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

element.name: asserter
element.definition: Individual who is making the procedure statement.

element.name: performer
element.description: The people who performed the procedure
element.definition: Limited to "real" people rather than equipment.

element.name: location
element.definition: The location where the procedure actually happened. E.g. a newborn at home, a tracheostomy at a restaurant.

element.name: reasonCode
element.definition: The coded reason why the procedure was performed. This may be a coded entity of some type, or may simply be present as text.
element.comment: Use Procedure.reasonCode when a code sufficiently describes the reason. Use Procedure.reasonReference when referencing a resource, which allows more information to be conveyed, such as onset date. Procedure.reasonCode and Procedure.reasonReference are not meant to be duplicative. For a single reason, either Procedure.reasonCode or Procedure.reasonReference can be used. Procedure.reasonCode may be a summary code, or Procedure.reasonReference may be used to reference a very precise definition of the reason using Condition | Observation | Procedure | DiagnosticReport | DocumentReference. Both Procedure.reasonCode and Procedure.reasonReference can be used if they are describing different reasons for the procedure.

binding.name: ProcedureReason
binding.description: A code that identifies the reason a procedure is required.

element.name: reasonReference
element.description: The justification that the procedure was performed
element.definition: The justification of why the procedure was performed.
element.comment: It is possible for a procedure to be a reason (such as C-Section) for another procedure (such as an epidural). Other examples include endoscopy for dilatation and biopsy (a combination of diagnostic and therapeutic use). Use Procedure.reasonCode when a code sufficiently describes the reason. Use Procedure.reasonReference when referencing a resource, which allows more information to be conveyed, such as onset date. Procedure.reasonCode and Procedure.reasonReference are not meant to be duplicative. For a single reason, either Procedure.reasonCode or Procedure.reasonReference can be used. Procedure.reasonCode may be a summary code, or Procedure.reasonReference may be used to reference a very precise definition of the reason using Condition | Observation | Procedure | DiagnosticReport | DocumentReference. Both Procedure.reasonCode and Procedure.reasonReference can be used if they are describing different reasons for the procedure.

element.name: bodySite
element.definition: Detailed and structured anatomical location information. Multiple locations are allowed - e.g. multiple punch biopsies of a lesion.
element.comment: If the use case requires attributes from the BodySite resource (e.g. to identify and track separately) then use the standard extension [procedure-targetbodystructure](extension-procedure-targetbodystructure.html).

binding.name: BodySite
binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

element.name: outcome
element.definition: The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve the reasons for the procedure being performed?
element.comment: If outcome contains narrative text only, it can be captured using the CodeableConcept.text.

binding.name: ProcedureOutcome
binding.description: An outcome of a procedure - whether it was resolved or otherwise.

element.name: report
element.description: Any report resulting from the procedure
element.definition: This could be a histology result, pathology report, surgical report, etc.
element.comment: There could potentially be multiple reports - e.g. if this was a procedure which took multiple biopsies resulting in a number of anatomical pathology reports.

element.name: complication
element.definition: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the notes, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues.
element.comment: If complications are only expressed by the narrative text, they can be captured using the CodeableConcept.text.

binding.name: ProcedureComplication
binding.description: Codes describing complications that resulted from a procedure.

element.name: complicationDetail
element.description: A condition that is a result of the procedure
element.definition: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period.

element.name: followUp
element.definition: If the procedure required specific follow up - e.g. removal of sutures. The follow up may be represented as a simple note or could potentially be more complex, in which case the CarePlan resource can be used.

binding.name: ProcedureFollowUp
binding.description: Specific follow up required for a procedure e.g. removal of sutures.

element.name: note
element.definition: Any other notes and comments about the procedure.

element.name: focalDevice
element.definition: A device that is implanted, removed or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

element.name: usedReference
element.definition: Identifies medications, devices and any other substance used as part of the procedure.
element.comment: For devices actually implanted or removed, use Procedure.device.

element.name: usedCode
element.description: Coded items used during the procedure
element.definition: Identifies coded items that were used as part of the procedure.
element.comment: For devices actually implanted or removed, use Procedure.device.

binding.name: ProcedureUsed
binding.description: Codes describing items used during a procedure.

element.name: action
element.definition: The kind of change that happened to the device during the procedure.

binding.name: DeviceActionKind
binding.description: A kind of change that happened to the device during the procedure.

element.name: manipulated
element.definition: The device that was manipulated (changed) during the procedure.

element.name: function
element.definition: Distinguishes the type of involvement of the performer in the procedure. For example, surgeon, anaesthetist, endoscopist.

binding.name: ProcedurePerformerRole
binding.description: A code that identifies the role of a performer of the procedure.

element.name: actor
element.definition: The practitioner who was involved in the procedure.

element.name: onBehalfOf
element.description: Organization the device or practitioner was acting for
element.definition: The organization the device or practitioner was acting on behalf of.

element.name: height
element.description: Where applicable, the height can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the height can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.name: width
element.description: Where applicable, the width can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the width can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.name: depth
element.description: Where applicable, the depth can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the depth can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.name: weight
element.description: Where applicable, the weight can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the weight can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.name: nominalVolume
element.description: Where applicable, the nominal volume can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the nominal volume can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.name: externalDiameter
element.description: Where applicable, the external diameter can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the external diameter can be specified using a numerical value and its unit of measurement The unit of measurement shall be specified in accordance with ISO 11240 and the resulting terminology The symbol and the symbol identifier shall be used.

element.name: shape
element.description: Where applicable, the shape can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the shape can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used.

element.name: color
element.description: Where applicable, the color can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the color can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used.

element.name: imprint
element.description: Where applicable, the imprint can be specified as text
element.definition: Where applicable, the imprint can be specified as text.

element.name: image
element.description: Where applicable, the image can be provided The format of the image attachment shall be specified by regional implementations
element.definition: Where applicable, the image can be provided The format of the image attachment shall be specified by regional implementations.

element.name: scoring
element.description: Where applicable, the scoring can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used
element.definition: Where applicable, the scoring can be specified An appropriate controlled vocabulary shall be used The term and the term identifier shall be used.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Unique identifier for the packaged Medicinal Product
element.definition: Unique identifier for the packaged Medicinal Product.

element.name: type
