These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate research element definition instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for research element definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the research element definition is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the research element definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: purpose
element.description: Why this research element definition is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this research element definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the research element definition. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this research element definition.

element.name: usage
element.description: Describes the clinical usage of the ResearchElementDefinition
element.definition: A detailed description, from a clinical perspective, of how the ResearchElementDefinition is used.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the research element definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the research element definition.

element.name: approvalDate
element.description: When the research element definition was approved by publisher
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.
element.comment: The 'date' element may be more recent than the approval date because of minor changes or editorial corrections.

element.name: lastReviewDate
element.description: When the research element definition was last reviewed
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.
element.comment: If specified, this date follows the original approval date.

element.name: effectivePeriod
element.description: When the research element definition is expected to be used
element.definition: The period during which the research element definition content was or is planned to be in active use.
element.comment: The effective period for a research element definition determines when the content is applicable for usage and is independent of publication and review dates. For example, a measure intended to be used for the year 2016 might be published in 2015.

element.name: topic
element.description: The category of the ResearchElementDefinition, such as Education, Treatment, Assessment, etc.
element.definition: Descriptive topics related to the content of the ResearchElementDefinition. Topics provide a high-level categorization grouping types of ResearchElementDefinitions that can be useful for filtering and searching.

binding.name: DefinitionTopic
binding.description: High-level categorization of the definition, used for searching, sorting, and filtering.

element.name: author
element.definition: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

element.name: editor
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

element.name: reviewer
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

element.name: endorser
element.definition: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

element.name: relatedArtifact
element.definition: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
element.comment: Each related artifact is either an attachment, or a reference to another resource, but not both.

element.name: library
element.definition: A reference to a Library resource containing the formal logic used by the ResearchElementDefinition.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of research element, a population, an exposure, or an outcome.

binding.name: ResearchElementType
binding.description: The possible types of research elements (E.g. Population, Exposure, Outcome).

element.name: variableType
element.definition: The type of the outcome (e.g. Dichotomous, Continuous, or Descriptive).

binding.name: VariableType
binding.description: The possible types of variables for exposures or outcomes (E.g. Dichotomous, Continuous, Descriptive).

element.name: characteristic
element.description: What defines the members of the research element
element.definition: A characteristic that defines the members of the research element. Multiple characteristics are applied with "and" semantics.
element.comment: Characteristics can be defined flexibly to accommodate different use cases for membership criteria, ranging from simple codes, all the way to using an expression language to express the criteria.

element.name: definition
element.description: What code or expression defines members?
element.definition: Define members of the research element using Codes (such as condition, medication, or observation), Expressions ( using an expression language such as FHIRPath or CQL) or DataRequirements (such as Diabetes diagnosis onset in the last year).

element.name: usageContext
element.definition: Use UsageContext to define the members of the population, such as Age Ranges, Genders, Settings.

element.name: exclude
element.description: Whether the characteristic includes or excludes members
element.definition: When true, members with this characteristic are excluded from the element.

element.name: unitOfMeasure
element.description: What unit is the outcome described in?
element.definition: Specifies the UCUM unit for the outcome.

binding.name: UCUMUnits
binding.description: Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM).

element.name: studyEffectiveDescription
element.description: What time period does the study cover
element.definition: A narrative description of the time period the study covers.

element.name: studyEffective
element.description: What time period does the study cover
element.definition: Indicates what effective period the study covers.

element.name: studyEffectiveTimeFromStart
element.definition: Indicates duration from the study initiation.

element.name: studyEffectiveGroupMeasure
element.description: mean | median | mean-of-mean | mean-of-median | median-of-mean | median-of-median
element.definition: Indicates how elements are aggregated within the study effective period.

binding.name: GroupMeasure
binding.description: Possible group measure aggregates (E.g. Mean, Median).

element.name: participantEffectiveDescription
element.description: What time period do participants cover
element.definition: A narrative description of the time period the study covers.

element.name: participantEffective
element.description: What time period do participants cover
element.definition: Indicates what effective period the study covers.

element.name: participantEffectiveTimeFromStart
element.definition: Indicates duration from the participant's study entry.

element.name: participantEffectiveGroupMeasure
element.description: mean | median | mean-of-mean | mean-of-median | median-of-mean | median-of-median
element.definition: Indicates how elements are aggregated within the study effective period.

binding.name: GroupMeasure
binding.description: Possible group measure aggregates (E.g. Mean, Median).

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Identifiers assigned to this research study by the sponsor or other systems.

element.name: title
element.definition: A short, descriptive user-friendly label for the study.

element.name: protocol
element.definition: The set of steps expected to be performed as part of the execution of the study.

element.name: partOf
element.definition: A larger research study of which this particular study is a component or step.

element.name: status
element.description: active | administratively-completed | approved | closed-to-accrual | closed-to-accrual-and-intervention | completed | disapproved | in-review | temporarily-closed-to-accrual | temporarily-closed-to-accrual-and-intervention | withdrawn
element.definition: The current state of the study.

binding.name: ResearchStudyStatus
binding.description: Codes that convey the current status of the research study.

element.name: primaryPurposeType
element.description: treatment | prevention | diagnostic | supportive-care | screening | health-services-research | basic-science | device-feasibility
element.definition: The type of study based upon the intent of the study's activities. A classification of the intent of the study.

binding.name: ResearchStudyPrimaryPurposeType
binding.description: Codes for the main intent of the study.

element.name: phase
element.description: n-a | early-phase-1 | phase-1 | phase-1-phase-2 | phase-2 | phase-2-phase-3 | phase-3 | phase-4
element.definition: The stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.

binding.name: ResearchStudyPhase
binding.description: Codes for the stage in the progression of a therapy from initial experimental use in humans in clinical trials to post-market evaluation.

element.name: category
element.definition: Codes categorizing the type of study such as investigational vs. observational, type of blinding, type of randomization, safety vs. efficacy, etc.

binding.name: ResearchStudyCategory
binding.description: Codes that describe the type of research study. E.g. Study phase, Interventional/Observational, blinding type, etc.

element.name: focus
element.definition: The medication(s), food(s), therapy(ies), device(s) or other concerns or interventions that the study is seeking to gain more information about.

binding.name: ResearchStudyFocus
binding.description: Codes for medications, devices and other interventions.

element.name: condition
element.definition: The condition that is the focus of the study. For example, In a study to examine risk factors for Lupus, might have as an inclusion criterion "healthy volunteer", but the target condition code would be a Lupus SNOMED code.

binding.name: ConditionCode
binding.description: Identification of the condition or diagnosis.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in learning more about or engaging with the study.

element.name: relatedArtifact
element.definition: Citations, references and other related documents.

element.name: keyword
element.description: Used to search for the study
element.definition: Key terms to aid in searching for or filtering the study.

binding.name: ResearchStudyKeyword
binding.description: Words associated with the study that may be useful in discovery.

element.name: location
element.definition: Indicates a country, state or other region where the study is taking place.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: description
element.definition: A full description of how the study is being conducted.

element.name: enrollment
element.definition: Reference to a Group that defines the criteria for and quantity of subjects participating in the study. E.g. " 200 female Europeans between the ages of 20 and 45 with early onset diabetes".
element.comment: The Group referenced should not generally enumerate specific subjects. Subjects will be linked to the study using the ResearchSubject resource.

element.name: period
element.description: When the study began and ended
element.definition: Identifies the start date and the expected (or actual, depending on status) end date for the study.

element.name: sponsor
element.description: Organization that initiates and is legally responsible for the study
element.definition: An organization that initiates the investigation and is legally responsible for the study.

element.name: principalInvestigator
element.description: Researcher who oversees multiple aspects of the study
element.definition: A researcher in a study who oversees multiple aspects of the study, such as concept development, protocol writing, protocol submission for IRB approval, participant recruitment, informed consent, data collection, analysis, interpretation and presentation.

element.name: site
element.description: Facility where study activities are conducted
element.definition: A facility in which study activities are conducted.

element.name: reasonStopped
element.definition: A description and/or code explaining the premature termination of the study.

binding.name: ResearchStudyReasonStopped
binding.description: Codes for why the study ended prematurely.

element.name: note
element.definition: Comments made about the study by the performer, subject or other participants.

element.name: arm
element.description: Defined path through the study for a subject
element.definition: Describes an expected sequence of events for one of the participants of a study. E.g. Exposure to drug A, wash-out, exposure to drug B, wash-out, follow-up.

element.name: objective
element.definition: A goal that the study is aiming to achieve in terms of a scientific question to be answered by the analysis of data collected during the study.

element.name: name
element.definition: Unique, human-readable label for this arm of the study.

element.name: type
element.definition: Categorization of study arm, e.g. experimental, active comparator, placebo comparater.

element.name: description
element.definition: A succinct description of the path through the study that would be followed by a subject adhering to this arm.

element.name: name
element.definition: Unique, human-readable label for this objective of the study.

element.name: type
element.definition: The kind of study objective.

binding.name: ResearchStudyObjectiveType
binding.description: Codes for the kind of study objective.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business Identifier for research subject in a study
element.definition: Identifiers assigned to this research subject for a study.

element.name: status
element.description: candidate | eligible | follow-up | ineligible | not-registered | off-study | on-study | on-study-intervention | on-study-observation | pending-on-study | potential-candidate | screening | withdrawn
element.definition: The current state of the subject.

binding.name: ResearchSubjectStatus
binding.description: Indicates the progression of a study subject through a study.

element.name: period
element.definition: The dates the subject began and ended their participation in the study.

element.name: study
element.definition: Reference to the study the subject is participating in.

element.name: individual
element.definition: The record of the person or animal who is involved in the study.

element.name: assignedArm
element.definition: The name of the arm in the study the subject is expected to follow as part of this study.

element.name: actualArm
element.definition: The name of the arm in the study the subject actually followed as part of this study.

element.name: consent
element.definition: A record of the patient's informed agreement to participate in the study.

element.name: id
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

element.name: meta
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.name: implicitRules
element.description: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

element.name: language
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

binding.name: Language
binding.description: A human language.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Business identifier assigned to the risk assessment.

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: A reference to the request that is fulfilled by this risk assessment.

element.name: parent
element.definition: A reference to a resource that this risk assessment is part of, such as a Procedure.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the RiskAssessment, using the same statuses as an Observation.

binding.name: RiskAssessmentStatus
binding.description: The status of the risk assessment; e.g. preliminary, final, amended, etc.

element.name: method
element.definition: The algorithm, process or mechanism used to evaluate the risk.

binding.name: RiskAssessmentMethod
binding.description: The mechanism or algorithm used to make the assessment; e.g. TIMI, PRISM, Cardiff Type 2 diabetes, etc.

element.name: code
element.definition: The type of the risk assessment performed.

element.name: subject
element.definition: The patient or group the risk assessment applies to.

element.name: encounter
element.definition: The encounter where the assessment was performed.

element.name: occurrence
element.definition: The date (and possibly time) the risk assessment was performed.

element.name: condition
element.definition: For assessments or prognosis specific to a particular condition, indicates the condition being assessed.

element.name: performer
element.definition: The provider or software application that performed the assessment.

element.name: reasonCode
element.definition: The reason the risk assessment was performed.

element.name: reasonReference
element.definition: Resources supporting the reason the risk assessment was performed.

element.name: basis
element.definition: Indicates the source data considered as part of the assessment (for example, FamilyHistory, Observations, Procedures, Conditions, etc.).

element.name: prediction
element.definition: Describes the expected outcome for the subject.
element.comment: Multiple repetitions can be used to identify the same type of outcome in different timeframes as well as different types of outcomes.

constraint.name: ras-2
constraint.message: Must be <= 100

expression.expression: probability is decimal implies (probability as decimal) <= 100

element.name: mitigation
element.definition: A description of the steps that might be taken to reduce the identified risk(s).

element.name: note
element.definition: Additional comments about the risk assessment.

element.name: outcome
element.definition: One of the potential outcomes for the patient (e.g. remission, death, a particular condition).

binding.name: RiskAssessmentOutcome
binding.description: The condition or other outcome; e.g. death, remission, amputation, infection, etc.

element.name: probability
element.definition: Indicates how likely the outcome is (in the specified timeframe).
element.comment: If range is used, it represents the lower and upper bounds of certainty; e.g. 40-60% Decimal values are expressed as percentages as well (max = 100).

constraint.name: ras-1
constraint.message: low and high must be percentages, if present

element.name: qualitativeRisk
element.description: Likelihood of specified outcome as a qualitative value
element.definition: Indicates how likely the outcome is (in the specified timeframe), expressed as a qualitative value (e.g. low, medium, or high).

binding.name: RiskAssessmentProbability
binding.description: The likelihood of the occurrence of a specified outcome.

element.name: relativeRisk
element.definition: Indicates the risk for this particular subject (with their specific characteristics) divided by the risk of the population in general. (Numbers greater than 1 = higher risk than the population, numbers less than 1 = lower risk.).

element.name: when
element.definition: Indicates the period of time or age range of the subject to which the specified probability applies.
element.comment: If not specified, the risk applies "over the subject's lifespan".

element.name: rationale
element.definition: Additional information explaining the basis for the prediction.

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this risk evidence synthesis, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this risk evidence synthesis when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this risk evidence synthesis is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the risk evidence synthesis is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Additional identifier for the risk evidence synthesis
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this risk evidence synthesis when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this risk evidence synthesis outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the risk evidence synthesis
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the risk evidence synthesis when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the risk evidence synthesis author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
element.comment: There may be different risk evidence synthesis instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the risk evidence synthesis with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this risk evidence synthesis (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the risk evidence synthesis. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

element.name: title
element.description: Name for this risk evidence synthesis (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the risk evidence synthesis.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of this risk evidence synthesis. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of risk evidence synthesiss that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the risk evidence synthesis was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the risk evidence synthesis changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the risk evidence synthesis. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the risk evidence synthesis.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the risk evidence synthesis is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the risk evidence synthesis. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the risk evidence synthesis. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the risk evidence synthesis
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the risk evidence synthesis from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the risk evidence synthesis was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the risk evidence synthesis as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the risk evidence synthesis is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the risk evidence synthesis was created).

element.name: note
element.description: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the resource.

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate risk evidence synthesis instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for risk evidence synthesis (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the risk evidence synthesis is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the risk evidence synthesis to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the risk evidence synthesis and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the risk evidence synthesis.

element.name: approvalDate
element.description: When the risk evidence synthesis was approved by publisher
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.
element.comment: The 'date' element may be more recent than the approval date because of minor changes or editorial corrections.

element.name: lastReviewDate
element.description: When the risk evidence synthesis was last reviewed
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.
element.comment: If specified, this date follows the original approval date.

element.name: effectivePeriod
element.description: When the risk evidence synthesis is expected to be used
element.definition: The period during which the risk evidence synthesis content was or is planned to be in active use.
element.comment: The effective period for a risk evidence synthesis determines when the content is applicable for usage and is independent of publication and review dates. For example, a measure intended to be used for the year 2016 might be published in 2015.

element.name: topic
element.description: The category of the EffectEvidenceSynthesis, such as Education, Treatment, Assessment, etc.
element.definition: Descriptive topics related to the content of the RiskEvidenceSynthesis. Topics provide a high-level categorization grouping types of EffectEvidenceSynthesiss that can be useful for filtering and searching.

binding.name: DefinitionTopic
binding.description: High-level categorization of the definition, used for searching, sorting, and filtering.

element.name: author
element.definition: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

element.name: editor
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

element.name: reviewer
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

element.name: endorser
element.definition: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

element.name: relatedArtifact
element.definition: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
element.comment: Each related artifact is either an attachment, or a reference to another resource, but not both.

element.name: synthesisType
element.definition: Type of synthesis eg meta-analysis.

binding.name: SynthesisType
binding.description: Types of combining results from a body of evidence (eg. summary data meta-analysis).

element.name: studyType
element.definition: Type of study eg randomized trial.

binding.name: StudyType
binding.description: Types of research studies (types of research methods).

element.name: population
element.definition: A reference to a EvidenceVariable resource that defines the population for the research.

element.name: exposure
element.definition: A reference to a EvidenceVariable resource that defines the exposure for the research.

element.name: outcome
element.definition: A reference to a EvidenceVariable resomece that defines the outcome for the research.

element.name: sampleSize
element.definition: A description of the size of the sample involved in the synthesis.

element.name: riskEstimate
element.definition: The estimated risk of the outcome.

element.name: certainty
element.definition: A description of the certainty of the risk estimate.

element.name: rating
element.definition: A rating of the certainty of the effect estimate.

binding.name: QualityOfEvidenceRating
binding.description: The quality of the evidence described. The code system used specifies the quality scale used to grade this evidence source while the code specifies the actual quality score (represented as a coded value) associated with the evidence.

element.name: note
element.description: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the resource.

element.name: certaintySubcomponent
element.description: A component that contributes to the overall certainty
element.definition: A description of a component of the overall certainty.

element.name: type
element.description: Type of subcomponent of certainty rating
element.definition: Type of subcomponent of certainty rating.

binding.name: CertaintySubcomponentType
binding.description: The subcomponent classification of quality of evidence rating systems.

element.name: rating
element.definition: A rating of a subcomponent of rating certainty.

binding.name: CertaintySubcomponentRating
binding.description: The quality rating of the subcomponent of a quality of evidence rating.

element.name: note
element.description: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the resource.

element.name: description
element.definition: Human-readable summary of risk estimate.

element.name: type
element.definition: Examples include proportion and mean.

binding.name: RiskEstimateType
binding.description: Whether the risk estimate is dichotomous, continuous or qualitative and the specific type of risk estimate (eg proportion or median).

element.name: value
element.definition: The point estimate of the risk estimate.

element.name: unitOfMeasure
element.description: What unit is the outcome described in?
element.definition: Specifies the UCUM unit for the outcome.

binding.name: UCUMUnits
binding.description: Unified Code for Units of Measure (UCUM).

element.name: denominatorCount
element.definition: The sample size for the group that was measured for this risk estimate.

element.name: numeratorCount
element.definition: The number of group members with the outcome of interest.

element.name: precisionEstimate
element.definition: A description of the precision of the estimate for the effect.

element.name: type
element.definition: Examples include confidence interval and interquartile range.

binding.name: PrecisionEstimateType
binding.description: Method of reporting variability of estimates, such as confidence intervals, interquartile range or standard deviation.

element.name: level
element.definition: Use 95 for a 95% confidence interval.

element.name: from
element.definition: Lower bound of confidence interval.

element.name: to
element.definition: Upper bound of confidence interval.

element.name: description
element.definition: Human-readable summary of sample size.

element.name: numberOfStudies
element.definition: Number of studies included in this evidence synthesis.

element.name: numberOfParticipants
element.definition: Number of participants included in this evidence synthesis.

element.name: origin
element.definition: The base quantity that a measured value of zero represents. In addition, this provides the units of the entire measurement series.

element.name: period
element.definition: The length of time between sampling times, measured in milliseconds.
element.comment: This is usually a whole number.

element.name: factor
element.description: Multiply data by this before adding to origin
element.definition: A correction factor that is applied to the sampled data points before they are added to the origin.

element.name: lowerLimit
element.definition: The lower limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value "L" (lower than detection limit).

element.name: upperLimit
element.definition: The upper limit of detection of the measured points. This is needed if any of the data points have the value "U" (higher than detection limit).

element.name: dimensions
element.description: Number of sample points at each time point
element.definition: The number of sample points at each time point. If this value is greater than one, then the dimensions will be interlaced - all the sample points for a point in time will be recorded at once.
element.comment: If there is more than one dimension, the code for the type of data will define the meaning of the dimensions (typically ECG data).

element.name: data
element.definition: A series of data points which are decimal values separated by a single space (character u20). The special values "E" (error), "L" (below detection limit) and "U" (above detection limit) can also be used in place of a decimal value.
element.comment: Data may be missing if it is omitted for summarization purposes. In general, data is required for any actual use of a SampledData.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: External Ids for this item.

element.name: active
element.description: Whether this schedule is in active use
element.definition: Whether this schedule record is in active use or should not be used (such as was entered in error).
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because it may be used to mark that the resource was created in error.

element.name: serviceCategory
element.definition: A broad categorization of the service that is to be performed during this appointment.

element.name: serviceType
element.definition: The specific service that is to be performed during this appointment.

element.name: specialty
element.definition: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

binding.name: specialty
binding.description: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty).

element.name: actor
element.description: Resource(s) that availability information is being provided for
element.definition: Slots that reference this schedule resource provide the availability details to these referenced resource(s).
element.comment: The capacity to support multiple referenced resource types should be used in cases where the specific resources themselves cannot be scheduled without the other, and thus only make sense to the system exposing them as a group. Common examples of this are where the combination of a practitioner and a room (Location) are always required by a system.

element.name: planningHorizon
element.description: Period of time covered by schedule
element.definition: The period of time that the slots that reference this Schedule resource cover (even if none exist). These cover the amount of time that an organization's planning horizon; the interval for which they are currently accepting appointments. This does not define a "template" for planning outside these dates.

element.name: comment
element.definition: Comments on the availability to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slots that may be associated.

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this search parameter, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this search parameter when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this search parameter is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the search parameter is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the search parameter
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the search parameter when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the search parameter author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
element.comment: There may be different search parameter instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the search parameter with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this search parameter (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the search parameter. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

element.name: derivedFrom
element.description: Original definition for the search parameter
element.definition: Where this search parameter is originally defined. If a derivedFrom is provided, then the details in the search parameter must be consistent with the definition from which it is defined. i.e. the parameter should have the same meaning, and (usually) the functionality should be a proper subset of the underlying search parameter.
element.comment: The intent of this is that a server can designate that it provides support for a search parameter defined in the specification itself (e.g. [`value-quantity`](http://hl7.org/fhir/SearchParameter/Observation-value-quantity), but detail how it is supported by the server.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of this search parameter. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of search parameters that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: experimental
element.description: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this search parameter is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of search parameters that are appropriate for use versus not.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the search parameter was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the search parameter changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the search parameter. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the search parameter.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the search parameter is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the search parameter. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the search parameter. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the search parameter
element.definition: And how it used.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the search parameter was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the search parameter as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the search parameter is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the search parameter was created).

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate search parameter instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for search parameter (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the search parameter is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the search parameter to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: purpose
element.description: Why this search parameter is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this search parameter is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the search parameter. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this search parameter.

element.name: code
element.definition: The code used in the URL or the parameter name in a parameters resource for this search parameter.
element.comment: For maximum compatibility, use only lowercase ASCII characters.

element.name: base
element.description: The resource type(s) this search parameter applies to
element.definition: The base resource type(s) that this search parameter can be used against.
element.comment: A search parameter must always apply to at least one resource type. When search parameters apply to more than one resource type, they can be used against any of the listed resource types, or in a cross-type search (see [Cross Resource Search](http.html#xres-search)).

binding.name: ResourceType
binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

element.name: type
element.description: number | date | string | token | reference | composite | quantity | uri | special
element.definition: The type of value that a search parameter may contain, and how the content is interpreted.

binding.name: SearchParamType
binding.description: Data types allowed to be used for search parameters.

element.name: expression
element.description: FHIRPath expression that extracts the values
element.definition: A FHIRPath expression that returns a set of elements for the search parameter.
element.comment: Note that the elements returned by the expression are sometimes complex elements where logic is required to determine quite how to handle them; e.g. CodeableConcepts may contain text and/or multiple codings, where the codings themselves contain a code and a system. For composite search parameters, the outcome of the expression must a collection of base elements from which the composites are derived.

element.name: xpath
element.definition: An XPath expression that returns a set of elements for the search parameter.
element.comment: Note that the elements returned by the XPath are sometimes complex elements where logic is required to determine quite how to handle them; e.g. CodeableConcepts may contain text and/or multiple codings, where the codings themselves contain a code and a system.

element.name: xpathUsage
element.definition: How the search parameter relates to the set of elements returned by evaluating the xpath query.

binding.name: XPathUsageType
binding.description: How a search parameter relates to the set of elements returned by evaluating its xpath query.

element.name: target
element.description: Types of resource (if a resource reference)
element.definition: Types of resource (if a resource is referenced).

binding.name: ResourceType
binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

element.name: multipleOr
element.definition: Whether multiple values are allowed for each time the parameter exists. Values are separated by commas, and the parameter matches if any of the values match.

element.name: multipleAnd
element.definition: Whether multiple parameters are allowed - e.g. more than one parameter with the same name. The search matches if all the parameters match.

element.name: comparator
element.description: eq | ne | gt | lt | ge | le | sa | eb | ap
element.definition: Comparators supported for the search parameter.
element.comment: If no comparators are listed, clients should not expect servers to support any comparators.

binding.name: SearchComparator
binding.description: What Search Comparator Codes are supported in search.

element.name: modifier
element.description: missing | exact | contains | not | text | in | not-in | below | above | type | identifier | ofType
element.definition: A modifier supported for the search parameter.

binding.name: SearchModifierCode
binding.description: A supported modifier for a search parameter.

element.name: chain
element.definition: Contains the names of any search parameters which may be chained to the containing search parameter. Chained parameters may be added to search parameters of type reference and specify that resources will only be returned if they contain a reference to a resource which matches the chained parameter value. Values for this field should be drawn from SearchParameter.code for a parameter on the target resource type.
element.comment: Systems are not required to list all the chain names they support, but if they don't list them, clients might not know to use them.

element.name: component
element.description: For Composite resources to define the parts
element.definition: Used to define the parts of a composite search parameter.

element.name: definition
element.definition: The definition of the search parameter that describes this part.

element.name: expression
element.definition: A sub-expression that defines how to extract values for this component from the output of the main SearchParameter.expression.
element.comment: This expression overrides the expression in the definition and extracts the index values from the outcome of the composite expression.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Identifiers assigned to this order instance by the orderer and/or the receiver and/or order fulfiller.
element.comment: The identifier.type element is used to distinguish between the identifiers assigned by the orderer (known as the 'Placer' in HL7 v2) and the producer of the observations in response to the order (known as the 'Filler' in HL7 v2). For further discussion and examples see the resource notes section below.

element.name: instantiatesCanonical
element.definition: The URL pointing to a FHIR-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this ServiceRequest.
element.comment: Note: This is a business identifier, not a resource identifier (see [discussion](resource.html#identifiers)). It is best practice for the identifier to only appear on a single resource instance, however business practices may occasionally dictate that multiple resource instances with the same identifier can exist - possibly even with different resource types. For example, multiple Patient and a Person resource instance might share the same social insurance number.

element.name: instantiatesUri
element.definition: The URL pointing to an externally maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this ServiceRequest.
element.comment: This might be an HTML page, PDF, etc. or could just be a non-resolvable URI identifier.

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: Plan/proposal/order fulfilled by this request.

element.name: replaces
element.definition: The request takes the place of the referenced completed or terminated request(s).

element.name: requisition
element.definition: A shared identifier common to all service requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the composite or group identifier.
element.comment: Requests are linked either by a "basedOn" relationship (i.e. one request is fulfilling another) or by having a common requisition. Requests that are part of the same requisition are generally treated independently from the perspective of changing their state or maintaining them after initial creation.

element.name: status
element.description: draft | active | on-hold | revoked | completed | entered-in-error | unknown
element.definition: The status of the order.
element.comment: The status is generally fully in the control of the requester - they determine whether the order is draft or active and, after it has been activated, competed, cancelled or suspended. States relating to the activities of the performer are reflected on either the corresponding event (see [Event Pattern](event.html) for general discussion) or using the [Task](task.html) resource.

binding.name: ServiceRequestStatus
binding.description: The status of a service order.

element.name: intent
element.description: proposal | plan | directive | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
element.definition: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, an original order or a reflex order.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the intent alters when and how the resource is actually applicable.

binding.name: ServiceRequestIntent
binding.description: The kind of service request.

element.name: category
element.definition: A code that classifies the service for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. "Surgical Procedure").
element.comment: There may be multiple axis of categorization depending on the context or use case for retrieving or displaying the resource. The level of granularity is defined by the category concepts in the value set.

binding.name: ServiceRequestCategory
binding.description: Classification of the requested service.

element.name: priority
element.definition: Indicates how quickly the ServiceRequest should be addressed with respect to other requests.

binding.name: ServiceRequestPriority
binding.description: Identifies the level of importance to be assigned to actioning the request.

element.name: doNotPerform
element.description: True if service/procedure should not be performed
element.definition: Set this to true if the record is saying that the service/procedure should NOT be performed.
element.comment: In general, only the code and timeframe will be present, though occasional additional qualifiers such as body site or even performer could be included to narrow the scope of the prohibition. If the ServiceRequest.code and ServiceRequest.doNotPerform both contain negation, that will reinforce prohibition and should not have a double negative interpretation.

element.name: code
element.definition: A code that identifies a particular service (i.e., procedure, diagnostic investigation, or panel of investigations) that have been requested.
element.comment: Many laboratory and radiology procedure codes embed the specimen/organ system in the test order name, for example, serum or serum/plasma glucose, or a chest x-ray. The specimen might not be recorded separately from the test code.

binding.name: ServiceRequestCode
binding.description: Codes for tests or services that can be carried out by a designated individual, organization or healthcare service. For laboratory, LOINC is (preferred)[http://build.fhir.org/terminologies.html#preferred] and a valueset using LOINC Order codes is available [here](valueset-diagnostic-requests.html).

element.name: orderDetail
element.definition: Additional details and instructions about the how the services are to be delivered. For example, and order for a urinary catheter may have an order detail for an external or indwelling catheter, or an order for a bandage may require additional instructions specifying how the bandage should be applied.
element.comment: For information from the medical record intended to support the delivery of the requested services, use the `supportingInformation` element.

binding.name: OrderDetail
binding.description: Codified order entry details which are based on order context.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: An amount of service being requested which can be a quantity ( for example $1,500 home modification), a ratio ( for example, 20 half day visits per month), or a range (2.0 to 1.8 Gy per fraction).

element.name: subject
element.description: Individual or Entity the service is ordered for
element.definition: On whom or what the service is to be performed. This is usually a human patient, but can also be requested on animals, groups of humans or animals, devices such as dialysis machines, or even locations (typically for environmental scans).

element.name: encounter
element.description: Encounter in which the request was created
element.definition: An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

element.name: occurrence
element.definition: The date/time at which the requested service should occur.

element.name: asNeeded
element.definition: If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for performing the service. For example "pain", "on flare-up", etc.

binding.name: ProcedureAsNeededReason
binding.description: A coded concept identifying the pre-condition that should hold prior to performing a procedure. For example "pain", "on flare-up", etc.

element.name: authoredOn
element.definition: When the request transitioned to being actionable.

element.name: requester
element.definition: The individual who initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.
element.comment: This not the dispatcher, but rather who is the authorizer. This element is not intended to handle delegation which would generally be managed through the Provenance resource.

element.name: performerType
element.definition: Desired type of performer for doing the requested service.
element.comment: This is a role, not a participation type. In other words, does not describe the task but describes the capacity. For example, compounding pharmacy, psychiatrist or internal referral.

binding.name: ServiceRequestParticipantRole
binding.description: Indicates specific responsibility of an individual within the care team, such as "Primary physician", "Team coordinator", "Caregiver", etc.

element.name: performer
element.definition: The desired performer for doing the requested service. For example, the surgeon, dermatopathologist, endoscopist, etc.
element.comment: If multiple performers are present, it is interpreted as a list of *alternative* performers without any preference regardless of order. If order of preference is needed use the [request-performerOrder extension](extension-request-performerorder.html). Use CareTeam to represent a group of performers (for example, Practitioner A *and* Practitioner B).

element.name: locationCode
element.definition: The preferred location(s) where the procedure should actually happen in coded or free text form. E.g. at home or nursing day care center.

binding.name: ServiceRequestLocation
binding.description: A location type where services are delivered.

element.name: locationReference
element.definition: A reference to the the preferred location(s) where the procedure should actually happen. E.g. at home or nursing day care center.

element.name: reasonCode
element.definition: An explanation or justification for why this service is being requested in coded or textual form. This is often for billing purposes. May relate to the resources referred to in `supportingInfo`.
element.comment: This element represents why the referral is being made and may be used to decide how the service will be performed, or even if it will be performed at all. Use `CodeableConcept.text` element if the data is free (uncoded) text as shown in the [CT Scan example](servicerequest-example-di.html).

binding.name: ServiceRequestReason
binding.description: Diagnosis or problem codes justifying the reason for requesting the service investigation.

element.name: reasonReference
element.definition: Indicates another resource that provides a justification for why this service is being requested. May relate to the resources referred to in `supportingInfo`.
element.comment: This element represents why the referral is being made and may be used to decide how the service will be performed, or even if it will be performed at all. To be as specific as possible, a reference to *Observation* or *Condition* should be used if available. Otherwise when referencing *DiagnosticReport* it should contain a finding in `DiagnosticReport.conclusion` and/or `DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode`. When using a reference to *DocumentReference*, the target document should contain clear findings language providing the relevant reason for this service request. Use the CodeableConcept text element in `ServiceRequest.reasonCode` if the data is free (uncoded) text as shown in the [CT Scan example](servicerequest-example-di.html).

element.name: insurance
element.definition: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be needed for delivering the requested service.

element.name: supportingInfo
element.definition: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may influence the services or their interpretations. This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations. In laboratory ordering these are typically referred to as "ask at order entry questions (AOEs)". This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example, reporting the amount of inspired oxygen for blood gas measurements.
element.comment: To represent information about how the services are to be delivered use the `instructions` element.

element.name: specimen
element.definition: One or more specimens that the laboratory procedure will use.
element.comment: Many diagnostic procedures need a specimen, but the request itself is not actually about the specimen. This element is for when the diagnostic is requested on already existing specimens and the request points to the specimen it applies to. Conversely, if the request is entered first with an unknown specimen, then the [Specimen](specimen.html) resource points to the ServiceRequest.

element.name: bodySite
element.definition: Anatomic location where the procedure should be performed. This is the target site.
element.comment: Only used if not implicit in the code found in ServiceRequest.code. If the use case requires BodySite to be handled as a separate resource instead of an inline coded element (e.g. to identify and track separately) then use the standard extension [procedure-targetBodyStructure](extension-procedure-targetbodystructure.html).

binding.name: BodySite
binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

element.name: note
element.definition: Any other notes and comments made about the service request. For example, internal billing notes.

element.name: patientInstruction
element.definition: Instructions in terms that are understood by the patient or consumer.

element.name: relevantHistory
element.definition: Key events in the history of the request.
element.comment: This might not include provenances for all versions of the request only those deemed relevant or important. This SHALL NOT include the Provenance associated with this current version of the resource. (If that provenance is deemed to be a relevant change, it will need to be added as part of a later update. Until then, it can be queried directly as the Provenance that points to this version using _revinclude All Provenances should have some historical version of this Request as their subject.

element.name: type
element.description: Indication of the reason the entity signed the object(s)
element.definition: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.
element.comment: Examples include attesting to: authorship, correct transcription, and witness of specific event. Also known as a "Commitment Type Indication".

binding.name: SignatureType
binding.description: An indication of the reason that an entity signed the object.

element.name: when
element.definition: When the digital signature was signed.
element.comment: This should agree with the information in the signature.

element.name: who
element.definition: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that signed (e.g. the signature used their private key).
element.comment: This should agree with the information in the signature.

element.name: onBehalfOf
element.definition: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that is represented by the signature.
element.comment: The party that can't sign. For example a child.

element.name: targetFormat
element.description: The technical format of the signed resources
element.definition: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the target resources signed by the signature.
element.comment: "xml", "json" and "ttl" are allowed, which describe the simple encodings described in the specification (and imply appropriate bundle support). Otherwise, mime types are legal here.

binding.name: MimeType
binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

element.name: sigFormat
element.description: The technical format of the signature
element.definition: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the signature. Important mime types are application/signature+xml for X ML DigSig, application/jose for JWS, and image/* for a graphical image of a signature, etc.

binding.name: MimeType
binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

element.name: data
element.description: The actual signature content (XML DigSig. JWS, picture, etc.)
element.definition: The base64 encoding of the Signature content. When signature is not recorded electronically this element would be empty.
element.comment: Where the signature type is an XML DigSig, the signed content is a FHIR Resource(s), the signature is of the XML form of the Resource(s) using XML-Signature (XMLDIG) "Detached Signature" form.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: External Ids for this item.

element.name: serviceCategory
element.description: A broad categorization of the service that is to be performed during this appointment
element.definition: A broad categorization of the service that is to be performed during this appointment.

element.name: serviceType
element.description: The type of appointments that can be booked into this slot (ideally this would be an identifiable service - which is at a location, rather than the location itself). If provided then this overrides the value provided on the availability resource
element.definition: The type of appointments that can be booked into this slot (ideally this would be an identifiable service - which is at a location, rather than the location itself). If provided then this overrides the value provided on the availability resource.

element.name: specialty
element.description: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment
element.definition: The specialty of a practitioner that would be required to perform the service requested in this appointment.

binding.name: specialty
binding.description: Additional details about where the content was created (e.g. clinical specialty).

element.name: appointmentType
element.description: The style of appointment or patient that may be booked in the slot (not service type)
element.definition: The style of appointment or patient that may be booked in the slot (not service type).

element.name: schedule
element.description: The schedule resource that this slot defines an interval of status information
element.definition: The schedule resource that this slot defines an interval of status information.

element.name: status
element.definition: busy | free | busy-unavailable | busy-tentative | entered-in-error.

binding.name: SlotStatus
binding.description: The free/busy status of the slot.

element.name: start
element.description: Date/Time that the slot is to begin
element.definition: Date/Time that the slot is to begin.

element.name: end
element.description: Date/Time that the slot is to conclude
element.definition: Date/Time that the slot is to conclude.

element.name: overbooked
element.description: This slot has already been overbooked, appointments are unlikely to be accepted for this time
element.definition: This slot has already been overbooked, appointments are unlikely to be accepted for this time.

element.name: comment
element.description: Comments on the slot to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slot
element.definition: Comments on the slot to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slot.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Id for specimen.

element.name: accessionIdentifier
element.definition: The identifier assigned by the lab when accessioning specimen(s). This is not necessarily the same as the specimen identifier, depending on local lab procedures.

element.name: status
element.definition: The availability of the specimen.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: SpecimenStatus
binding.description: Codes providing the status/availability of a specimen.

element.name: type
element.description: Kind of material that forms the specimen
element.definition: The kind of material that forms the specimen.
element.comment: The type can change the way that a specimen is handled and drives what kind of analyses can properly be performed on the specimen. It is frequently used in diagnostic work flow decision making systems.

binding.name: SpecimenType
binding.description: The type of the specimen.

element.name: subject
element.description: Where the specimen came from. This may be from patient(s), from a location (e.g., the source of an environmental sample), or a sampling of a substance or a device
element.definition: Where the specimen came from. This may be from patient(s), from a location (e.g., the source of an environmental sample), or a sampling of a substance or a device.

element.name: receivedTime
element.description: The time when specimen was received for processing
element.definition: Time when specimen was received for processing or testing.

element.name: parent
element.description: Specimen from which this specimen originated
element.definition: Reference to the parent (source) specimen which is used when the specimen was either derived from or a component of another specimen.
element.comment: The parent specimen could be the source from which the current specimen is derived by some processing step (e.g. an aliquot or isolate or extracted nucleic acids from clinical samples) or one of many specimens that were combined to create a pooled sample.

element.name: request
element.definition: Details concerning a service request that required a specimen to be collected.
element.comment: The request may be explicit or implied such with a ServiceRequest that requires a blood draw.

element.name: collection
element.definition: Details concerning the specimen collection.

element.name: processing
element.definition: Details concerning processing and processing steps for the specimen.

element.name: container
element.definition: The container holding the specimen. The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here.

element.name: condition
element.definition: A mode or state of being that describes the nature of the specimen.
element.comment: Specimen condition is an observation made about the specimen. It's a point-in-time assessment. It can be used to assess its quality or appropriateness for a specific test.

binding.name: SpecimenCondition
binding.description: Codes describing the state of the specimen.

element.name: note
element.definition: To communicate any details or issues about the specimen or during the specimen collection. (for example: broken vial, sent with patient, frozen).

element.name: collector
element.definition: Person who collected the specimen.

element.name: collected
element.definition: Time when specimen was collected from subject - the physiologically relevant time.

element.name: duration
element.description: How long it took to collect specimen
element.definition: The span of time over which the collection of a specimen occurred.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: The quantity of specimen collected; for instance the volume of a blood sample, or the physical measurement of an anatomic pathology sample.

element.name: method
element.definition: A coded value specifying the technique that is used to perform the procedure.

binding.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
binding.description: The technique that is used to perform the procedure.

element.name: bodySite
element.definition: Anatomical location from which the specimen was collected (if subject is a patient). This is the target site. This element is not used for environmental specimens.
element.comment: If the use case requires BodySite to be handled as a separate resource instead of an inline coded element (e.g. to identify and track separately) then use the standard extension [bodySite](extension-bodysite.html).

binding.name: BodySite
binding.description: Codes describing anatomical locations. May include laterality.

element.name: fastingStatus
element.description: Whether or how long patient abstained from food and/or drink
element.definition: Abstinence or reduction from some or all food, drink, or both, for a period of time prior to sample collection.
element.comment: Representing fasting status using this element is preferred to representing it with an observation using a 'pre-coordinated code' such as LOINC 2005-7 (Calcium [Moles/time] in 2 hour Urine --12 hours fasting), or using a component observation ` such as `Observation.component code` = LOINC 49541-6 (Fasting status - Reported).

binding.name: FastingStatus
binding.description: Codes describing the fasting status of the patient.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Id for container. There may be multiple; a manufacturer's bar code, lab assigned identifier, etc. The container ID may differ from the specimen id in some circumstances.

element.name: description
element.definition: Textual description of the container.

element.name: type
element.description: Kind of container directly associated with specimen
element.definition: The type of container associated with the specimen (e.g. slide, aliquot, etc.).

binding.name: SpecimenContainerType
binding.description: Type of specimen container.

element.name: capacity
element.definition: The capacity (volume or other measure) the container may contain.

element.name: specimenQuantity
element.definition: The quantity of specimen in the container; may be volume, dimensions, or other appropriate measurements, depending on the specimen type.

element.name: additive
element.definition: Introduced substance to preserve, maintain or enhance the specimen. Examples: Formalin, Citrate, EDTA.

binding.name: SpecimenContainerAdditive
binding.description: Substance added to specimen container.

element.name: description
element.definition: Textual description of procedure.

element.name: procedure
element.description: Indicates the treatment step applied to the specimen
element.definition: A coded value specifying the procedure used to process the specimen.

binding.name: SpecimenProcessingProcedure
binding.description: Type indicating the technique used to process the specimen.

element.name: additive
element.description: Material used in the processing step
element.definition: Material used in the processing step.

element.name: time
element.description: Date and time of specimen processing
