element.definition: A record of the time or period when the specimen processing occurred. For example the time of sample fixation or the period of time the sample was in formalin.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Business identifier of a kind of specimen
element.definition: A business identifier associated with the kind of specimen.

element.name: typeCollected
element.definition: The kind of material to be collected.

binding.name: CollectedSpecimenType
binding.description: The type of the specimen to be collected.

element.name: patientPreparation
element.definition: Preparation of the patient for specimen collection.

binding.name: PreparePatient
binding.description: Checks on the patient prior specimen collection.

element.name: timeAspect
element.definition: Time aspect of specimen collection (duration or offset).

element.name: collection
element.definition: The action to be performed for collecting the specimen.

binding.name: SpecimenCollection
binding.description: The action to collect a type of specimen.

element.name: typeTested
element.description: Specimen in container intended for testing by lab
element.definition: Specimen conditioned in a container as expected by the testing laboratory.

element.name: isDerived
element.definition: Primary of secondary specimen.

element.name: type
element.definition: The kind of specimen conditioned for testing expected by lab.

binding.name: IntendedSpecimenType
binding.description: The type of specimen conditioned in a container for lab testing.

element.name: preference
element.definition: The preference for this type of conditioned specimen.

binding.name: SpecimenContainedPreference
binding.description: Degree of preference of a type of conditioned specimen.

element.name: container
element.definition: The specimen's container.

element.name: requirement
element.definition: Requirements for delivery and special handling of this kind of conditioned specimen.

element.name: retentionTime
element.definition: The usual time that a specimen of this kind is retained after the ordered tests are completed, for the purpose of additional testing.

element.name: rejectionCriterion
element.definition: Criterion for rejection of the specimen in its container by the laboratory.

binding.name: RejectionCriterion
binding.description: Criterion for rejection of the specimen by laboratory.

element.name: handling
element.definition: Set of instructions for preservation/transport of the specimen at a defined temperature interval, prior the testing process.

element.name: material
element.definition: The type of material of the container.

binding.name: ContainerMaterial
binding.description: Types of material for specimen containers.

element.name: type
element.description: Kind of container associated with the kind of specimen
element.definition: The type of container used to contain this kind of specimen.

binding.name: ContainerType
binding.description: Type of specimen container.

element.name: cap
element.definition: Color of container cap.

binding.name: ContainerCap
binding.description: Color of the container cap.

element.name: description
element.definition: The textual description of the kind of container.

element.name: capacity
element.definition: The capacity (volume or other measure) of this kind of container.

element.name: minimumVolume
element.definition: The minimum volume to be conditioned in the container.

element.name: additive
element.definition: Substance introduced in the kind of container to preserve, maintain or enhance the specimen. Examples: Formalin, Citrate, EDTA.

element.name: preparation
element.definition: Special processing that should be applied to the container for this kind of specimen.

element.name: additive
element.definition: Substance introduced in the kind of container to preserve, maintain or enhance the specimen. Examples: Formalin, Citrate, EDTA.

binding.name: ContainerAdditive
binding.description: Substance added to specimen container.

element.name: temperatureQualifier
element.definition: It qualifies the interval of temperature, which characterizes an occurrence of handling. Conditions that are not related to temperature may be handled in the instruction element.

binding.name: HandlingConditionSet
binding.description: Set of handling instructions prior testing of the specimen.

element.name: temperatureRange
element.definition: The temperature interval for this set of handling instructions.

element.name: maxDuration
element.definition: The maximum time interval of preservation of the specimen with these conditions.

element.name: instruction
element.definition: Additional textual instructions for the preservation or transport of the specimen. For instance, 'Protect from light exposure'.

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this structure definition, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this structure definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this structure definition is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the structure definition is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Additional identifier for the structure definition
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this structure definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this structure definition outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the structure definition
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the structure definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the structure definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
element.comment: There may be different structure definition instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the structure definition with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this structure definition (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the structure definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment:
The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.Some Examples:
* O2SatObservation * PresentationReport * Immunization2 * AcmeAdmissionRecordOld.

element.name: title
element.description: Name for this structure definition (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the structure definition.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.Applications don't have to use this name but can always fall back to it. The title also corresponds to the label for the root element.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of this structure definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of structure definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: experimental
element.description: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this structure definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of structure definitions that are appropriate for use versus not.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the structure definition was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the structure definition changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the structure definition. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the structure definition.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the structure definition is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the structure definition. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the structure definition. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the structure definition
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the structure definition from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the structure definition was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the structure definition as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the structure definition is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the structure definition was created).

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate structure definition instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for structure definition (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the structure definition is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the structure definition to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: purpose
element.description: Why this structure definition is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this structure definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the structure definition. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this structure definition.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the structure definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the structure definition.

element.name: keyword
element.definition: A set of key words or terms from external terminologies that may be used to assist with indexing and searching of templates nby describing the use of this structure definition, or the content it describes.

binding.name: StructureDefinitionKeyword
binding.description: Codes for the meaning of the defined structure (SNOMED CT and LOINC codes, as an example).

element.name: fhirVersion
element.definition: The version of the FHIR specification on which this StructureDefinition is based - this is the formal version of the specification, without the revision number, e.g. [publication].[major].[minor], which is 4.3.0-cibuild. for this version.
element.comment: A StructureDefinition does not need to specify the target it applies to as StructureDefinitions will often be valid across multiple versions of FHIR. FHIR tooling can determine whether a StructureDefinition is consistent with a particular StructureDefinition if desired.

binding.name: FHIRVersion
binding.description: All published FHIR Versions.

element.name: mapping
element.description: External specification that the content is mapped to
element.definition: An external specification that the content is mapped to.

constraint.name: sdf-2
constraint.message: Must have at least a name or a uri (or both)

element.name: kind
element.definition: Defines the kind of structure that this definition is describing.

binding.name: StructureDefinitionKind
binding.description: Defines the type of structure that a definition is describing.

element.name: abstract
element.definition: Whether structure this definition describes is abstract or not - that is, whether the structure is not intended to be instantiated. For Resources and Data types, abstract types will never be exchanged between systems.
element.comment: Abstract Resources cannot be instantiated - a concrete sub-type must be used. Abstract datatypes and extensions cannot be used in an instance. For logical models, the exact implication of "abstract" will rest with the author, depending how the logical model is used. Flagging a constraint structure as abstract conveys design intent but makes no difference to how the structure definition is handled. Note that inline declared elements that are given the type "Element" in the StructureDefinition, but have children described, are anonymous concrete types that specialize Element.

element.name: context
element.description: If an extension, where it can be used in instances
element.definition: Identifies the types of resource or data type elements to which the extension can be applied.

element.name: contextInvariant
element.description: FHIRPath invariants - when the extension can be used
element.definition: A set of rules as FHIRPath Invariants about when the extension can be used (e.g. co-occurrence variants for the extension). All the rules must be true.
element.comment: The rules are only evaluated when the extension is present. When evaluating the invariant, the FHIRPath focus is the element that holds the extension, and %extension refers to the extension itself.

element.name: type
element.description: Type defined or constrained by this structure
element.definition: The type this structure describes. If the derivation kind is 'specialization' then this is the master definition for a type, and there is always one of these (a data type, an extension, a resource, including abstract ones). Otherwise the structure definition is a constraint on the stated type (and in this case, the type cannot be an abstract type). References are URLs that are relative to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition e.g. "string" is a reference to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/string. Absolute URLs are only allowed in logical models.
element.comment:
Note that in the case of constraints, the type could be determined by chasing through the baseDefinition references until a concrete structure (derivation = specialization) is reached, or by looking at the path of the first element in the snapshot - if present - but providing the type directly makes for simpler tooling and indexing.
The type must match the elements defined in the differential and the snapshot. For all FHIR defined types, the path name of the element will start with the type name. For logical models, where the type is a URL, the type name SHOULD start with the tail of the type URL where required.

binding.name: FHIRDefinedTypeExt
binding.description: Either a resource or a data type, including logical model types.

element.name: baseDefinition
element.description: Definition that this type is constrained/specialized from
element.definition: An absolute URI that is the base structure from which this type is derived, either by specialization or constraint.
element.comment: If differential constraints are specified in this structure, they are applied to the base in a "differential" fashion. If there is no base, then the differential constraints cannot be provided (snapshot only). Differential structures are useful for the editing perspective, and snapshot structures are suitable for operational use. The FHIR Project provides a number of tools/services to populate snapshots from differential constraints. Logical Models have a base of "Element" or another logical model.

element.name: derivation
element.description: specialization | constraint - How relates to base definition
element.definition: How the type relates to the baseDefinition.
element.comment: If the definition is a specialization, then it adds new elements in the differential, and the snapshot includes the inherited elements. If the definition is a constraint, then it cannot define new elements, it can only make new rules about existing content (see [Profiling Resources](profiling.html#resources)).

binding.name: TypeDerivationRule
binding.description: How a type relates to its baseDefinition.

element.name: snapshot
element.definition: A snapshot view is expressed in a standalone form that can be used and interpreted without considering the base StructureDefinition.

constraint.name: sdf-8
constraint.message: All snapshot elements must start with the StructureDefinition's specified type for non-logical models, or with the same type name for logical models

constraint.name: sdf-3
constraint.message: Each element definition in a snapshot must have a formal definition and cardinalities

constraint.name: sdf-8b
constraint.message: All snapshot elements must have a base definition

element.name: differential
element.definition: A differential view is expressed relative to the base StructureDefinition - a statement of differences that it applies.

constraint.name: sdf-20
constraint.message: No slicing on the root element

constraint.name: sdf-8a
constraint.message: In any differential, all the elements must start with the StructureDefinition's specified type for non-logical models, or with the same type name for logical models

element.name: type
element.definition: Defines how to interpret the expression that defines what the context of the extension is.

binding.name: ExtensionContextType
binding.description: How an extension context is interpreted.

element.name: expression
element.description: Where the extension can be used in instances
element.definition: An expression that defines where an extension can be used in resources.

element.name: element
element.description: Definition of elements in the resource (if no StructureDefinition)
element.definition: Captures constraints on each element within the resource.

element.name: identity
element.description: Internal id when this mapping is used
element.definition: An Internal id that is used to identify this mapping set when specific mappings are made.
element.comment: The specification is described once, with general comments, and then specific mappings are made that reference this declaration.

element.name: uri
element.description: Identifies what this mapping refers to
element.definition: An absolute URI that identifies the specification that this mapping is expressed to.
element.comment: A formal identity for the specification being mapped to helps with identifying maps consistently.

element.name: name
element.description: Names what this mapping refers to
element.definition: A name for the specification that is being mapped to.

element.name: comment
element.definition: Comments about this mapping, including version notes, issues, scope limitations, and other important notes for usage.

element.name: element
element.description: Definition of elements in the resource (if no StructureDefinition)
element.definition: Captures constraints on each element within the resource.

constraint.name: sdf-10
constraint.message: provide either a binding reference or a description (or both)

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this structure map, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this structure map when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this structure map is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the structure map is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Additional identifier for the structure map
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this structure map when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this structure map outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the structure map
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the structure map when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the structure map author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.
element.comment: There may be different structure map instances that have the same identifier but different versions. The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the structure map with the format [url]|[version].

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this structure map (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the structure map. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.

element.name: title
element.description: Name for this structure map (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the structure map.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of this structure map. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of structure maps that are appropriate for use versus not.

binding.name: PublicationStatus
binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.name: experimental
element.description: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this structure map is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.comment: Allows filtering of structure maps that are appropriate for use versus not.

element.name: date
element.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the structure map was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the structure map changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the structure map. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.name: publisher
element.description: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the structure map.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the structure map is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the structure map. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the structure map. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.

element.name: description
element.description: Natural language description of the structure map
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the structure map from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the structure map was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the structure map as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the structure map is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the structure map was created).

element.name: useContext
element.description: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate structure map instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.

element.name: jurisdiction
element.description: Intended jurisdiction for structure map (if applicable)
element.definition: A legal or geographic region in which the structure map is intended to be used.
element.comment: It may be possible for the structure map to be used in jurisdictions other than those for which it was originally designed or intended.

binding.name: Jurisdiction
binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

element.name: purpose
element.description: Why this structure map is defined
element.definition: Explanation of why this structure map is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
element.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the structure map. Instead, it provides traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this structure map.

element.name: copyright
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the structure map and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the structure map.

element.name: structure
element.description: Structure Definition used by this map
element.definition: A structure definition used by this map. The structure definition may describe instances that are converted, or the instances that are produced.
element.comment: It is not necessary for a structure map to identify any dependent structures, though not listing them may restrict its usefulness.

element.name: import
element.description: Other maps used by this map (canonical URLs)
element.definition: Other maps used by this map (canonical URLs).

element.name: group
element.definition: Organizes the mapping into manageable chunks for human review/ease of maintenance.

element.name: name
element.definition: A unique name for the group for the convenience of human readers.

element.name: extends
element.description: Another group that this group adds rules to
element.definition: Another group that this group adds rules to.

element.name: typeMode
element.definition: If this is the default rule set to apply for the source type or this combination of types.
element.comment: Not applicable if the underlying model is untyped. There can only be one default mapping for any particular type combination.

binding.name: StructureMapGroupTypeMode
binding.description: If this is the default rule set to apply for the source type, or this combination of types.

element.name: documentation
element.definition: Additional supporting documentation that explains the purpose of the group and the types of mappings within it.

element.name: input
element.description: Named instance provided when invoking the map
element.definition: A name assigned to an instance of data. The instance must be provided when the mapping is invoked.
element.comment: If no inputs are named, then the entry mappings are type based.

element.name: rule
element.description: Transform Rule from source to target
element.definition: Transform Rule from source to target.

element.name: name
element.description: Name for this instance of data
element.definition: Name for this instance of data.

element.name: type
element.description: Type for this instance of data
element.definition: Type for this instance of data.

element.name: mode
element.definition: Mode for this instance of data.

binding.name: StructureMapInputMode
binding.description: Mode for this instance of data.

element.name: documentation
element.description: Documentation for this instance of data
element.definition: Documentation for this instance of data.

element.name: name
element.description: Name of the rule for internal references
element.definition: Name of the rule for internal references.

element.name: source
element.definition: Source inputs to the mapping.

element.name: target
element.description: Content to create because of this mapping rule
element.definition: Content to create because of this mapping rule.

constraint.name: smp-2
constraint.message: Must have a contextType if you have a context

constraint.name: smp-1
constraint.message: Can only have an element if you have a context

element.name: rule
element.definition: Rules contained in this rule.

element.name: dependent
element.description: Which other rules to apply in the context of this rule
element.definition: Which other rules to apply in the context of this rule.

element.name: documentation
element.description: Documentation for this instance of data
element.definition: Documentation for this instance of data.

element.name: name
element.description: Name of a rule or group to apply
element.definition: Name of a rule or group to apply.

element.name: variable
element.description: Variable to pass to the rule or group
element.definition: Variable to pass to the rule or group.

element.name: context
element.description: Type or variable this rule applies to
element.definition: Type or variable this rule applies to.

element.name: min
element.definition: Specified minimum cardinality for the element. This is optional; if present, it acts an implicit check on the input content.

element.name: max
element.definition: Specified maximum cardinality for the element - a number or a "*". This is optional; if present, it acts an implicit check on the input content (* just serves as documentation; it's the default value).

element.name: type
element.description: Rule only applies if source has this type
element.definition: Specified type for the element. This works as a condition on the mapping - use for polymorphic elements.

element.name: defaultValue
element.description: Default value if no value exists
element.definition: A value to use if there is no existing value in the source object.
element.comment: If there's a default value on an item that can repeat, it will only be used once.

element.name: element
element.definition: Optional field for this source.

element.name: listMode
element.definition: How to handle the list mode for this element.

binding.name: StructureMapSourceListMode
binding.description: If field is a list, how to manage the source.

element.name: variable
element.description: Named context for field, if a field is specified
element.definition: Named context for field, if a field is specified.

element.name: condition
element.description: FHIRPath expression - must be true or the rule does not apply
element.definition: FHIRPath expression - must be true or the rule does not apply.

element.name: check
element.description: FHIRPath expression - must be true or the mapping engine throws an error instead of completing
element.definition: FHIRPath expression - must be true or the mapping engine throws an error instead of completing.

element.name: logMessage
element.description: Message to put in log if source exists (FHIRPath)
element.definition: A FHIRPath expression which specifies a message to put in the transform log when content matching the source rule is found.
element.comment: This is typically used for recording that something Is not transformed to the target for some reason.

element.name: context
element.description: Type or variable this rule applies to
element.definition: Type or variable this rule applies to.

element.name: contextType
element.definition: How to interpret the context.

binding.name: StructureMapContextType
binding.description: How to interpret the context.

element.name: element
element.description: Field to create in the context
element.definition: Field to create in the context.

element.name: variable
element.description: Named context for field, if desired, and a field is specified
element.definition: Named context for field, if desired, and a field is specified.

element.name: listMode
element.definition: If field is a list, how to manage the list.

binding.name: StructureMapTargetListMode
binding.description: If field is a list, how to manage the production.

element.name: listRuleId
element.description: Internal rule reference for shared list items
element.definition: Internal rule reference for shared list items.

element.name: transform
element.definition: How the data is copied / created.

binding.name: StructureMapTransform
binding.description: How data is copied/created.

element.name: parameter
element.definition: Parameters to the transform.

element.name: value
element.definition: Parameter value - variable or literal.

element.name: url
element.definition: The canonical reference to the structure.

element.name: mode
element.definition: How the referenced structure is used in this mapping.

binding.name: StructureMapModelMode
binding.description: How the referenced structure is used in this mapping.

element.name: alias
element.description: Name for type in this map
element.definition: The name used for this type in the map.
element.comment: This is needed if both types have the same name (e.g. version conversion).

element.name: documentation
element.definition: Documentation that describes how the structure is used in the mapping.

element.name: status
element.definition: The status of the subscription, which marks the server state for managing the subscription.
element.comment:
A client can only submit subscription resources in the requested or off state. Only the server can move a subscription from requested to active, and then to error. Either the server or the client can turn a subscription off.
This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

binding.name: SubscriptionStatus
binding.description: The status of a subscription.

element.name: contact
element.definition: Contact details for a human to contact about the subscription. The primary use of this for system administrator troubleshooting.

element.name: end
element.description: When to automatically delete the subscription
element.definition: The time for the server to turn the subscription off.
element.comment: The server is permitted to deviate from this time but should observe it.

element.name: reason
element.description: Description of why this subscription was created
element.definition: A description of why this subscription is defined.

element.name: criteria
element.definition: The rules that the server should use to determine when to generate notifications for this subscription.
element.comment: The rules are search criteria (without the [base] part). Like Bundle.entry.request.url, it has no leading "/".

element.name: error
element.definition: A record of the last error that occurred when the server processed a notification.

element.name: channel
element.description: The channel on which to report matches to the criteria
element.definition: Details where to send notifications when resources are received that meet the criteria.

element.name: type
element.definition: The type of channel to send notifications on.

binding.name: SubscriptionChannelType
binding.description: The type of method used to execute a subscription.

element.name: endpoint
element.definition: The url that describes the actual end-point to send messages to.
element.comment: For rest-hook, and websocket, the end-point must be an http: or https: URL; for email, a mailto: url, for sms, a tel: url, and for message the endpoint can be in any form of url the server understands (usually, http: or mllp:). The URI is allowed to be relative; in which case, it is relative to the server end-point (since there may be more than one, clients should avoid using relative URIs).

element.name: payload
element.description: MIME type to send, or omit for no payload
element.definition: The mime type to send the payload in - either application/fhir+xml, or application/fhir+json. If the payload is not present, then there is no payload in the notification, just a notification. The mime type "text/plain" may also be used for Email and SMS subscriptions.
element.comment: Sending the payload has obvious security implications. The server is responsible for ensuring that the content is appropriately secured.

binding.name: MimeType
binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

element.name: header
element.description: Usage depends on the channel type
element.definition: Additional headers / information to send as part of the notification.
element.comment: Exactly what these mean depend on the channel type. They can convey additional information to the recipient and/or meet security requirements; for example, support of multiple headers in the outgoing notifications for rest-hook type subscriptions.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Unique identifier for the substance.
element.comment: This identifier is associated with the kind of substance in contrast to the Substance.instance.identifier which is associated with the package/container.

element.name: status
element.definition: A code to indicate if the substance is actively used.

binding.name: FHIRSubstanceStatus
binding.description: A code to indicate if the substance is actively used.

element.name: category
element.description: What class/type of substance this is
element.definition: A code that classifies the general type of substance. This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes.
element.comment: The level of granularity is defined by the category concepts in the value set. More fine-grained filtering can be performed using the metadata and/or terminology hierarchy in Substance.code.

binding.name: SubstanceCategory
binding.description: Category or classification of substance.

element.name: code
element.definition: A code (or set of codes) that identify this substance.
element.comment: This could be a reference to an externally defined code. It could also be a locally assigned code (e.g. a formulary), optionally with translations to the standard drug codes.

binding.name: SubstanceCode
binding.description: Substance codes.

element.name: description
element.description: Textual description of the substance, comments
element.definition: A description of the substance - its appearance, handling requirements, and other usage notes.

element.name: instance
element.description: If this describes a specific package/container of the substance
element.definition: Substance may be used to describe a kind of substance, or a specific package/container of the substance: an instance.

element.name: ingredient
element.definition: A substance can be composed of other substances.

element.name: quantity
element.definition: The amount of the ingredient in the substance - a concentration ratio.

element.name: substance
element.definition: Another substance that is a component of this substance.

binding.name: SubstanceIngredient
binding.description: Substance Ingredient codes.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Identifier associated with the package/container (usually a label affixed directly).

element.name: expiry
element.description: When no longer valid to use
element.definition: When the substance is no longer valid to use. For some substances, a single arbitrary date is used for expiry.

element.name: quantity
element.description: Amount of substance in the package
element.definition: The amount of the substance.

element.name: amount
element.description: Used to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements. If only limits are given, the arithmetic mean would be the average. If only a single definite value for a given element is given, it would be captured in this field
element.definition: Used to capture quantitative values for a variety of elements. If only limits are given, the arithmetic mean would be the average. If only a single definite value for a given element is given, it would be captured in this field.

element.name: amountType
element.description: Most elements that require a quantitative value will also have a field called amount type. Amount type should always be specified because the actual value of the amount is often dependent on it. EXAMPLE: In capturing the actual relative amounts of substances or molecular fragments it is essential to indicate whether the amount refers to a mole ratio or weight ratio. For any given element an effort should be made to use same the amount type for all related definitional elements
element.definition: Most elements that require a quantitative value will also have a field called amount type. Amount type should always be specified because the actual value of the amount is often dependent on it. EXAMPLE: In capturing the actual relative amounts of substances or molecular fragments it is essential to indicate whether the amount refers to a mole ratio or weight ratio. For any given element an effort should be made to use same the amount type for all related definitional elements.

element.name: amountText
element.description: A textual comment on a numeric value
element.definition: A textual comment on a numeric value.

element.name: referenceRange
element.description: Reference range of possible or expected values
element.definition: Reference range of possible or expected values.

element.name: lowLimit
element.definition: Lower limit possible or expected.

element.name: highLimit
element.definition: Upper limit possible or expected.

element.name: sequenceType
element.description: The type of the sequence shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary
element.definition: The type of the sequence shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary.

element.name: numberOfSubunits
element.description: The number of linear sequences of nucleotides linked through phosphodiester bonds shall be described. Subunits would be strands of nucleic acids that are tightly associated typically through Watson-Crick base pairing. NOTE: If not specified in the reference source, the assumption is that there is 1 subunit
element.definition: The number of linear sequences of nucleotides linked through phosphodiester bonds shall be described. Subunits would be strands of nucleic acids that are tightly associated typically through Watson-Crick base pairing. NOTE: If not specified in the reference source, the assumption is that there is 1 subunit.

element.name: areaOfHybridisation
element.description: The area of hybridisation shall be described if applicable for double stranded RNA or DNA. The number associated with the subunit followed by the number associated to the residue shall be specified in increasing order. The underscore shall be used as separator as follows: Subunitnumber Residue
element.definition: The area of hybridisation shall be described if applicable for double stranded RNA or DNA. The number associated with the subunit followed by the number associated to the residue shall be specified in increasing order. The underscore shall be used as separator as follows: Subunitnumber Residue.

element.name: subunit
element.description: Subunits are listed in order of decreasing length; sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight; subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated multiple times
element.definition: Subunits are listed in order of decreasing length; sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight; subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated multiple times.

element.name: subunit
element.description: Index of linear sequences of nucleic acids in order of decreasing length. Sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight. Subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated and have sequential subscripts
element.definition: Index of linear sequences of nucleic acids in order of decreasing length. Sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight. Subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated and have sequential subscripts.

element.name: sequence
element.description: Actual nucleotide sequence notation from 5' to 3' end using standard single letter codes. In addition to the base sequence, sugar and type of phosphate or non-phosphate linkage should also be captured
element.definition: Actual nucleotide sequence notation from 5' to 3' end using standard single letter codes. In addition to the base sequence, sugar and type of phosphate or non-phosphate linkage should also be captured.

element.name: length
element.description: The length of the sequence shall be captured
element.definition: The length of the sequence shall be captured.

element.name: fivePrime
element.description: The nucleotide present at the 5 terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5 prime nucleotide is the letter at the first position in the sequence. A separate representation would be redundant
element.definition: The nucleotide present at the 5 terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5 prime nucleotide is the letter at the first position in the sequence. A separate representation would be redundant.

element.name: threePrime
element.description: The nucleotide present at the 3 terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5 prime nucleotide is the letter at the last position in the sequence. A separate representation would be redundant
element.definition: The nucleotide present at the 3 terminal shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. Since the sequence is represented from the 5' to the 3' end, the 5 prime nucleotide is the letter at the last position in the sequence. A separate representation would be redundant.

element.name: linkage
element.description: The linkages between sugar residues will also be captured
element.definition: The linkages between sugar residues will also be captured.

element.name: sugar
element.definition: 5.3.6.8.1 Sugar ID (Mandatory).

element.name: connectivity
element.description: The entity that links the sugar residues together should also be captured for nearly all naturally occurring nucleic acid the linkage is a phosphate group. For many synthetic oligonucleotides phosphorothioate linkages are often seen. Linkage connectivity is assumed to be 3-5. If the linkage is either 3-3 or 5-5 this should be specified
element.definition: The entity that links the sugar residues together should also be captured for nearly all naturally occurring nucleic acid the linkage is a phosphate group. For many synthetic oligonucleotides phosphorothioate linkages are often seen. Linkage connectivity is assumed to be 3-5. If the linkage is either 3-3 or 5-5 this should be specified.

element.name: identifier
element.description: Each linkage will be registered as a fragment and have an ID
element.definition: Each linkage will be registered as a fragment and have an ID.

element.name: name
element.description: Each linkage will be registered as a fragment and have at least one name. A single name shall be assigned to each linkage
element.definition: Each linkage will be registered as a fragment and have at least one name. A single name shall be assigned to each linkage.

element.name: residueSite
element.description: Residues shall be captured as described in 5.3.6.8.3
element.definition: Residues shall be captured as described in 5.3.6.8.3.

element.name: identifier
element.description: The Substance ID of the sugar or sugar-like component that make up the nucleotide
element.definition: The Substance ID of the sugar or sugar-like component that make up the nucleotide.

element.name: name
element.description: The name of the sugar or sugar-like component that make up the nucleotide
element.definition: The name of the sugar or sugar-like component that make up the nucleotide.

element.name: residueSite
element.description: The residues that contain a given sugar will be captured. The order of given residues will be captured in the 5-3direction consistent with the base sequences listed above
element.definition: The residues that contain a given sugar will be captured. The order of given residues will be captured in the 5-3direction consistent with the base sequences listed above.

element.name: sequenceType
element.description: The SubstanceProtein descriptive elements will only be used when a complete or partial amino acid sequence is available or derivable from a nucleic acid sequence
element.definition: The SubstanceProtein descriptive elements will only be used when a complete or partial amino acid sequence is available or derivable from a nucleic acid sequence.

element.name: numberOfSubunits
element.description: Number of linear sequences of amino acids linked through peptide bonds. The number of subunits constituting the SubstanceProtein shall be described. It is possible that the number of subunits can be variable
element.definition: Number of linear sequences of amino acids linked through peptide bonds. The number of subunits constituting the SubstanceProtein shall be described. It is possible that the number of subunits can be variable.

element.name: disulfideLinkage
element.description: The disulphide bond between two cysteine residues either on the same subunit or on two different subunits shall be described. The position of the disulfide bonds in the SubstanceProtein shall be listed in increasing order of subunit number and position within subunit followed by the abbreviation of the amino acids involved. The disulfide linkage positions shall actually contain the amino acid Cysteine at the respective positions
element.definition: The disulphide bond between two cysteine residues either on the same subunit or on two different subunits shall be described. The position of the disulfide bonds in the SubstanceProtein shall be listed in increasing order of subunit number and position within subunit followed by the abbreviation of the amino acids involved. The disulfide linkage positions shall actually contain the amino acid Cysteine at the respective positions.

element.name: subunit
element.description: This subclause refers to the description of each subunit constituting the SubstanceProtein. A subunit is a linear sequence of amino acids linked through peptide bonds. The Subunit information shall be provided when the finished SubstanceProtein is a complex of multiple sequences; subunits are not used to delineate domains within a single sequence. Subunits are listed in order of decreasing length; sequences of the same length will be ordered by decreasing molecular weight; subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated multiple times
element.definition: This subclause refers to the description of each subunit constituting the SubstanceProtein. A subunit is a linear sequence of amino acids linked through peptide bonds. The Subunit information shall be provided when the finished SubstanceProtein is a complex of multiple sequences; subunits are not used to delineate domains within a single sequence. Subunits are listed in order of decreasing length; sequences of the same length will be ordered by decreasing molecular weight; subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated multiple times.

element.name: subunit
element.description: Index of primary sequences of amino acids linked through peptide bonds in order of decreasing length. Sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight. Subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated and have sequential subscripts
element.definition: Index of primary sequences of amino acids linked through peptide bonds in order of decreasing length. Sequences of the same length will be ordered by molecular weight. Subunits that have identical sequences will be repeated and have sequential subscripts.

element.name: sequence
element.description: The sequence information shall be provided enumerating the amino acids from N- to C-terminal end using standard single-letter amino acid codes. Uppercase shall be used for L-amino acids and lowercase for D-amino acids. Transcribed SubstanceProteins will always be described using the translated sequence; for synthetic peptide containing amino acids that are not represented with a single letter code an X should be used within the sequence. The modified amino acids will be distinguished by their position in the sequence
element.definition: The sequence information shall be provided enumerating the amino acids from N- to C-terminal end using standard single-letter amino acid codes. Uppercase shall be used for L-amino acids and lowercase for D-amino acids. Transcribed SubstanceProteins will always be described using the translated sequence; for synthetic peptide containing amino acids that are not represented with a single letter code an X should be used within the sequence. The modified amino acids will be distinguished by their position in the sequence.

element.name: length
element.description: Length of linear sequences of amino acids contained in the subunit
element.definition: Length of linear sequences of amino acids contained in the subunit.

element.name: sequenceAttachment
element.description: The sequence information shall be provided enumerating the amino acids from N- to C-terminal end using standard single-letter amino acid codes. Uppercase shall be used for L-amino acids and lowercase for D-amino acids. Transcribed SubstanceProteins will always be described using the translated sequence; for synthetic peptide containing amino acids that are not represented with a single letter code an X should be used within the sequence. The modified amino acids will be distinguished by their position in the sequence
element.definition: The sequence information shall be provided enumerating the amino acids from N- to C-terminal end using standard single-letter amino acid codes. Uppercase shall be used for L-amino acids and lowercase for D-amino acids. Transcribed SubstanceProteins will always be described using the translated sequence; for synthetic peptide containing amino acids that are not represented with a single letter code an X should be used within the sequence. The modified amino acids will be distinguished by their position in the sequence.

element.name: nTerminalModificationId
element.description: Unique identifier for molecular fragment modification based on the ISO 11238 Substance ID
element.definition: Unique identifier for molecular fragment modification based on the ISO 11238 Substance ID.

element.name: nTerminalModification
element.description: The name of the fragment modified at the N-terminal of the SubstanceProtein shall be specified
element.definition: The name of the fragment modified at the N-terminal of the SubstanceProtein shall be specified.

element.name: cTerminalModificationId
element.description: Unique identifier for molecular fragment modification based on the ISO 11238 Substance ID
element.definition: Unique identifier for molecular fragment modification based on the ISO 11238 Substance ID.

element.name: cTerminalModification
element.description: The modification at the C-terminal shall be specified
element.definition: The modification at the C-terminal shall be specified.

element.name: sourceMaterialClass
element.description: General high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material
element.definition: General high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material.

element.name: sourceMaterialType
element.description: The type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent
element.definition: The type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent.

element.name: sourceMaterialState
element.description: The state of the source material when extracted
element.definition: The state of the source material when extracted.

element.name: organismId
element.description: The unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified
element.definition: The unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified.

element.name: organismName
element.description: The organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy
element.definition: The organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy.

element.name: parentSubstanceId
element.description: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant)
element.definition: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant).

element.name: parentSubstanceName
element.description: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation
element.definition: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation.

element.name: countryOfOrigin
element.description: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For Plasma-derived substances the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate
element.definition: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For Plasma-derived substances the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate.

element.name: geographicalLocation
element.description: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat
element.definition: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat.

element.name: developmentStage
element.description: Stage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum)
element.definition: Stage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum).

element.name: fractionDescription
element.description: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels
element.definition: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels.

element.name: organism
element.description: This subclause describes the organism which the substance is derived from. For vaccines, the parent organism shall be specified based on these subclause elements. As an example, full taxonomy will be described for the Substance Name: ., Leaf
element.definition: This subclause describes the organism which the substance is derived from. For vaccines, the parent organism shall be specified based on these subclause elements. As an example, full taxonomy will be described for the Substance Name: ., Leaf.

element.name: fraction

element.description: The specific type of the material constituting the component. For Herbal preparations the particulars of the extracts (liquid/dry) is described in Specified Substance Group 1
element.definition: The specific type of the material constituting the component. For Herbal preparations the particulars of the extracts (liquid/dry) is described in Specified Substance Group 1.

element.name: genus
element.description: The genus of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the genus element of the plant/animal scientific name; it is present in names for genera, species and infraspecies
element.definition: The genus of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the genus element of the plant/animal scientific name; it is present in names for genera, species and infraspecies.

element.name: species

element.definition: The species of an organism shall be specified; refers to the Latin epithet of the species of the plant/animal; it is present in names for species and infraspecies.

element.definition: The intraspecific description of an organism shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For Influenza Vaccine, the intraspecific description shall contain the syntax of the antigen in line with the WHO convention.

element.name: authorType
element.description: The type of author of an organism species shall be specified. The parenthetical author of an organism species refers to the first author who published the plant/animal name (of any rank). The primary author of an organism species refers to the first author(s), who validly published the plant/animal name
element.definition: The type of author of an organism species shall be specified. element.description: The author of an organism species shall be specified. The author year of an organism shall also be specified when applicable; refers to the year in which the first author(s) published the infraspecific plant/animal name (of any rank)
element.definition: The author of an organism species shall be specified. The author year of an organism shall also be specified when applicable; refers to the year in which the first author(s) published the infraspecific plant/animal name (of any rank).

element.name: identifier
element.definition: Identifier for the supply delivery event that is used to identify it across multiple disparate systems.
element.comment: This identifier is typically assigned by the dispenser, and may be used to reference the delivery when exchanging information about it with other systems.

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

element.name: partOf
element.definition: A larger event of which this particular event is a component or step.
element.comment: Not to be used to link an event to an Encounter - use Event.context for that. [The allowed reference resources may be adjusted as appropriate for the event resource].

element.name: status
element.definition: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.
element.comment: This element is labeled as a modifier because the status contains codes that mark the resource as not currently valid.

element.name: receiver

element.name: item

element.comment: Note that there's a difference between a prescription - an instruction to take a medication, along with a (sometimes) implicit supply, and an explicit request to supply, with no explicit instructions.

element.name: reasonReference
element.description: The reason why the supply item was requested
element.definition: The reason why the supply item was requested.

element.name: deliverFrom
element.definition: Where the supply is expected to come from.

element.name: deliverTo
element.definition: Where the supply is destined to go.

element.name: code
element.definition: A code or string that identifies the device detail being asserted.

binding.name: ParameterCode
binding.description: A code that identifies the device detail.

element.name: value
element.definition: The value of the device detail.
element.comment: Range means device should have a value that falls somewhere within the specified range.

element.name: identifier
element.definition: The business identifier for this task.

element.name: instantiatesCanonical
element.definition: The URL pointing to a *FHIR*-defined protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Task.

element.name: instantiatesUri
element.definition: The URL pointing to an *externally* maintained protocol, guideline, orderset or other definition that is adhered to in whole or in part by this Task.

element.name: basedOn
element.definition: BasedOn refers to a higher-level authorization that triggered the creation of the task. It references a "request" resource such as a ServiceRequest, MedicationRequest, ServiceRequest, CarePlan, etc. which is distinct from the "request" resource the task is seeking to fulfill. This latter resource is referenced by FocusOn. For example, based on a ServiceRequest (= BasedOn), a task is created to fulfill a procedureRequest ( = FocusOn ) to collect a specimen from a patient.

element.name: groupIdentifier
element.definition: An identifier that links together multiple tasks and other requests that were created in the same context.

element.name: partOf
element.definition: Task that this particular task is part of.
element.comment: This should usually be 0..1.

element.name: status
element.definition: The current status of the task.

binding.name: TaskStatus
binding.description: The current status of the task.

element.name: statusReason
element.definition: An explanation as to why this task is held, failed, was refused, etc.
element.comment: This applies to the current status. Look at the history of the task to see reasons for past statuses.

binding.name: TaskStatusReason
binding.description: Codes to identify the reason for current status. These will typically be specific to a particular workflow.

element.name: businessStatus
element.definition: Contains business-specific nuances of the business state.

binding.name: TaskBusinessStatus
binding.description: The domain-specific business-contextual sub-state of the task. For example: "Blood drawn", "IV inserted", "Awaiting physician signature", etc.

element.name: intent
element.description: unknown | proposal | plan | order | original-order | reflex-order | filler-order | instance-order | option
element.definition: Indicates the "level" of actionability associated with the Task, i.e. i+R[9]Cs this a proposed task, a planned task, an actionable task, etc.
element.comment:
This element is immutable. Proposed tasks, planned tasks, etc. must be distinct instances.
In most cases, Tasks will have an intent of "order".

binding.name: TaskIntent
binding.description: Distinguishes whether the task is a proposal, plan or full order.

element.name: priority
element.definition: Indicates how quickly the Task should be addressed with respect to other requests.

binding.name: TaskPriority
binding.description: The task's priority.

element.name: code
element.definition: A name or code (or both) briefly describing what the task involves.
element.comment: The title (eg "My Tasks", "Outstanding Tasks for Patient X") should go into the code.

binding.name: TaskCode
binding.description: Codes to identify what the task involves. These will typically be specific to a particular workflow.

element.name: description
element.definition: A free-text description of what is to be performed.

element.name: focus
element.definition: The request being actioned or the resource being manipulated by this task.
element.comment: If multiple resources need to be manipulated, use sub-tasks. (This ensures that status can be tracked independently for each referenced resource.).

element.name: for
element.definition: The entity who benefits from the performance of the service specified in the task (e.g., the patient).

element.name: encounter
element.description: Healthcare event during which this task originated
element.definition: The healthcare event (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this task was created.

element.name: executionPeriod
element.description: Start and end time of execution
element.definition: Identifies the time action was first taken against the task (start) and/or the time final action was taken against the task prior to marking it as completed (end).

element.name: authoredOn
element.definition: The date and time this task was created.

element.name: lastModified
element.definition: The date and time of last modification to this task.

element.name: requester
element.description: Who is asking for task to be done
element.definition: The creator of the task.

element.name: performerType
element.definition: The kind of participant that should perform the task.

binding.name: TaskPerformerType
binding.description: The type(s) of task performers allowed.

element.name: owner
element.definition: Individual organization or Device currently responsible for task execution.
element.comment: Tasks may be created with an owner not yet identified.

element.name: location
element.definition: Principal physical location where the this task is performed.

element.name: reasonCode
element.definition: A description or code indicating why this task needs to be performed.
element.comment: This should only be included if there is no focus or if it differs from the reason indicated on the focus.

binding.name: TaskReason
binding.description: Indicates why the task is needed. E.g. Suspended because patient admitted to hospital.

element.name: reasonReference
element.definition: A resource reference indicating why this task needs to be performed.
element.comment: Tasks might be justified based on an Observation, a Condition, a past or planned procedure, etc. This should only be included if there is no focus or if it differs from the reason indicated on the focus. Use the CodeableConcept text element in `Task.reasonCode` if the data is free (uncoded) text.

element.name: insurance
element.definition: Insurance plans, coverage extensions, pre-authorizations and/or pre-determinations that may be relevant to the Task.

element.name: note
element.definition: Free-text information captured about the task as it progresses.

element.name: relevantHistory
element.description: Key events in history of the Task
element.definition: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this Task that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the task.
element.comment: This element does not point to the Provenance associated with the *current* version of the resource - as it would be created after this version existed. The Provenance for the current version can be retrieved with a _revinclude.

element.name: restriction
element.definition: If the Task.focus is a request resource and the task is seeking fulfillment (i.e. is asking for the request to be actioned), this element identifies any limitations on what parts of the referenced request should be actioned.

element.name: input
element.definition: Additional information that may be needed in the execution of the task.

element.name: output
element.description: Information produced as part of task
element.definition: Outputs produced by the Task.

element.name: type
element.definition: A code or description indicating how the input is intended to be used as part of the task execution.
element.comment: If referencing a BPMN workflow or Protocol, the "system" is the URL for the workflow definition and the code is the "name" of the required input.

binding.name: TaskInputParameterType
binding.description: Codes to identify types of input parameters. These will typically be specific to a particular workflow. E.g. "Comparison source", "Applicable consent", "Concomitent Medications", etc.

element.name: value
element.description: Content to use in performing the task
element.definition: The value of the input parameter as a basic type.

element.name: type
element.definition: The name of the Output parameter.

binding.name: TaskOutputParameterType
binding.description: Codes to identify types of input parameters. These will typically be specific to a particular workflow. E.g. "Identified issues", "Preliminary results", "Filler order", "Final results", etc.

element.name: value
element.definition: The value of the Output parameter as a basic type.

element.name: repetitions
element.definition: Indicates the number of times the requested action should occur.

element.name: period
element.definition: Over what time-period is fulfillment sought.
element.comment: Note that period.high is the due date representing the time by which the task should be completed.

element.name: recipient
element.definition: For requests that are targeted to more than on potential recipient/target, for whom is fulfillment sought?

element.name: url
element.description: Canonical identifier for this terminology capabilities, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this terminology capabilities when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this terminology capabilities is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the terminology capabilities is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred. Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.
The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author. Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.

element.name: version
element.description: Business version of the terminology capabilities
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the terminology capabilities when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance.
